title: Use verbs in Add Filter Comment for API tools instead of OK
desc: Created attachment 278925 [details] Screenshot  See screenshot.

title: PDE API Analysis Application does not recognize output from tycho-dependency-tools-plugin
desc: The content of dependencies-list.txt totally ignored by API Analysis Application (probably on Windows only) as it contains absolute paths like ``` C:\work\ef\passage-master\git\passage\bundles\org.eclipse.passage.lic.api\target\org.eclipse.passage.lic.api-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar ``` while parsing splits each line with ":" separator and any of segments will never be recognized as existing file (and bundle)

title: ee.osgiminimum 1.2 is missing X500Principal
desc: Cloned for possible 4.2.1 inclusion.  +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #383448 +++  I have org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ee.osgiminimum12_1.0.200.v20120530-1420 installed and it seems to be missing the following as defined by the OSGi min 1.2 execution environment.  javax/security/auth/x500/X500Principal.class

title: Allow 'include' lists to be used for our Ant tasks
desc: Currently our Ant tasks have the ability to exclude specific bundles using a given exclude list. The exclude list works fine, and supports RegEx, but in some scenarios it would be much easier (and far more manageable) to just say what bundles we want to include.  For example in the use task it would be easier to say that we want to include *.wtp.* instead of having to maintain a list of all platform, etc (dependent) bundles that we do not want scanned.

title: Processing API deltas is not cancelable
desc: If you use a workspace configured with a Juno baseline to maintain pre-Juno code the API baseline validation takes forever and it cannot be canceled. Even exiting Eclipse is insufficient. You have to kill Eclipse the hard way.  Critical, since builder cancelation is mandatory until EGIT has been as well-tuned as CVS to optimize redundant builds.

title: org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui has smaller bundle version than in 3.6.2+J7
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #392412 +++  org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui has smaller bundle version than in 3.6.2+J7:  3.6.2		1.0.201.v20100820_r361 3.6.2+J7	1.0.351.v20111011_r362Java7 3.7.2		1.0.301.v20110803_r371 3.8		1.0.400.v20120523-2012  The version in 3.7 maintenance was updated to 370 in bug 392412.  However products build on top of 3.6.2J7 will be unable to install on existing Eclipse installs with the old version.

title: Remove BREE from non-Java bundles
desc: PDe has multiple of them see https://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/I20190610-1800/buildlogs/reporeports/reports/breedata.txt

title: use pomless builds where possible

Is there a replacement for properties (e.g. org.eclipse.pde.api.tools)?    <properties>     <defaultSigning-excludeInnerJars>true</defaultSigning-excludeInnerJars>   </properties>

title: Remove BREE from non-Java bundles

Is there a replacement for properties (e.g. org.eclipse.pde.api.tools)?    <properties>     <defaultSigning-excludeInnerJars>true</defaultSigning-excludeInnerJars>   </properties>

title: Add test for filtered use scan ant task
desc: org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.anttasks.tests.ApiToolingApiuseAntTaskTests  We have a few tests for the use scan ant task already.  We should add another test that uses problem filters.

title: Missing include/exclude file should cause task to fail
desc: 1) Create an ant file that runs the analysis task 2) Use the include or exclude attribute to point somewhere that doesn't exist 3) Run the task Result Task runs successfully Debug output lists 0 include/exclude matches  If I specify an include file that doesn't exist, the ant task should fail with explanation.

title: Support usage scanning tools in IDE
desc: The 3.6 API tools have support for usage scanning - allowing adopters to provide scans back to you on what API and internal code they're using. As far as I can tell, these tools are currently command-line and there is no support for using the reports within the IDE.  I'm opening this enhancement to request IDE support - being able to point to a number of scans, have it show you which classes and methods are being used, and the ability to flag errors when usage is broken (i.e. when you don't want to break adopters within a service release, no matter how much internal code they used).

title: Analysis task doesn't report bundles with resolver errors
desc: 1) Set up an API analysis task 2) Delete one or more bundles that are required by a bundle being analyzed 3) Run the task Result: The report states there are no problems in the bundle being analyzed.  If there are problems resolving the bundle in the profile/baseline, they should be reported.  Certainly we shouldn't state that there are no problems when we don't know what problems exist.

title: API error on org.eclipse.osgi project
desc: With the latest SDK build I see following PDE error reported on org.eclipse.osgi project:  The minor version should be incremented in version 3.16.200, since execution environments have been   changed since version 3.16.100

title: Api File Generation task quits early if method cannot be resolved
desc: Create an API type with several methods that have noreference restrictions.  Run the api file generation task with the proper binary location, then again without it.  Not only are the types not resolved (expected), but not all methods are included (bug).  Project Binary: <type name="Activator" restrictions="0"> <field name="context" restrictions="8"/> <method name="getContext" restrictions="8" signature="()Lorg/osgi/framework/BundleContext;"/> <method name="start" restrictions="8" signature="(Lorg/osgi/framework/BundleContext;)V"/> <method name="stop" restrictions="8" signature="(Lorg/osgi/framework/BundleContext;)V"/> </type>  No binary: <type name="Activator" restrictions="0"> <field name="context" restrictions="8"/> <method name="getContext" restrictions="8" signature="()QBundleContext;"/></type>  This happens because the visitor checks if an exception has been encountered and if so, fails to visit the methods.  The visitor should continue with the exceptions and instead store all the problems in the multi status.

title: Use Scan builder may throw NPE
desc: Use Scan builder may throw NPE when  1. there are two (open) projects present on workspace with same ID such that one is normal plug-in while other a binary 2. APIBaselineManager confuses one with other and creates BundleComponent instead of ProjectComponent

title: Add Use Scan builder tests to nightly build
desc: Tests were checked in as part of fix for Bug #310547. Add them to nightly build.

title: API Use Scan builder throws NPE for a missing Inner Type problem
desc: The API Use Scan builder throws NPE when an inner type (class inside class) which is referenced from the use scan goes missing.

title: ApiMigrationTask is declared twice
desc: My eyes tricking me or its actually there twice?  /org.eclipse.pde.api.tools/plugin.xml  ...     <antTask           class="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.tasks.ApiMigrationTask"           library="lib/apitooling-ant.jar"           name="apitooling.apimigration">     </antTask>     <antTask           class="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.tasks.ApiMigrationTask"           library="lib/apitooling-ant.jar"           name="apitooling.apimigration">     </antTask> ...

title: API error on org.eclipse.osgi project
desc: With the latest SDK build I see following PDE error reported on org.eclipse.osgi project:  The minor version should be incremented in version 3.16.200, since execution environments have been   changed since version 3.16.100

title: Flag tags as invalid if parent type is private or package default
desc: From Bug 402393  I found an issue with our invalid tag scanner, it appears it does not thoroughly check the visibility of the a member. Consider the following example:  public class PublicStaticInner {   static class Inner {     /**      * @noinstantiate This class is not intended to be instantiated by clients.      * @noextend This class is not intended to be subclassed by clients.      */     public static class OpenInner {       /** 	* @noreference This method is not intended to be referenced by clients. 	*/ 	public static void one() { 	  System.out.println("one"); 	}     }   } }  Those tags are not flagged as invalid when they should be.

title: [1.7] Add Java 7 support for API Tools
desc: 3.7.  For 3.7.1 we need to add Java 7 support to API Tools - make sure our TypeBuilder is working correctly and that we correctly create ASTs + handle the new ASTNode kinds.  We also need to create the EE fragment for system library reference checks (for the builder).  This should be done by end of June, so that we have enough time for team wide testing and fixing in July.

title: Tags should be invalid on package default interfaces
desc: In a number of the valid tag tests we create inner interfaces with the package default restriction.  The tag validator currently accepts tags on them that would be valid for public interfaces.  This is incorrect because of Bug 402393.

title: Remove workaround code in BaseApiAnalyzer
desc: Cloned so that when JDT fixes the issue with their method we can remove our workaround code.  +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #405015 +++  4.3.0 I20130326-0800  Build the example below and notice you will get two problem markers for the invalid @noreference tag  package x.y.z;  public interface test13 { }  /**  * @noreference  */ interface test13outer {}  could be related to the fix for bug 404744 or bug 404830

title: Remove support for pre-OSGi 2.0 plug-ins from API Tools
desc: We just added limited support for pre-OSGi bundles (Bug 405211).  In Luna, the conversion service will no longer be supported and may be removed entirely (Bug 407312).

title: API Deprecation log: Bad rendering of types and state
desc: http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/I20130605-2000/apitools/deprecation/apideprecation.html says:  org.junit(4.11.0) ADDED	junit.framework.Assert.junit.framework.Assert ADDED	org.junit.matchers.JUnitMatchers#Matcher<String> containsString(String) ... REMOVED	org.junit.rules.MethodRule.org.junit.rules.MethodRule REMOVED	org.junit.runners.BlockJUnit4ClassRunner#List<MethodRule> rules(Object)  - junit.framework.Assert has indeed been deprecated and org.junit.rules.MethodRule has been un-deprecated, but the table wrongly repeats the fully-qualified names (joined with '.').  - The ADDED and REMOVED keywords in the first column are confusing. They should be DEPRECATED and UN-DEPRECATED.

title: Execution Environments not available from http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.3
desc: http://wiki.eclipse.org/Execution_Environments#Installing_Execution_Environment_Descriptions describes the execution environments.   I tried to install them from http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.3 but they only seem available from http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.2.  My assumption is that they should also be available in Kepler.

title: Unanticipated comparator errors in I20131119-0800
desc: This has actually been showing up for weeks (nothing specific to I20131119-0800)  Related to "license" in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ee.feature  http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/I20131119-0800/buildlogs/comparatorlogs/buildtimeComparatorUnanticipated.log.txt  At first I thought we might have to ignore these errors related to moving to the "common CBI license" ... but it seems in recent weeks, this is the only plugin that shows up ... maybe its the only that changed at some critical point in time before CBI license was "finalized"?   The "difference" doesn't really hurt anything (its just "line endings" type changes) but would be easier to "touch" the bundle, than to write special code to ignore it.

title: [1.8] Support lambda expressions
desc: We need to support checking lambda expression for illegal use, and that they don't cause the remainder of the tooling to blow up (see bug 427493).

title: [1.8] Port BETA_JAVA8 fixes to Luna
desc: A significant amount of development went into PDE / API Tools during the early months of 4.4.  This will cause conflicts when applying Java 8 support to master for the Luna release.  All fixes that go into the BETA_JAVA8 branch should be ported. This bug is to track any issues that come up.

title: Allow API baseline to be specified via a target definition
desc: I have my target platform set up as a target definition that references a p2 repository. Similarly, I have a target definition that references a p2 repository for the previous version/release of the target platform. It would be nice to be able to set up my baseline by pointing to a target definition (currently the user is limited to point to an install location only).  Better yet, it would be nice to be able to optionally associate an API baseline (target definition) with each target definition. That way, whenever the user switches targets, the API is also kept in synch.

title: Could not locate method ... error logged
desc: With 3.7M4 with API tools enabled, I've seen this error logged (no associated backtrace).  Not sure what it means or whether the user is supposed to resolve it?  Could not locate method MIVariableObject(Lorg/eclipse/cdt/dsf/mi/service/MIVariableManager;Lorg/eclipse/cdt/dsf/mi/service/MIVariableManager$VariableObjectId;Lorg/eclipse/cdt/dsf/mi/service/MIVariableManager$MIVariableObject;Z)V An exception stack trace is not available.

title: [1.8] Check minimum version requirements of jdt
desc: As API Tools uses new API for Java 8 support from JDT Core (and possibly JDT UI?), we should update the minimum version requirement in our manifests to reflect this.

title: [apitools] Add New API Baseline wizard opened with wrong parent shell
desc: Build Id: 4.5.0.I20150506-2000  Found another location in ApiBaselinePreferencePage wrongly using ApiUIPlugin#getShell() to set the parent shell for a dialog.  1. Window > Preferences > Plug-in Development > API Baselines 2. Click on Add Baseline 3. Hit escape  Focus does not go back to the Preferences dialog.  Only seen on Windows; OS X seems to do the right thing.

title: API Tools Use Scans of jarred bundles throw cryptic IOException with bad bundle-classpath entry
desc: When we create a BundleComponent we need to add the content from the bundle's Bundle-Classpath manifest entry.  In Eclipse this is typically a few jars inside a lib folder which works correctly.  However, when the bundle itself is jarred and there are folder entries on the bundle classpath, the scan fails with an IOException 'tmp/lib/ is a directory'.  org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.BundleComponent.createApiTypeContainer(String) The code here used to extract a folder from inside a jarred bundle is described as a hack to get around a known Java issue.  We should create a test case for this and fix the code.

title: Feature description for API Tools EE Descriptions does not mention JavaSE-1.8
desc: Mentions "the rest" ... but, assume 1.8 should be added?   This feature provides API Tools Execution Environment Descriptions for the following environments: JRE-1.1, J2SE-1.2, J2SE-1.3, J2SE-1.4, J2SE-1.5, JavaSE-1.6, JavaSE-1.7, CDC-1.0/Foundation-1.0, CDC-1.1/Foundation-1.1,  OSGi/Minimum-1.0, OSGi/Minimum-1.1, OSGi/Minimum-1.2

title: .options file not included in the binary build
desc: o.e.pde.api.tools has a .options file but it is not included in the binary build (See /org.eclipse.pde.api.tools/build.properties) As a result it is not easy to know if some debug options for the plug-in are available or not.  I hope this can be fixed for 3.7 since the .options file already exists, it only has to be included in the build, and most importantly it is only available as a sample/doc to the user.

title: API Tools quick fix changes all line delimiters in .api_filters
desc: I20111018-0850  The API Tools quick fix to remove an unused API problem filter changes all line delimiters in .api_filters to the platform default delimiter (Windows, in my case).  Operations on existing files must always use the existing delimiter format. For new files, the Platform.PREF_LINE_SEPARATOR preference must be used (but the quick fix doesn't even respect that option, which is set to \n in my case).

title: Remove whitespace from PDE API tools test plug-in
Unused API filter markers does not appear in MANIFEST.MF
desc: 4.3 M5a.  Unused API filter markers does not appear in MANIFEST.MF.

This string must be externalized for it to be translated.  Thanks!

Remove trailing white spaces in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui

title: Remove (non-Javadoc) statements from eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui
Remove trailing white spaces in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui
Reduce "Missing execution environment" workspace default to warning
desc: Having errors by default in PDE/API Errors/Warnings/API Use "Missing execution environment descriptions" is too strict and a real burden for people getting familiar with codebase or simply trying to create small patch. Reducing it to warning will still make it obvious but allow easily to continue working.  Based on thoughts on bug 497551.

title: Add "Execution Environment Descriptions" to API Errors/Warnings perference page as search term
desc: Kills me that I never be able to find this, without spending a lot of time on the search.

Use StringBuilder instead of StringBuffer in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools

desc: Having errors by default in PDE/API Errors/Warnings/API Use "Missing execution environment descriptions" is too strict and a real burden for people getting familiar with codebase or simply trying to create small patch. Reducing it to warning will still make it obvious but allow easily to continue working.  Based on thoughts on bug 497551.

title: Update API Tools icons to png files instead of Gifs
desc: Created attachment 277099 [details] Screenshot  Looks to me that API tools in PDE are still using Gifs. I suggest to replace them by png files.

title: Use enhanced for loops in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui
[patch][performance] All project API descriptions get saved for every project close
desc: Using Eclipse 4.4-I20140408-1645.  The method ApiDescriptionManager.saving saves all modified project API descriptions even for a save context with the kind ISaveContext.PROJECT_SAVE. To illustrate this problem, one can follow those steps:  1. Import a large number of projects with API tooling enabled. For example, all projects from git://git.eclipse.org/gitroot/cdt/org.eclipse.cdt.git 2. Make sure all the projects are in a "modified" state by doing a "Clean all projects" and waiting for the build to complete 3. Insert a breakpoint on the line Util.saveFile in ApiDescriptionManager.saving or add a print statement. 4. Select all the project and close them.  Result: For every project that gets closed, all project API descriptions get saved. Instead, I think only the project API description for the project in the ISaveContext should be saved when the saving is of kind ISaveContext.PROJECT_SAVE.  Here are the results before and after the change for the scenario described above: time before handling PROJECT_SAVE: 37173 ms time after: 29682 ms  By extension, if a General Project (non-java, no API tooling) in the same workspace gets closed, a measurable difference can also be seen: time before handling PROJECT_SAVE: 120 ms time after: 33 ms  The times are measured be comparing the time after and before the WorkspaceJob in WorkspaceAction.

title: Use StringBuilder instead of StringBuffer in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools
[Theme] Adopt the new menu/command framework
desc: In PDE UI, we're going to adopt the new menu/command story for everything. API Tools should aim to do the same. The Platform projects are always looked at as being exemplary examples on how things should be done.

title: Many API tools EE description error false positives
desc: code from HEAD  After checking out the HTML editor code to play around with adding JS breakpoints to the HTML editor, I noticed that there are 42 API tools errors on the the projects and one fatal error.  Fatal: Group_label_Insertion cannot be resolved or is not a field	HTMLContentAssistPreferencePage.java	/org.eclipse.wst.html.ui/src/org/eclipse/wst/html/ui/internal/preferences/ui	line 75	Java Problem  The bulk of the API tools errors are about using code that is not found in the project-specified EE. These are quite serious problems and should be fixed for M5

title: The org.w3c.ranges package is not showing up in the J2SE-1.4 EE description
desc: Version: 4.2.0 Build id: I20120222-2200  Steps:  1. install / update to the latest EE descriptions 2. get project org.eclipse.wst.html.core from HEAD (CVS) - clean build 3. notice two API tools errors:  Description	Resource	Path	Location	Type The type Range referenced in org.eclipse.wst.html.core.internal.modelquery.DocumentQuery.getHeadCorrespondentRange(Document) is not defined in the bundle's required execution environment: J2SE-1.4	DocumentQuery.java	/org.eclipse.wst.html.core/src/org/eclipse/wst/html/core/internal/modelquery	line 75	API Usage Problem  The org.w3c.ranges package is in the whitelist, and when I tried to re-generate the EE descriptions (in case something went wrong before) I still do not get the org.w3c.ranges package generated.

title: Support dynamic tracing
desc: Version: 4.2.0 Build id: I20120223-2200  The title says it all...

title: Baseline not bound to execution environment
desc: I20120608-1200 (3.8) + other plug-ins  When I try to add an API Baseline or reset an existing one, I get an error message "Baseline not bound to execution environment" and the Finish button is disabled.  I don't understand this message, and I don't think I should. I just want to set an API Baseline. If that doesn't work for some of the plug-in in the selected install, then just skip them but let me continue.

title: [1.8] Update to ASM 5.x
desc: It's a good practice to stay up to date with new libraries.

title: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when running a scan
desc: A third-party jar in one of our bundles contains code like the following  public void someMethod(String className, String displayName) {    ...    if (displayName == null)       displayName = "[unknown?]";    Class c = Class.forName(className);    ... }  The API Tools ReferenceExtractor class assumes that the most-recently loaded static string before a call to Class.forName() is the name of the class to be loaded, so the string "[unknown?]" eventually gets passed to ASM. ASM then throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException:  java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 10 	at org.objectweb.asm.Type.a(Unknown Source) 	at org.objectweb.asm.Type.getElementType(Unknown Source) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ReferenceExtractor.resolveType(ReferenceExtractor.java:1107) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ReferenceExtractor.addTypeReference(ReferenceExtractor.java:999) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ReferenceExtractor$ClassFileMethodVisitor.visitMethodInsn(ReferenceExtractor.java:372) 	at org.objectweb.asm.ClassReader.accept(Unknown Source) 	at org.objectweb.asm.ClassReader.accept(Unknown Source) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.ApiType.extractReferences(ApiType.java:161) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.search.ApiSearchEngine.getResolvedReferences(ApiSearchEngine.java:154) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.search.ApiSearchEngine$ReferenceExtractor.visit(ApiSearchEngine.java:99) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.ArchiveApiTypeContainer.accept(ArchiveApiTypeContainer.java:204) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.AbstractApiTypeContainer.accept(AbstractApiTypeContainer.java:56) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.Component.accept(Component.java:62) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.search.ApiSearchEngine.searchReferences(ApiSearchEngine.java:232) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.search.ApiSearchEngine.search(ApiSearchEngine.java:298) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui.internal.use.ApiUseScanJob.run(ApiUseScanJob.java:163) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:53)

title: TagScanner and markers treat package default members as API
desc: In an API type or interface, add a method or field with a package default scope.  The javadoc quickfixes will allow you to add a @noreference restriction.  The TagScanner will inspect the tags and they will be added to the .api_description file.  This isn't correct as a package default level API could only be accessed by another API class in the same package.  Since the restrictions are intended for clients, not for the bundle's internal use, there is not value in allowing the restrictions.

title: Use problem on anonymous type in incorrect location
desc: While working on the API for e4 there is a problem like the following:  org.eclipse.e4.ui.internal.workbench.Activator illegally implements LogService  in the above example the illegal implements is on an anonymous type but the error marker is on the root type, causing confusion when you otry to figure out what is going on.  We should try to place the error marker on the class instance creation, failing that at least have a different message like: Actvator illegally implements LogService in an anonymous type

title: Quickfix for removing unused version filter does not work on MANIFEST file
desc: Version: 4.3.0 Build id: I20130319-1000  If you activate the quick fix for an unused filter problem marker on the MANIFEST.MF file it will not include the option to remove the unused filter, only to open the property page.  The problem is in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui.internal.markers.ApiMarkerResolutionGenerator.computeProblemHashcode(String) where we end up adding the hashcode of "null" to the problem hashcode. In ApiProblem we compute the hashcode using 0 when the backing typename is null.

title: Avoid dumping tag scanner problems to the error log when the user has no ability to fix them
desc: If we are unable to resolve a member we get exceptions in the log such as the following:  Error Fri Apr 19 14:51:48 CDT 2013 Problems encountered while scanning tags Error Fri Apr 19 14:51:48 CDT 2013 Unable to resolve method signature: org.eclipse.ui.XMLMemento#void error(SAXParseException) Error Fri Apr 19 14:51:48 CDT 2013 Unable to resolve method signature: org.eclipse.ui.XMLMemento#void warning(SAXParseException)  The errors provide no useful information, no fixes and no indication what the use can do to fix it (clean and build).  If they occur because of a conflicting file change (I was doing a git reset), any new built class files will cause the API builder to run again anyways.  Options: 1) Reduce the message severity to warning 2) Only log them if tracing is turned on 3) Provide a more descriptive message.

title: Consistently handle implicitly public members
desc: We are currently inconsistent in what tags we support when a member is marked as package default but is implicitly public due to its parent type.  See Bug 409352 - interface methods See Bug 402393 comment 14 - interface fields (implicitly static final)  We should go through all of the following cases and check that we treat them as public members.  interface I {     int pub();     int PUB = 1, PUB2 = 2;  // implicitly static and final     class PUB {} // implicitly static } @interface Annot {     int pub();     int PUB = 1;     class PUB {} } enum En {     PUB;     void packAccess() {} }

title: NPE in BaseApiAnalyzer.processType
desc: N20130819-2000.  Found this in the .log.   !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 2 2013-08-21 12:23:21.441 !MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.resources". !STACK 0 java.lang.NullPointerException 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BaseApiAnalyzer.processType(BaseApiAnalyzer.java:1156) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BaseApiAnalyzer.checkTagValidation(BaseApiAnalyzer.java:1079) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BaseApiAnalyzer.analyzeComponent(BaseApiAnalyzer.java:276) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.IncrementalApiBuilder.build(IncrementalApiBuilder.java:273) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.IncrementalApiBuilder.build(IncrementalApiBuilder.java:231) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.build(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:389) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:733) 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:42) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:206) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:246) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$1.run(BuildManager.java:299) 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:42) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:302) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuildLoop(BuildManager.java:358) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.build(BuildManager.java:381) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.doBuild(AutoBuildJob.java:143) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.run(AutoBuildJob.java:241) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:53)

title: Remove W3 validator icons from generated HTML reports
desc:
HTML files generated by the APITools contains a W3 validator icon:

This has some problems: - It is included via HTTP. So opening one of those generated HTML files over HTTPS includes insecure resources. The browser may chose to not display it at all, leaving only an ugly placeholder icon with alt text. - Including an external resource for a self-contained generated report is unnecessary. - This validator badge is quite useless: It is hard-coded so there is no guarantee that claim is even true, it doesn't link to a re-validation on w3.org, ... I propose to simply remove the badge.

title: Properly place problem markers for restricted annotations (was: Investigate supporting the @noreference tag on annotation fields and methods)
desc: Currently we do not support the @noreference tag on annotation fields or methods. Off the top of my head I don't recall why for methods, but for the field it is probably because the are similar to interface fields and e cannot detect references to them even if we wanted to (see bug 230277).  I'll run some tests to see if we can extract references to annotation methods.

title: Investigate supporting annotations for API Tools
desc: With more and more projects moving to 1.5+ source levels we could add support in API tools for annotations in addition to the Javadoc tags.  For example we could have annotations like:  @ApiRestriction("noextend, noimplement")  or  @NoExtend and @NoImplement  This should be fairly easy to hook up since the back end that updates the API description is separate from the tools that scan for tags (or annotations if we supported them).

title: Unjustified @since tag error during incremental build
desc: Version: 4.4.0 Build id: I20130918-2000  prior to applying the patch for bug 411773, I formatted the class AntCorePreferences and after an incremental build I get the following error:  Description	Resource	Path	Location	Type Invalid @since 2.1 tag on org.eclipse.ant.core.AntCorePreferences; expecting @since 3.3	AntCorePreferences.java	/org.eclipse.ant.core/src/org/eclipse/ant/core	line 76	@since tag problem   If I clean the project the error goes away. I reproduced on Mac and Win 7.

title: Do not offer to convert Javadoc to annotations on < 1.5 projects
desc: Version: 4.4.0 Build id: I20131027-2130  In the plug-in tools menu the option to convert Javadoc tags to annotations will appear for projects that are not 1.5+ source level. < 1.5 projects also appear in the wizard (and should not).  Steps: 1. have a 1.4 plugin project in your workspace 2. start the wizard -> it should not appear in the listing

title: [10] Switch ASTs to JLS10
desc: I've stumbled over some places in code where we still refer to JLS4 or 8. I believe we should use JLS10.  Patch follows.

title: Running the convert Javadoc wizard seems to hang while computing changes
desc: Version: 4.4.0 Build id: I20131027-2130 Mac OSX Mavericks  Steps: 1. start the conversion wizard on a few projects (I used all of platform and JDT Debug) 2. Hit 'Next' after selecting the projects to convert 3. notice it seems to hang while computing changes (not good)  I'm guessing the progress is just not being updated as it will finish computing the changes and allow the conversion to complete normally.

title: [1.8] apitooling-ant.jar will not build using 1.8 JRE / JDK
desc: Compiling against 1.8 to create the support jar yields piles of earnings like:   1. ERROR in /Users/mrennie/git/eclipse.pde.ui/apitools/org.eclipse.pde.api.tools/src_ant/org/eclipse/pde/api/tools/internal/tasks/APIDeprecationReportConversionTask.java (at line 240)        [javac] 	Collections.sort(allEntries, new Comparator() {        [javac] 	                                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^        [javac] The type new Comparator(){} must implement the inherited abstract method Comparator.thenComparing(Function, Comparator)  This comes from all the fancy new breaking changes in the functional interfaces in JDK 8.  The solution is to set the EE in the builder to be 1.4 (to match the BREE) rather than allow the workspace default JRE to be used when building the support jar.  I'll tag this as blocking Java 8, but the change should be applied to master as well to prevent the support jar from being built with a different level of bytecodes than its project.

title: API tools should not mute exceptions
desc: Follow up on bug 532282. I can't see any errors in the log, but on one workspace I see 300 API errors reported on SWT, and in another workspace zero errors.   There *must* be some exceptions in the API scan on the "bad" workspace, so I plan to unmcover "muted" exceptions to find the root cause. We have lot of muted exceptions in PDE.

title: [1.8] Support JLS8 and the new AST nodes
desc: Summary says it all, we need to replace the use of the old JLS4 tag with JLS8 and update out code to handle the new AST nodes.

title: [1.8] Generate the 1.8 EE description fragment
desc: Title says it all - we need to generate the 1.8 EE description fragment

title: PDE feature needs to be "touched" (for I-build)
desc: In bug 430748 we updated objectweb.asm (so it was not marked as a singleton).   I've tried a test run with that change (and others) and the build fails because the pde.feature itself did not change, it's older version get's "swapped in" and therefore points to a version of objectweb.asm that no longer exists in current orbit repository (that is, qualifier of objectweb.asm changed).   While not technically required until Tuesday, for I-build ... improves my "test builds" if it was fixed as soon as possible.   Thanks,

title: Stop dumping not useful output during test runs
desc: Currently when you run the non-plugin API tools tests you get piles of output about searching and pattern matching, but none of it is useful. We should stop printing it all out.

title: [1.8] Properly extract invokedynamic instructions
desc: We need to implement the new API to properly extract invokedynamic instructions

title: [1.8] Annotation validator reports @NoOverride not allowed on default methods
desc: import org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.annotations.NoOverride;  public interface INoOverrideInterface { 	@NoOverride 	default void m1() { 		 	} }  a warning will appear on the annotation saying it is not allowed (but it should be).

title: React to changes in Orbit's org.objectweb.asm 5.0.1
desc: This is follow up to bug 431820.   From what I understand, API tools need to add "org.objectweb.asm.tree" to it's dependencies?   Apologies for build break, I thought it'd already been done.   I would like to get this in an I-build, if possible, since not much time left before M7.

title: Update to ASM 9.0
desc: ASM 9.0 is released with Java 15 / 16 support, so we should update PDE to use it, once the bundle is added to Orbit. See orbit bug 567273.

title: Missing @since tag when adding new API classes not reported
desc: I20100414-1200.  We have a hole in the API tooling story: when adding a new API package plus a new API class, no API tooling error is reported (as defined by the preferences).  The error is only reported once the package is added to the manifest. Unfortunately, out of the box the severity for missing package is set to 'Ignore'.  Not sure we want to change that default so late in the game but maybe we could dynamically adjust that setting for projects that have API tooling enabled.

title: [patch] - Automatically select a new baseline when it is the only one
desc: M20100825-0800 and 3.7  In a new workspace and in a new use scan launch configuration, if you create a new baseline it should be selected for you in the baseline combo.  Steps:  1. start a new workspace 2. create a new use scan configuration - baselines combo is empty 3. press Baselines... to create a new one  Notice that once you are done creating the new one you then have to go to the combo to select it.

title: [1.8] Support method references
desc: We must provide illegal use support for method references:   1. be able to detect illegal references 2. be able to detect illegal instantiation (in the MyObject::new case?)

title: [1.8] Remove the unsupported bytecodes preference in Luna
desc: We added a preference setting and problem marker for unsupported bytecodes.  In the Luna stream, the new version of ASM will read Java 8 bytecodes rendering this preference obsolete (until the next Java release).  While there is no harm in having the preference page, it will do nothing.

title: [1.8] Add comparator tests for 1.8 code
desc: We should probably add some comparator tests to ensure we get a correct delta for the following cases:  1) Interface method becomes a default method 2) Anonymous class gets turned into a lambda expression (JDT may have a refactoring that does this) 3) Method call becomes method reference

title: @NoOverride not respected for default interface methods
desc: Created attachment 242337 [details] Project to recreate this  Import the project attached.  /**  * Test no overriding restricted default methods  */ public class test5 implements INoOverrideInterface {  	@Override 	public void m1() { 	} }   The function is not be overridden. If it is override, error should come if the options in preference is set to report error. Currently it doesnt report any error.

title: @NoOverride PDE annotation on static method should be disallowed
desc: public class ClassTest2 {  //	/** //	 * @nooverride //	 */ 	@NoOverride 	static public void m3(){ 		 	} }   Javadoc tag gives an error whereas the PDE annotation tag doesn't

title: Wrong API Tools errors in org.eclipse.core.runtime (ADDED and REMOVED annotation types)
desc: master with correct API Baseline (4.3.2)  API Tools errors in org.eclipse.core.runtime:  The major version should be incremented in version 3.10.0, since API breakage occurred since version 3.9.100 The re-exported type javax.annotation.ManagedBean has been removed from org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.9.100 The re-exported type org.eclipse.osgi.event.BatchBundleListener has been removed from org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.9.100  Maybe bug 424274 should also be fixed in master? Or else API filters should be added.

title: Wrongly reports addition of first type parameter to a generic method
desc: Bug 465292 revealed an example of a binary-compatible, but source-incompatible API change.  Example:  public interface Test { 	public void move(Number n, List<Number> l); }  Change to:  public interface Test { 	public <T extends Number> void move(T n, List<T> l); }  Since the erasure didn't change, this is a binary-compatible change. However, an implementation or extension of the interface that already used the List<Number> parameter type won't compile any more after the change. (If it used the raw type List, then would still compile.)  Since API Tools are only concerned about binary-incompatible changes, this change should not result in an error.  Fix follows.

title: API Tools view should filter non-API changes (ApiComparator bug for generic methods)
desc: The API Tools view should filter non-API changes.  I tried to verify the API changes for bug 478673, but the view showed too many changes for private and package-accessible members. Those are not considered API and should not be shown.  If you still want to show non-API changes, you can add a toggleable filter.

title: [patch] API Tools builder wrongly "weaves" dev properties into manifests of non-workspace bundles
desc: I20160223-0800  - new workspace - clone git://git.eclipse.org/gitroot/platform/eclipse.platform.runtime.git - import all projects from /bundles  - launch new runtime workspace - set API Baseline to 4.5.1 - set Target Platform to a new target definition that uses the Installation of the I20160223-0800 build you used initially - add Git repo eclipse.platform.runtime (you can reuse the cloned one from the host workspace) - import /bundles/org.eclipse.core.runtime  25 Errors like these:  * The major version should be incremented in version 3.12.0, since API breakage occurred since version 3.11.1	MANIFEST.MF	/org.eclipse.core.runtime/META-INF	line 4	Version Numbering Problem  * The re-exported type org.eclipse.core.runtime.content.BinarySignatureDescriber has been removed from org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.11.1	MANIFEST.MF	/org.eclipse.core.runtime/META-INF	line 1	Compatibility Problem  The problem is the same as bug 332112: The PDE model doesn't properly encapsulate the support for "workspace projects" in the target platform or API baseline, and client code wrongly "weaves" the dev properties into manifests of bundles that are not even coming from the host workspace.

title: API tools improvements in PDE for 4.7
desc: This the root bug for general API tools improvements planned in 4.7 like improvement in versioning, better reporting of breakage in corner scenarios ( involving generics and others) and fixing issues in since tag etc.

title: 'Ignore minor/major version increment without API changes/breakages' is broken
desc: Currently if I check the checkbox "ignore minor version increment without api changes"  in Version Management tab of API Error/Warning Preference page, the value returned by ignoreMinorVersionCheckWithoutApiChange is false. If I uncheck it, the value returned is true.  Either this is doing opposite of what it should do or the text in UI (or code or both )is misleading.

title: API Analysis Builder inactive for old version of multi-version bundle
desc: Follow-up to bug 489684, bug 511310  See scenario from bug 511310 comment 0. After the fix for that bug, API Tools is still effectively disabled for the old version org.eclipse.jdt.annotation_v1. When I add a new class or method in that project, I don't get any error from API Tools.  Looks like the API Tools model only stores infos from the latest version. .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.api.tools\org.eclipse.jdt.annotation\.api_description persists only the description for version 2.1.0.

title: API analyze component is taking lot of time with Java 9
desc: 1) Take a sample plugin project org.eclipse.jdt.apt.ui 2) Ignore API baseline ( so that only illegal API use are reported) 3) Run Clean->Build All 3)  Time taken for IApiProblem[] illegal = analyzer.analyze(component, scope, localMonitor.split(2)); ( in BaseApiAnalyzer) for java 9 is 1200 millisec  The same with Java 8 takes 30 odd millisec   I investigated and found out that ASM API is slow with Java 9.  		ClassReader reader = new ClassReader(((AbstractApiTypeRoot) fStorage).getContents()); 		long t = System.currentTimeMillis(); 		reader.accept(extractor, ClassReader.SKIP_FRAMES); 		long t2 = System.currentTimeMillis(); 		System.out.println("diff=======" + (t2 - t)); //$NON-NLS-1$  ASM's classreader for BaseConfigurationBlock.class takes 770 millisec instead of 30 millisecond by Java 8.

title: API tools test failures with Java 10
desc: Use Build id: M20180221-1700 Use  http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.7-P-builds/ for Java 10 update  Run pde.api.tools tests locally

title: Remove interface from Enum is not reported by API tools in Java 10
desc: Use Build id: M20180221-1700 Use  http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/4.7-P-builds/ for Java 10 update  Baseline ------- public enum RemoveSuperInterface implements InterfaceA { 	A, B, C; 	public int methodA() { 		return 0; 	}  }  Current Workspace  public enum RemoveSuperInterface { 	A, B, C; 	public int methodA() { 		return 0; 	}  }  The super interfaces set has been reduced for type removesuper.handlers.RemoveSuperInterface  is not reported  In Java9 or before, this is reported

title: API analysis is very slow with Java 11
desc: Run jdt.core API analysis with no baseline.  With Java 10 - it finishes in few seconds  With Java 11 - it takes > 1 minute.

title: API Tools ant tasks should use links/profile metadata to discover bundles in an installation
desc: Currently, many API tools ant tasks require installations to analyze and a baseline to compare to. The bundles to analyze are identified by a location on disk which is a simple directory of bundles. The tasks should support pointing to an installation and using the install metadata (.links, p2 profile, etc.), to understant what bundles are part of that installation.

title: Apibaseline::resolveSystemLibrary should use the latest EE as a fallback
desc: In code  // https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=383261 						// we don't need to compute anything here, in all cases 						// if 						// we fail to find a compatible EE, fall back to highest 						// known. 						// TODO this should be updated for each new EE that gets 						// added 						systemEE = "JavaSE-1.7"; //$NON-NLS-1$   Steps 1) Launch eclipse Build id: I20190605-1800 with java 13 2) Launch a debug configuration 3) Try to add an API baseline ( use the same eclipse as API baseline) 4) Put breakpoint in Apibaseline::initialize()  Environment id is JavaSE-1.7  It should be the highest EE ( in this case JavaSE-12).

title: Update to ASM 9.0
desc: ASM 9.0 is released with Java 15 / 16 support, so we should update PDE to use it, once the bundle is added to Orbit. See orbit bug 567273.

title: UseScanParser ignores result of visit methods
desc: Created attachment 181228 [details] Fix to avoid calling endvisit methods  The UseScanParser does a depth first search through a use scan xml folder and calls a UseScanVisitor to perform actions on it.  Several of the visit methods (component, referencing component, member) allow boolean return values to specify whether children should be visited.  If false is returned, no visit methods of the children should be called.  This works.  If false is returned, no end visit methods of the children should be called.  This fails currently.  I have a fix attached for this.  If false is returned, the children should be skipped entirely.  this fails currently.  We parse every file fully even if we don't need to.  Fixing this would improve performance for visitors that only care about certain components.

desc: java.util.ConcurrentModificationException 	at java.base/java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextNode(HashMap.java:1493) 	at java.base/java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:1516) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.ApiPlugin.saving(ApiPlugin.java:577) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.executeLifecycle(SaveManager.java:387) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager$1.run(SaveManager.java:204) 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:45) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.broadcastLifecycle(SaveManager.java:207) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:1164) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:1143) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.DelayedSnapshotJob.run(DelayedSnapshotJob.java:55) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:63)

title: Remove ManifestBuilder and SchemaBuilder from API analysis
desc: For example, Bug 550188 gives some errors due to different setup in IDE  Mickael in https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=550188#c5  "In the meantime, I found the cause of this specific message in Niko's patch. The reason is that the target platform doesn't include org.eclipse.core.expressions schemas; they're in the source bundle which is not included by default. As a result, the plugin validation fails."  One good option is to remove ManifestBuilder and SchemaBuilder from api analysis.  This will make api analysis faster too.

title: [patch] Expanded/Contracted superset should mention which interface was added/removed
desc: See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=551109#c0  3) For the future add *which* interface was added to the PDE API error message.

title: [patch] Report error on unnecessary version increment
desc: API tooling should report unnecessary version increment for bundles, where version was already incremented.  See https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/145561/13/org.eclipse.jface.text/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF@5  The minor version segment was bumped for bug 547683, and after that service segment increment was not needed in the change above.

title: [14] Create JavaSE-x-systempackages.profile for java 14
desc: JavaSE-x-systempackages.profile for Java 14 to be created.

title: [14] Investigate API tools with new Java version (14) and current ASM
desc: Investigate if the current ASM version breaks/supports new Java version. If required get new ASM version.

title: API tools improvements in PDE
desc: This is the root bug to capture API tools enhancements for 4.14

title: Flukey spurious error on org.eclipse.osgi MANIFEST.MF
desc: 4.14 M1  In my dev workspace with most stuff as source and the rest imported as binary projects I got;  The minor version should be incremented in version 3.15.100, since new APIs have been added since version   3.15.0  due to  List of compatible changes: - The superinterfaces set has been expanded for class   org.eclipse.osgi.storagemanager.ManagedOutputStream  This did not go away after full builds or restarts or close/reopen project.  Same not reproducible on new workspace  JRE 13  Switching to 4.13 fixed the problem. Going back to 4.14 M1, problem still gone.

title: Provide a consumer based report launch config UI
desc: Extension to bug 322571.  The consumer oriented report should be available from the existing launch configuration.  We should have a radio button or combo to select the type of report.  Most of the controls will be the same between the settings.  We could also add an option to produce both reports.

title: [14] API tool support for records
desc: Right now if a new record is added, the tool doesnt check if a since tag is required to be added.   Also need to test for other scenarios 1) component addition in record 2) record implementing an interface 3) method addition in record  etc

title: [14] - Update system package in latest Java in PDE system package
desc: jdk.dynalink.support >> jdk.incubator.foreign   One extra package is added

title: Investigate support for generating .api_description files for bundles that are not API tools enabled
desc: Current the ApiFileGenerationTask will short-circuit if the bundle it is run on does not have the API tools nature. We should investigate some level of support for generating an .api_description file for bundles without the API tools nature.  The benefit of this is that a build process could make use of the other API tasks without having to explicitly modify all of the bundles to be API tools enabled.

title: [14] [record] Support for compact contructor and components in API tools
desc: Support for compact contructor and component in API tools

title: Polish Use Scan Feature II
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #331811 +++  Opening this clone for the remaining identified polish work for M5  4) Preference page should have a link to the error level page.  5) Error levels should not be ignore by default.  Currently the user sets up the scan on the preference page, it asks you if you want to build and you say "great, go for it".  No errors are reported, which is perfect until you realize that there are no errors being reported period.  6) Is there any value to letting the user change the cache size?  As a user I have know idea what a reasonable value it and whether it would be beneficial for me to change it.  No need to give the user an advanced option unless there is a definite need by some users.

title: [15] Create JavaSE-x-systempackages.profile for Java 15
desc: JavaSE-x-systempackages.profile for Java 15 to be created.

title: API Use Scan problem description can get too long
desc: I deleted a reference that is used by many consumers in my use scan.  The problem marker showed up correctly, but has many repeated plug-in entries.  Having the same plug-in listed more than once is not helpful.  Furthermore, the description text limit is hit, so it doesn't tell me what the problem actually is.  Three suggestions  1) Remove duplicate plug-ins 2) If the text is too long, replace with a ... and others 3) Put the basic description at the start so it can be understood from the problems view.

title: [15] Remove JCP disclaimers from code in PDE
desc: Remove JCP disclaimers from code in PDE.

title: [api tooling] extending @noextend method not detected
desc: We do not create errors for extending a @noextend method. The reason for this is that we do not create IReference objects for extending methods (we do not have a reference type for this).  I'm not sure what the most efficient way is to implement this feature. It feels like keeping all @extend references for methods would be slow/inefficient.

title: [api tooling] plug-in version number validation
desc: Based on comparison with an API baseline, we should validate that a plug-in's version number has been updated correctly (and create errors markers when there is a problem with plug-in version numbers).  I think it only makes sense to perform the validation if two API profiles represent successive versions (i.e. comparing what will be released in 3.4, compared to 3.3). For example comparing 3.4 to 3.2 could provide misleading results if new API was added in 3.3 and 3.4 - as this would require to major version updates (and we would only be able to infer one?).

title: Wrong API Tools errors in org.eclipse.core.runtime (ADDED and REMOVED annotation types)
desc: master with correct API Baseline (4.3.2)  API Tools errors in org.eclipse.core.runtime:  The major version should be incremented in version 3.10.0, since API breakage occurred since version 3.9.100 The re-exported type javax.annotation.ManagedBean has been removed from org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.9.100 The re-exported type org.eclipse.osgi.event.BatchBundleListener has been removed from org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.9.100  Maybe bug 424274 should also be fixed in master? Or else API filters should be added.

title: [api tooling] tag scanner silently fails without class files
desc: When we are scanning source files for javadoc tags we try to resolve methods using their associated .class files.   Scanning will fail silently if there are no class files for the source we are scanning. This case can happen if you turn off autobuild and add source tags to a method. The scanner silently fails with an NPE that is never exposed...  There are a few things we could do here:  1. we could queue up the unresolvable methods in the api tool builder and the next time a build is activated we could try again to resolve them.  2. we could try to resolve using the java model if no class file are available

title: [api tooling] @noreference not working on inherited interface method
desc: If interfaceA implements foo(), and interfaceB extends interfaceA, a call to foo() on an implementor of interfaceB is not found as an error (if foo() has a @noreference flag).

title: Modifying directory on api use report configuration does not make tab dirty
desc: 1) New API Use Report configuration 2) Select to analyze a directory, give it valid values and save it 3) Reopen the launch config dialog 4) Modify the directory location = Tab is not dirty and will not save changes even if launched.

title: Provide problem/reference counts in xml from Analysis and Use Scan tasks
desc: Build Identifier:   API Usage and API Analysis Ant tasks produce a bunch of XML reports. There's no summary in XML format.  This presents a problem for a build using these Ant tasks that needs to report the found numbers of warnings and errors in a concise form. There doesn't seem to be an easy way to get this information right now, especially from the API Use task output.  What I would like to suggest, is each API Tooling task to produce at least a XML summary reporting the total errors/warnings numbers and any other important information, if any.  I think, ideally, the report should be a well formed XML output transformed to HTML via XSLT, as opposed to how right now a separate Ant task transforms it to HTML.  Reproducible: Always

title: [api tooling] API tooling set up should present as refactoring
desc: It was suggested that API tooling adopters would appreciate the initial API tooling setup to work like a refactoring - i.e. preview the edits of component.xml application to source code before pressing Finish.

title: [api tooling] Refactoring participants required for filters
desc: In our code we have many places that record/cache/persist qualified names/sigatures/etc. for reuse.  If a refactoring is done on one of these referenced types then the cached information about the (previous) type is stale and never gets removed.  We need to add in refactoring participants for:  1. api descriptions, for package/type/member rename/signature changes 2. api filters, for package/type/member rename/signature changes

title: [api tooling] Workspace profile needs to update after resource changes
desc: currently if you remove a resource from the workspace, the workspace api profile is not updated. For example I removed the jdt.debug project from my workspace and was barraged by errors like the following:  org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource '/org.eclipse.jdt.debug' does not exist. 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkExists(Resource.java:309) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkAccessible(Resource.java:192) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.checkAccessible(Project.java:113) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Folder.assertCreateRequirements(Folder.java:32) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Folder.create(Folder.java:88) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Folder.create(Folder.java:118) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.PluginProjectApiComponent.getProjectSettingsPath(PluginProjectApiComponent.java:234) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.PluginProjectApiComponent.persistApiFilters(PluginProjectApiComponent.java:369) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.PluginProjectApiComponent.saving(PluginProjectApiComponent.java:336) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ApiPlugin.saving(ApiPlugin.java:815) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.executeLifecycle(SaveManager.java:343) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager$1.run(SaveManager.java:160) 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.broadcastLifecycle(SaveManager.java:163) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:989) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.DelayedSnapshotJob.run(DelayedSnapshotJob.java:44) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: PDE support for Java 16 during 4.18
desc: PDE support for Java 16 during 4.18

title: Polish Use Scan Feature III
desc: 1) Separate the setence with the link to a new paragraph (at the bottom?).  It is a little hard to read what is going on.  2) Use the applyData method to open the api errors/warnings to the correct tab.  3) Removing use scans or pressing restore defaults still affects the preferences even if cancel is pressed.

title: [16] Create JavaSE-x-systempackages.profile for Java 16
desc: JavaSE-x-systempackages.profile for Java 16 to be created.

title: [16] Investigate API tools with new Java version (16) and current ASM
desc: Investigate if the current ASM version breaks/supports new Java version. If required get new ASM version.

title: Wrongly reports addition of first type parameter to a generic method
desc: Bug 465292 revealed an example of a binary-compatible, but source-incompatible API change.  Example:  public interface Test { 	public void move(Number n, List<Number> l); }  Change to:  public interface Test { 	public <T extends Number> void move(T n, List<T> l); }  Since the erasure didn't change, this is a binary-compatible change. However, an implementation or extension of the interface that already used the List<Number> parameter type won't compile any more after the change. (If it used the raw type List, then would still compile.)  Since API Tools are only concerned about binary-incompatible changes, this change should not result in an error.  Fix follows.

title: API Tools view should filter non-API changes (ApiComparator bug for generic methods)
desc: The API Tools view should filter non-API changes.  I tried to verify the API changes for bug 478673, but the view showed too many changes for private and package-accessible members. Those are not considered API and should not be shown.  If you still want to show non-API changes, you can add a toggleable filter.

title: [api tools] project settings update for org.eclipse.pde.api.tools
desc: With these updated settings it should be easy to catch the current problems

title: markers not cleaned up after replace
desc: If you convert a project to be 'api aware' and then replae it with a 'non-api aware' version from SCM, any markers created by the api builder are not removed after the replace finishes. This is technically working as it should, since the api builder only runs on project with the api tool nature, but it feels wrong that we are leaving behind 'garbage' in a case like this.  We should look at ways to remove any api tool markers from projects like this (without being too invasive or expensive).

title: [patch] API Tools builder wrongly "weaves" dev properties into manifests of non-workspace bundles
desc: I20160223-0800  - new workspace - clone git://git.eclipse.org/gitroot/platform/eclipse.platform.runtime.git - import all projects from /bundles  - launch new runtime workspace - set API Baseline to 4.5.1 - set Target Platform to a new target definition that uses the Installation of the I20160223-0800 build you used initially - add Git repo eclipse.platform.runtime (you can reuse the cloned one from the host workspace) - import /bundles/org.eclipse.core.runtime  25 Errors like these:  * The major version should be incremented in version 3.12.0, since API breakage occurred since version 3.11.1	MANIFEST.MF	/org.eclipse.core.runtime/META-INF	line 4	Version Numbering Problem  * The re-exported type org.eclipse.core.runtime.content.BinarySignatureDescriber has been removed from org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.11.1	MANIFEST.MF	/org.eclipse.core.runtime/META-INF	line 1	Compatibility Problem  The problem is the same as bug 332112: The PDE model doesn't properly encapsulate the support for "workspace projects" in the target platform or API baseline, and client code wrongly "weaves" the dev properties into manifests of bundles that are not even coming from the host workspace.

title: [15] Update AST.JLS14 to AST.JLS15 in API tools
desc: Update AST.JLS14 to AST.JLS15 in API tools

title: test suite required for incremental builder
desc: with incremental building added to api tooling we need to have a fairly extensive test suite for it. A good place to start would be to examine how jdt tests their builders.

title: [patch] ResourceApiTypeRoot object is created multiple times for the same resource and API type
desc: During API tooling, the constructor of ResourceApiTypeRoot  is created multiple times for the same resource and same type ( and the same baseline/current baseline). Due to this, in AbstractApiTypeRoot::getStructure(), the contents are not cached and recreated everytime.

title: dynamic plug-in project API description and API component
desc: As plug-ins are modified in the workspace, the associated API descriptions, components, and workspace profile need to be kept up-to-date.  Implemented a new API description for plug-in projects that dynamically retrieve API description information from the workspace, using modification timestamps to know when the data is stale.  Modified the API profile manager to dispose the workspace API profile when a manifest, build.properties, or classpath changes. This way our OSGi state stays up to date. A new workspacep profile is created on demand.

title: adding plug-in from CVS broke workspace profile
desc: I had these plug-ins in my workspace, API tooling enabled:  * org.eclipse.debug.ui * org.eclipse.jdt.debug  I added "org.eclipse.debug.core" to the workspace from CVS (which was not API tooling enabled). This seemed to break the workspace profile (i.e. it had resolution errors that caused extra API build problems to appear).

title: persist project API descriptions
desc: We should persist project API descriptions so they can be re-used across workbench invocations. (Since the format of the descriptions for projects changed, we no longer do this). We should ensure the save participant is smart enough to know to only save the description if it is dirty.

title: NPE in getElementInfoFromAnyBaseline in API tools
desc: I got   ava.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.ApiModelCache$Cache.keys()" because "this.fRootCache" is null 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.ApiModelCache.getElementInfoFromAnyBaseline(ApiModelCache.java:264) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.ApiModelCache.getElementInfo(ApiModelCache.java:255) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.model.AbstractApiTypeRoot.getStructure(AbstractApiTypeRoot.java:59) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.Reference.resolve(Reference.java:325) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ReferenceResolver.resolveReferenceSets(ReferenceResolver.java:103) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ReferenceResolver.resolveReferences(ReferenceResolver.java:77) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ReferenceAnalyzer.analyze(ReferenceAnalyzer.java:241)  After restart the machine and launching eclipse in a workspace on which API analysis was done earlier.

title: illegal implementor error disappears after clean/build
desc: Steps:  * Auto-build is ON * Check out these projects and setup API tooling:    org.eclipse.core.variables    org.eclipse.debug.core    org.eclipse.debug.ui    org.eclipse.jdt.debug    org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui    org.eclipse.jdt.launching * Notice there are 3 errors in jdt.debug.ui:  (1) Illegally implements org.eclipse.debug.ui.ILaunchConfigurationDialog (2) llegally implements org.eclipse.jdt.launching.IRuntimeClasspathEntry (3) Invalid @since tag: 3.4; the @since tag value cannot be greater than the component version 3.3.0.qualifier  * Clean org.eclipse.deubg.core, wait for build to complete. Now there are only two errors in jdt.debug.ui:  (1) Illegally implements org.eclipse.jdt.launching.IRuntimeClasspathEntry (2) Invalid @since tag: 3.4; the @since tag value cannot be greater than the component version 3.3.0.qualifier  NOTE: Cleaning jdt.debug.ui makes the missing problem re-appear.

title: checkBaselineMismatch is recalculated multiple times for the same workspace and baseline combination
desc: If workspace is changed, then WorkspaceBaseline is disposed and a new WorkspaceBaseline is created, hence mismatch problem can be stored with a workspace baseline

title: more efficient scoped class file container
desc: For incremental builds we use a search scope consisting entirely of types within one component. The general implemenation visits all class files in the entire component, using the scope as a filter.   Since we know the exact set of types to visit it is more efficient just to visit those types. Created new TypeScope and use it in the builder. Added a test to SearchScopeTests for the new scope.

title: only write filter file if the project has API nature
desc: I replaced a project in my workspace (effectively removing its API nature). However, the .api_filters file was still written to the .settings folder on the next workspace save. The project is still part of the workspace profile, but we should not save filters unless the project actually has the API nature.

title: IReference should keep unresolved and resolved target locations
desc: Currently, we slam IReference's that get resolved - the target location is slammed with the resolved target location. It is useful to have both unresolved and resolved locations in some cases (for example, when re-resolving references in a different profile to see determine if a different version of a required bundle satifies all references).  Modified IReference to have 'referenced location' and 'resolved location'. Modified those that use IReference to reflect the change.

title: .api_filters not updated when it becomes empty
desc: I created a filter for an API problem (illegal implements). I re-built the project to ensure that the problem was filtered. This worked as expected.  Then I  * removed the filter * shutdown the workspace * restarted the workspace  > When I re-built the workspace I noticed the problem was still missing - and found that the .api_filters file still contained XML to filter the problem, and that the filter re-appeared in my project properties.

title: creating a no-op change causes API builder to run for 20 seconds
desc: Using  I20080226-1155  I have these projects in my workspace as source:  org.eclipse.jdt.doc.isv org.eclipse.jdt.doc.user org.eclipse.jdt-feature org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.doc org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv org.eclipse.platform.doc.user org.eclipse.releng org.eclipse.test.performance.win32 org.apache.ant org.eclipse.ant.core org.eclipse.ant.tests.core org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui org.eclipse.ant.ui org.eclipse.core.variables org.eclipse.debug.core org.eclipse.debug.examples.core org.eclipse.debug.examples.ui org.eclipse.debug.ui org.eclipse.jdt.debug org.eclipse.jdt.debug.jdi.tests org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui org.eclipse.jdt.launching org.eclipse.jdt.launching.j9 org.eclipse.jdt.ui.examples.javafamily org.eclipse.pde.api.tools org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.tests org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui org.eclipse.pde.core org.eclipse.pde.ui org.eclipse.test.performance org.eclipse.ui.console org.eclipse.ui.externaltools org.eclipse.ui.views.log org.objectweb.asm  Removing/adding a semi-colon in ApiUseAnalyzer causes the API builder to run for about 20 seconds.

title: [api tooling] Improve changes in EE
desc: The API analysis builder should improve the detection of changes inside Execution Environments of a project. Right now the tool reports a breakage as soon as a previous EE has been removed from the list. It doesn't check the compatibility of EEs.

title: Wording and casing in wizards
desc: I20080305-1100  - Open context menu on a PDE project   Sub menu PDE Tools:   'Api Tooling Setup...' should be 'API Tooling Setup...'  Open the wizard - First page Window title is 'API Tooling Setup...' no dots required here. Change to: 'API Tooling Setup'  'Configure projects for...' would better be the wizard description, and 'Select the Java projects to update would better be the label of the table' If not, 'Configure projects...' needs a dot at the end.  - Preview page Title is missing  Open preference page: - API Profiles > New API Profile 'Execution Environment:' should be 'Execution environment:' (Sentence capitalization) 'Browse' need dots: 'Browse...'  - API Errors/Warning:   columns (':') required on labels in 2nd and 3rd tab

title: Adding new profile blocks UI
desc: I20080305-1100  - Open preference page: API Profiles - Press 'New API Profile' button - Press 'Browse' - Select an existing Eclipse installation. Press OK.  While the install is investigated, the UI is blocked. Should be run in the modal context thread.

title: Report multiple increase of the service segment or minor version
desc: Few times, inspite of the the service segment already increased, the developer tends to increase the service segment by 100. All such scenarios are currently detected if the major or minor version is already increased. But in the scenarios when major or minor version is not increased, then redundant increase of service version should be detected as unnecessary version change. Similar for minor version. If minor version is increased once, it should not be increased again. API tools should warn about redundant increase.

title: [17] Create JavaSE-x-systempackages.profile for Java 17
desc: Create JavaSE-x-systempackages.profile for Java 17

title: Improve labels on Usage Restriction tab
desc: I20080305-1100  - Open preference page: API Error/Warning On the first tab:  'Extending a restricted member'. Wouldn't that better say 'Extending a restricted type'? I assume only types can be extended.  'Referencing a restricted member'. Is that types, methods and fields? 'Member' is confusing here. Member of what? Is a type a member? Would it be better to call this 'Referencing an internal type'  Out of curiosity: How does this play together with the JDT access restrictions? Would it make sense to link to the JDT Error/Warning compiler page?  Maybe avoid 'restriction' and be explicit: Extending a type marked with '@noextend' Instantiating a class marked with '@noinstantiate' (what about enums?)

title: problem reporter should not clean problems
desc: Problems are cleaned by the builder (incrementally), so the problem reporter should not clean problem markers - it does not know which files to clean.  After an incremental build all markers disappear.

title: Incorrect casing on API Use Scans tab on error/warnings pref page
desc: The options should use sentence casing, but instead use title casing.

title: failing tests in Build N20080317-2000
desc: there are some problem factory / problem tests that are failing.

title: avoid "finding" types when building API description nodes
desc: When creating nodes for types in "project" API descriptions, we are using IJavaProject.findType(...) to locate the associated IType. We already have the parent IType or IPackageFragment, so it should be faster just to create an appropriate java element handle.

title: Confusing error message in "New API Profile" dialog
desc: For "Location", I selected the folder containing the "eclipse" folder instead of the "eclipse" folder itself. The error message said something about "not bound to execution environment", which confused me. Could this be something like "Cannot detect a valid profile at the given location"?

title: [api tooling] @since tag quickfix should use the version from the Manifest, and not what it thinks is right
desc: Build id: I20080327-2251  I'm comparing my HEAD version (org.eclipse.rse.core_3.0.0) against baseline 2.0.  I have reved up the version in MANIFEST.MF to 3.0 for good reason, but API Tooling thinks it should be at 2.1 because it cannot find any breaking change - although I know that there is breaking binary change.  Now API Tooling finds several "missing @since tag" problems, and using Quickfix inserts @since 2.1 - what API Tooling thinks is correct. But it's wrong, so the quickfix is useless for me.  The @since quickfix should insert the version that it finds in the Manifest, even if it thinks that the version is wrong. This gives the user the chance to configure behavior in the correct way (in case the tooling is right and the user is wrong, user can still change the Manifest to 2.1 first and then fix the @since problems).

title: [api tooling] The enclosing type should not be returned as a default member
desc: When trying to locate the @since tags for a new member, we should not return the enclosing type as a default member. Otherwise we can end up reported invalid @since tags errors on the enclosing type. See bug  224685.

title: Got "The super interfaces set has been reduced" but I didn't
After fixing breaking API changes, error about bundle version still there
desc: I have a project with breaking API changes, leading to errors being reported for the breaking change, the @since tags and the bundle version number. After fixing the breaking change (adding back a removed API field), I was expecting that the other errors went away, but I had to do Project>Clean... manually.

title: Wording in the API Tooling setup wizard
desc: 20080401  - The wizard page description needs a dot.  - When pressing 'Next' on the first page of the 'API Tooling setup' you can see progress message 'Scanning projects for javadoc changes' Should be 'Javadoc', maybe even 'Javadoc comment'.

title: Ignoring missing API baseline also ignores missing plugin in baseline.
desc: Have a workspace with atleast 1 plugin in baseline and 1 plugin in not baseline. Change the option of "Missing baseline" to ignore. The missing plugin is removed too.

title: PreferencesTests rely on test ordering
desc: From bug 349447:  junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: The value for RESTRICTION_NOINSTANTIATE should be 'Error' expected:<2> but was:<1>     at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)     at junit.framework.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:283)     at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:64)     at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:195)     at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.util.tests.PreferencesTests.testGetNonDefaultValue(PreferencesTests.java:78)     at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)     at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)     at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:601)     at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:168)     at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:134)     at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:110)     at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:128)     at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:113)     at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:124)     at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:243)     at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:238)     at
