title: [api tooling] "Illegally instantiates" should not be flagged when extending an @noinstantiate class
desc: Build Id: I20080502-0100 (3.4M7)  In following example, an API Usage Problem "Illegally instantiates org.eclipse.dstore.core.miners.Miner" is flagged on the class declaration of CommandMiner. Am I misunderstanding the meaning of @noinstantiate, or is this a bug?  My understanding is that clients are allowed to extend the Miner and have it registered by some means (extension point or similar), as long as they leave instanatiating the class to the Framework.   We have a separate @noextend tag for disallowing extension, so I cannot see why this is folded into @noinstantiate.  /** @noinstantiate Clients should not instantiate this class. The framework  *                 will take care of instantiating the Miners.  */ public abstract class Miner { }  public class CommandMiner extends Miner { }

title: 'Set all to:...' preference action does not set all
desc: The 'Set all to:..' action does not set all of the preferences to the selected severity level.  Preferences not set:  1: Annotation -> the superinterfaces heirarchy has been reduced 2: Interface -> super interfaces have been reduced

title: Similar problems are being dropped from analyzer
desc: If we find N problems that match (have the same id and arguments, but have different line number, charstart, charend) in the base analyzer, we end up only returning 1 of them (the first one to be added to the backing collection.  Consider the following code example (where NoInstantiateClazz2 has been tagged @noinstantiate):  public abstract class Clazz2 extends TestPlugin2Clazz { 	Object o = new NoInstantiateClazz2(); 	/** 	 * Constructor 	 */ 	public Clazz2() { 		Object o = new NoInstantiateClazz2();  		Object o2 = new NoInstantiateClazz2(); 	} }  In this example only the first usage problem is returned, the other two are 'pruned', since the problem already exists in the base analyzer collection.

title: Filter quick-fix should use filter icon
desc: The quick-fix for creating an API filter should use the 'standard' filter icon.

title: simplify search scopes
desc: Currently, we only ever use search scopes that are an entire component (full build) or specific types in a component (incremental build). We have a lot of code to support more complex scopes that we don't use.

title: Transient failure in API filter tests
desc: the .api_filters file must exist in the testing project   junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: the .api_filters file must exist in the testing project at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.model.tests.ApiFilterStoreTests.testCopyFilterFile(ApiFilterStoreTests.java:63) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:354) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:206) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:35) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.run(CoreTestApplication.java:31) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer.callMethodWithException(EclipseAppContainer.java:574) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:195) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.MainApplicationLauncher.run(MainApplicationLauncher.java:32) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:110) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:79) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:370) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:179) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:549) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:504) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1236) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1212) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:30)

title: Generic signatures should be used when creating API problems
desc: fup to bug 253940, we should always show generic signatures in API rpoblems (for types, etc) if they are available.  For example "Clazz illegally extends GenericClazz<T>" instead of just  "Clazz illegally extends GenericClazz"

title: Accurately catching constructor problems inside constructors
desc: With the fix in for 230209 we now properly flag (and ignore) implicit constructor calls. There is one problem: if you explicitly call the constructor of your super-class within your constructor, it does not get flagged properly.  Example: class A extends B, where B is tagged as noinstantiate and A explicitly calls 'new B()' in one of its constructors.

title: Conversion of org.eclipse.update.core is causing weird results
desc: When convertion this bundle, the api restriction tags inside the type org.eclipse.update.configuration.IActivity are duplicated and you can find: @noextend null multiple times.  This should be fixed to help people to convert.

title: Improve API description memory usage
desc: Currently the single largest use of memory in API tools are the API descriptions since descriptions are directly dependent on the API package / type count. We should look at ways to minimize the use of LRU / MRU caches for components / packages and we should examine our usage of HashMaps (avoid default sized aps if smaller will suffice and make intellgent guesses at default mapo siezs to minimize map resizing / rehashing).  Some classes to consider (which hold, or are part of, the largest amount of retained memory)  ApiDescriptionManager ApiProfile ProjectApiDescription BundleApiComponent ReferenceTypeDescriptorImpl FieldDescriptorImpl

title: Delete API Tools EE Description features (individual EE features)
desc: Git tree: http://git.eclipse.org/c/pde/eclipse.pde.ui.git/tree/apitools?id=ef26c6a2ba1f29ecf7d75aba3548897202957e6a  In git there are feature folders for each EE description.  The folders do not contain a feature.xml or a .project file so they cannot be checked out.  However, they do contain a pom.xml.  In 4.3, individual features are not built.  Instead we have one top level feature.  The folders should be deleted from git.

title: API tooling wizard: "Use Reset..." error  in banner shouldn't be
desc: 3.4 RC1 0510-2000  1) Preferences -> PDE -> API Baselines  2) Fill in name 3) Pick a valid location  A progress bar will appear.  During that moment, an error note was visible in the banner saying something like, "Use Reset to scan the <something or other>"  Observations: A) It seemed to be telling me something that wasn't required since it was already scanning the directory B) It shouldn't have had the error icon beside it, it was at most info

title: API tooling wizard: adding baseline should select it
desc: 3.4 RC1 0510-2000  1) Preferences -> PDE -> API Baselines->Add Baselines 2) Fill in name, location, Finish 3) Back in the preference page, the newly added baseline appears but is unchecked.    Observation: It should probably be checked, since the reason I added it was likely so I'd use it.  That I assume is the most common workflow.

title: bundle version error disappears on incremental build
desc: I20080513-2000  I noticed today that the errors on the Ant plugins for incrementing the minor version with no API changes were disappearing and re-appearing. It seems that they sometimes get cleaned on an incremental build, and are not re-created.

title: Delta Processor is reporting method additions incorrectly in interfaces
desc: There is a subtle bug in our delta processor where we are considering method additions to an interface tagged as noimplement to be a breaking change. These additions should be allowed.  The fix is simple: with adding back the noextend support I accidentally added the additional case that a method addition needed an extend restriction as well, this should be removed and the tests updated

title: Cannot add back a baseline with same name
desc: Steps to reproduce: 1) create a first baseline named "3.3.2" 2) Click finish 3) Reopen the baseline wizard and remove the 3.3.2 baseline 4) Try to create a new baseline without clicking finish with the same name. You get an error saying that a baseline with the same name already exists.

title: "Tag '@noinstantiate' is unsupported on a class" should say "abstract class"
desc: I20080513-2000  Tag '@noinstantiate' is unsupported on a class	RefactoringContribution.java	org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring/src/org/eclipse/ltk/core/refactoring	Unsupported Tag Problem	line 71  => Should be "... unsupported on an *abstract* class".

title: Illegal usage should not be reported inside fragments of the host
desc: With HEAD and running the ant task between 3.5M3 and 3.4.1, we report: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.tool.EclipseFileManager illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.InvalidInputException org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.tool.EclipseFileManager illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.InvalidInputException org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.tool.EclipseFileManager illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.InvalidInputException org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.tool.EclipseFileManager illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.InvalidInputException  These are invalid usage reported inside a fragment of the host. This should be tolerated.

title: NPE running api verification task on Linux
desc: Fup of bug 255667, if you are trying to use an alternate location, or some some reason the *.zip file did not extract properly and the ref locations are empty, then the verification task will throw an NPE:   Buildfile: /eclipse/workspaces/target/P/build.xml  run: [apitooling.apitoolsverification] reference : /eclipse/eclipse-SDK-3.4.1-linux-gtk.tar.gz [apitooling.apitoolsverification] profile to compare : /eclipse/eclipse-SDK-I20081112-1200-linux-gtk.tar.gz [apitooling.apitoolsverification] report location : /eclipse/tests_api/reports/xml [apitooling.apitoolsverification] filter store : /eclipse/tests_api/filters [apitooling.apitoolsverification] exclude list location : /eclipse/tests_api/exclude_list_external.txt [apitooling.apitoolsverification] Extraction of both archives : 39ms  BUILD FAILED /eclipse/workspaces/target/P/build.xml:18: java.lang.NullPointerException  Total time: 6 minutes 16 seconds  Olivier suggested that we should report a build exception in this case, and I agree with him.

title: ApiBaselineManagerTests.testWPUpdateSourceInnerTypeChanged failed
desc: ApiBaselineManagerTests.testWPUpdateSourceInnerTypeChanged failed.   junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: there must not be a noinstantiate setting for TestClass3$InnerTestClass3 at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.util.tests.ApiBaselineManagerTests.testWPUpdateSourceInnerTypeChanged(ApiBaselineManagerTests.java:486) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:655) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:310) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:36) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.run(CoreTestApplication.java:32) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer.callMethodWithException(EclipseAppContainer.java:587) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:198) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:110) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:79) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:354) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:181) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:636) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:591) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1450) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1426) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:34)

title: Unsupported tag on a secondary type causes two problems to be created
desc: 4.3.0 I20130326-0800  Build the example below and notice you will get two problem markers for the invalid @noreference tag  package x.y.z;  public interface test13 { }  /**  * @noreference  */ interface test13outer {}  could be related to the fix for bug 404744 or bug 404830

title: Wrong API problem (illegally implements interface via sub-interface)
desc: I20081118-1720 (including fix for bug 230189)  In HEAD, we have the following API problem:  AbstractTemplatesPage illegally implements IPage via ITemplatesPage in org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor/src/org/eclipse/ui/texteditor/templates/AbstractTemplatesPage.java  Here's the type declaration: public abstract class AbstractTemplatesPage extends Page implements ITemplatesPage { ... }  => AbstractTemplatesPage should not be flagged, since it also implements IPage via superclass Page, and that path is legal.

title: reduce manifest footprint
desc: API components cache entire manifests as dictionaries. However, we only access a few of the headers (one a BundleDescription has been created). We could reduce the footprint of manifests by reducing them to only contain the interesting headers.

title: API tools should have external tool builder to build ant support jar
desc: Created attachment 118406 [details] proposed fix  org.eclipse.pde.api.tools should have an external tool builder to build the apitooling-ant.jar file when the project is built. Furthermore the tool builder should be scoped to the src_ant folder, and there should be a .cvsignore in the lib folder for the apitooling-ant.jar file.

title: Treat old style (pre-osgi) plugins as valid bundles
desc: API Tools has never created valid API components for pre-osgi plugins.  We have tests to ensure that the component can be created, but the components will not be considered valid and therefore are not added to the baseline.  While direct analysis of these plug-ins isn't valuable, any bundle that depends on them (directly or indirectly) will have a resolver error for the missing dependency.  PDE UI converts the old style plug-ins to its bundle model using the Equinox PluginConverter.  API Tools should reuse this code and support old style plug-ins the same way.

title: Restore defaults doesn't work on the API Use Scans preference page
desc: 1) Go to the API use scans page 2) Add a directory without use scans (error message opens) 3) Press restore defaults (entry is removed from the table) Result: Error message stays and you cannot leave the page.

title: Remove unused caching code
desc: we have a few unused classes in the o.e.p.a.t.internal.model.cache that can be removed:  ApiElementCache.java ApiToolsCache.java LRUCache.java LRUCacheEnumerator.java	 OverflowingLRUCache.java ToStringSorter.java

title: Scanning 'project' message is not descriptive
desc: Now that our progress reporting has been fixed, I often see the message "Scanning 'project name'". I'm not sure exactly which phase of the API analysis this is, but it's not very descriptive for the user. We should likely update this to something more descriptive.

title: FUP 256157 additional code clean up
desc: Using the code coverage report posted here: http://www.eclipse.org/pde/pde-api-tools/coverage/20081121/index.html there are other unused classes that can be removed. We could also use this report to identify places to improve our code usage.

title: API builder seems slower in I20080515-2000
desc: Testing on Windows XP and Linux using I20080515-2000 it feels as though the API  builder is a bit slower. Talking with Olivier it could be that some additional time has been added with the fix for the @noreference support, where we now request the restrictions for each member.  It would be good to profile the builder again and compare...

title: migration guide entry
desc: We should add a migration guide entry describing the changes in API tooling tags (@noextend for interfaces). Following was the text sent to the mailing list:  API tooling now supports the @noextend restriction on interfaces.  Components with API interfaces should read/follow instructions below.  ** What is affected: **  API interfaces defined with the @noimplement restriction.  ** Description:  **  In release 3.4 (Ganymede) and earlier, API tooling supported one  restriction for API interfaces - @noimplement. This restriction indicated  an interface was not to be implemented *or* extended by clients. To allow  for more flexibility, Eclipse 3.5 (Galileo) separates these concerns with  two restrictions - @noimplement and @noextend. This allows an interface to  be extended when it is not intended to be implemented directly. For  example, in some cases clients are not allowed to implement an interface  directly, but can subclass an existing implementation and extend the base  interface/class with extra function (@see  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=230189 for a discussion and  examples).  ** Action required:  **  Component owners need to decide where to add @noextend tags on existing  interfaces.  To have exactly the same API contract as specified in 3.4, @noextend tags  can be added to all interfaces specified as @noimplement. However, this  can be decided on a case by case basis. Generally, the @noextend can be  omitted, as clients that extend and implement a @noimplement interface  will still be flagged with errors. However, if you would like to reserve  the right to add constants (public static final fields) to an API  interface in the future, you must add the @noextend tag. This is because  adding a field to an interface is binary incompatible if clients can  extend or implement an interface (@see  http://wiki.eclipse.org/Evolving_Java-based_APIs_2#Evolving_API_Interfaces).  Adding an API restriction to a class/interface is usually an error -  however, API tooling allows you to add @noextend tags without penalty in  release 3.5, since this specifies the same contract as in 3.4. If you were  to wait until a later release to add the additional tag, and error would  be generated.

title: The same API Problem is reported several in Problem View
desc: build I20080519-2000 1) open a new workspace 2) checkout org.eclipse.jdt.core from dev.eclipse.org 3) add an API Baseline 4) do a full build 5) open org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.BuildContext.java In the Problem View the type BuildContext.java has 6 problem: BuildContext extends non-API type CompilationParticipantResult BuildContext extends non-API type CompilationParticipantResult BuildContext extends non-API type CompilationParticipantResult Constructor for BuildContext with non-API parameter type SourceFile Constructor for BuildContext with non-API parameter type SourceFile Constructor for BuildContext with non-API parameter type SourceFile  In fact there is only 2 problems but each problem has three occurrences.  6) add a space in the editor of BuildContext.java 7) save and build There is only 2 problems: BuildContext extends non-API type CompilationParticipantResult Constructor for BuildContext with non-API parameter type SourceFile  8) do a full build There is the same 6 problems as before

title: Expand tag tests for @noreference
desc: The tag tests should add @noreference tags to the list of valid tag tests and as well as a few invalid checks.

title: package / classfile organization
desc: Created attachment 118524 [details] work in progress  As we have been adding more features, fixes, etc, our package structure and source files have become a hodge-podge mess and should be reorganized into the correct packages.  The attached patch is a start

title: No separate error level for referencing a type marked @noreference
desc: We have API Use error/warning levels for the other tags, but none was added for @noreference support.  The doc will also have to be updated for this change.

title: Builder could report unused API problem filters
desc: With code always changing, it could happen that API problem filters become stale. This could also happen due to changes in the filters themselves.   In our current world we just leave the filters there and it is the responsibility of the user to clean them up. We could do better. We could hook into our builder and report when a filter is no longer used.   The detection should:  1. work with a full and incremental build 2. create a problem marker on the resource (maybe the project?) the filter used to apply to 3. offer a quick-fix to remove the filter and / or open the property page

title: Unused NLS strings should be cleaned up
desc: API tools has quite a few unused NLS'd strings, which need to be cleaned up.

title: search engine returns emtpy search results
desc: Currently when our SearchEngine returns, the collection of returned items contains (on average) 90% empty values; which causes us to iterate over a lot of search results only to do no work. One of the last things we do in the search(..) method of our search engine is to copy search results over to a new collection; we could be a bit smarter here and only return search results that are not empty.   For example searching org.eclipse.jdt.core will return 273 search results, of which only 3 of them are not empty. So for the one plugin alone we can save 270 pieces of garbage to be collected, and 270 unneeded no-op iterations.

title: Possibly broken code in IllegalImplementsProblemDetector.isImplemented(String, IApiType[])
desc: I20081125-0840.   org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.IllegalImplementsProblemDetector.isImplemented(String, IApiType[]):  	for (int i = 0; i < interfaces.length; i++) { 		if(interfaces[i].getName().equals(iname)) { 			return true; 		} 		return isImplemented(iname, interfaces[i].getSuperInterfaces()); 	}  Obviously the loop is either useless as it will at most handle interfaces[0] or it is broken.

title: Wrong problems reported in build reports (N20081126-2000)
desc: N20081126-2000.  The following build reports are wrong:  http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/N20081126-2000/apitools/apitoolsverifications/html/org.eclipse.ui.editors/report.html  org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.ITextEditorActionConstants illegally implements org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchActionConstants   http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/N20081126-2000/apitools/apitoolsverifications/html/org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor/report.html:  org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.ITextEditorHelpContextIds illegally implements org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.IAbstractTextEditorHelpContextIds   It looks once again, that API filters aren't respected. Could be same problem though as reported in 252719 comment 4.

title: CoreException should not be logged when a superclass or a superinterface cannot be resolved
desc: Inside api usage scan, we log CoreException when a type cannot be resolved. This happens when resolving either the superclass or a superinterface for a IApiType. With fix for bug 252386, a marker will be reported if the baseline doesn't resolve properly. We should however still log the problem in debug mode.

title: Incorrect API leak warning given on a protected method of final that returns non-API class
desc: I20081030-1917  Make an API class that is final, but does not have @noextend Have a protected method that returns a non-API class The protected method gets a warning that it is returning a non-API class.  Adding a @noextend fixes this problem, but of course is not allowed since the class is final.

title: Cannot locate illegal usage inside anonymous or local types when bundle targets < 1.5
desc: Right now the current implementation is using the EnclosingMethod attribute inside the .class file in order to retrieve the right line number inside the source file when we want to locate illegal usage problems for anonymous or local types. Since this attribute is only available in the .class file when the target platform is 1.5 or above, when the bundle targets 1.4, we cannot locate these problems on the right line. In this case the best we can do is to report the problem on the top level type definition.

title: Jazz up the API reports a bit
desc: It would be nice if the (awesome) API html reports were just a bit more snazzy.  1. If the number of a category of problems was a hyper-link to the respective section in the components' report    org.eclipse.osgi  	15  	175  	1  i.e. if the '15' linked to the compatibility section, the 175 to the usage, etc, etc  2. if a component has problems they should be red + bold or something to make them stand out more from the vast sea of zeros (plus having them red + bold would match the Junit build reports, which might look nice)

title: IOExceptions if baseline name is invalid file name
desc: 3.4 M7 Vista Home  If I name a baseline with characters that would not constitute a valid file name, I get IOExceptions performing operations that would cause an workspace save to happen.  Steps:   1 - create a new API baseline and name it "product foo v2.2.*" 2 - create a new project (any type), or close an existing project - you should get the exception below:   Started getting the following exception logged once in a while (makes sense, it is during workspace snapshot save):  !ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.api.tools 4 120 2008-05-21 23:19:49.228 !MESSAGE Error logged from API Tools Core:  !STACK 0 java.io.IOException: The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect 	at java.io.WinNTFileSystem.createFileExclusively(Native Method) 	at java.io.File.createNewFile(Unknown Source) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiProfileManager.persistStateCache(ApiProfileManager.java:276) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiProfileManager.saving(ApiProfileManager.java:396) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.ApiPlugin.saving(ApiPlugin.java:459) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.executeLifecycle(SaveManager.java:343) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager$1.run(SaveManager.java:160) 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.broadcastLifecycle(SaveManager.java:163) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:989) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.DelayedSnapshotJob.run(DelayedSnapshotJob.java:44) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: Explore alternate methods to acquire enclosing method for local types
desc: FUP to bugs 246672 and 257219. As it is now we have a discontinuity between how marker ranges are determined for local types in the pre- and post-1.5 worlds. If the class files we are examining are 1.5 or greater everything is fine and the correct selections are made, however, if the class files are < 1.4 we make a best effort to select the top-level type.  This leads to confusion (see bug 246672 comment 21) when a problem is expected but does not appear where expected.  We should examine ways to correctly and consistently compute the enclosing method for local types in the < 1.5 world, so that this confusion can be corrected.  Some ideas would be using the Java model to perform a brute force search (type + method-wise), or to use ASTs and search that way. Things to consider though are the memory and performance impact: we don't want to unnecessarily populate the Java model (more memory) and we don't want to kill the performance of a build (incremental or otherwise).

title: Setup wizard behaves strangely
desc: Using: I20081209-0100  starting the API tooling setup wizard with the only selection in the workspace being the api.tools project, and the wizard indicates that there is a project checked, but the list does not show this. if I press the next button, I see that the wizard will try to setup api tooling for the api.tools project (which is already API tooling enabled)  Steps:  1. select a project that is known to be API tools enabled 2. start the API setup wizard  Expected:  that nothing is selected in the listing of available projects, the next (or finish) button is (are) not enabled  Happens:  the next and finish buttons are enabled, and the wizard proposes to enable api tooling on a project that is already API tooling enabled

title: Scan for unsupported tags creates duplicate problems
desc: We are scanning source files more than once for unsupported javadoc tags. Since we traverse the class file container and process assoicated source, we are scanning source once for each top level type, and then once for each inner type. This results in duplicate problems, and we are doing more work than needed.

title: Close baseline profile after build
desc: From bug 233441, we should probably close the baseline API profile after each build as well. It may not be as critical, but it means we have zip files open that will prevent others form deleting them (until the workspace is closed).

title: Quick fix to remove stale filter not available
desc: In I20081209-0100  When there is a warning for a stale API problem filter, the quick fix to remove the problem is no longer available. We need this for M4 to complete the new feature.

title: API builder performance bad for incremental build
desc: I20080520-2000  In a development workspace with JDT, Debug and PDE plug-ins from CVS, open DebugPlugin.java, type a space (that does not change the class file), and save the file. The Java builder takes less than 0.5 seconds, but the API Tools builder needs about 30 seconds to finish.  This makes it a pain to work with compilation units that have a lot of incoming dependencies, and there's no way for me to improve the situation (except for disabling auto build).

title: New API Baseline dialog: Browse... should start at current install
desc: I20081211-1908  New API Baseline dialog: The Browse... button should start the dialog near the current install. Currently, the chooser always opens at the root, and I have to dig down in the file system to find the install.  Chances are very high that the install I want to use is very close to the current install, i.e. in a sibling directory.

title: Support the @noreference Javadoc tag on types
desc: SWT has a class GCData that is a public type in an API package. However, the class is documented as: * IMPORTANT: This class is not part of the public * API for SWT. It is marked public only so that it can be shared * within the packages provided by SWT. It is not available on all * platforms, and should never be called from application code. The class has a binary incomatibililty in it (vs 3.3 a removed field), however the problem should not be flagged. It can be filtered, but really, the type should have a @noreference or @private tag on it so clients would be warned about any reference to it, and all problems would be filtered automatically.

title: Unsupported tag tests should examine specific problem message arguments
desc: Currently in our test suite all of the unsupported tag tests check that the message for the created problems fits a general pattern, but should be making use of the setExpectedMessageArgs(..) and specialized assertProblems(..) methods to ensure the exact expected problem messages are being created.

title: Re-order compatibility options
desc: I think we should re-order the top level groupings of compatibility options to the following (since classes/interfaces are generally more widely used than enums and annotations):  Bundle Class Interface Enum Annotation Field Method  Constructor

title: API dependency reporting
desc: API tooling is planning to augment its toolset to produce reports of what API and *non*-API is referenced. This analysis could be used to obtain a better understanding of what parts of your API and non-API is used by others. This is different from current discouraged access reporting, as the report is oriented from the perspective of the producer rather than the consumer (currently, if you use something illegally, you are told - but the producer has no idea).  We should report non-API access as well as illegal API use (illegal extension, etc).  Typically, these reports would be run as part of a releng build - but could also be integrated into the IDE's search facilities.

title: Tons of API tooling errors after importing binaries
desc: I20080805-0100.  1. started my workspace (which had no errors) using I20080805-0100.    ==> all good 2. imported all unshared binary plug-ins from I20080805-0100.    ==> tons of API tooling errors on interfaces: The super interfaces set has been reduced for type 'T' (T stands for the concrete type)     plus: errors on many manifest files:  The major version should be incremented in version 3.5.0.qualifier, since API breakage occurred since version 'v' (v differs from plug-in to plug-in)   Similar errors were already reported but are marked as fixed (see bug 224969 and bug 233426).

title: yellow performance tests need tuning
desc: Many of the incremental build performance tests are yellow (standard deviation is too high to be considered consistent). For example:  http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/I20090106-0800/performance/org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.php?fp_type=0

title: Unused api filters should not be reported when corresponding checks have not been run
desc: If you check in jdt.core and you don't set up an api baseline, after the build is done, some api filters are reported as unused, but they are actually used if a reference api baseline is set for a compatibility check.

title: temp ee files left around
desc: I was poking around my hard drive and found a mess of .ee files in the normal tempfile location (under the user dir).  these appear to be something related to debug and is creation or parsing of ee files.  Looks like hter eis a leak in the clean up code.  I had about 100 of them in there.  Not too big but still a leak

desc: The compatibility tests are failing in the nightly build:  java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiSettingsXmlVisitor.<init>(ApiSettingsXmlVisitor.java:86) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.compatibility.CompatibilityTest.exportApiComponent(CompatibilityTest.java:241) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.compatibility.CompatibilityTest.setUp(CompatibilityTest.java:174) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:354) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:206) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:35) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.run(CoreTestApplication.java:31) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer.callMethodWithException(EclipseAppContainer.java:574) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:195) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.MainApplicationLauncher.run(MainApplicationLauncher.java:32) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:110) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:79) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:370) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:179) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:549) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:504) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1236) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1212) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:30)

title: Smoke test plan published on web site
desc: We should polish the existing API Tooling smoke test on the WIKI, and post a read-only copy on the PDE web site. Existing plan can be found here:  http://wiki.eclipse.org/Api_Tooling_Testing

title: Performance test suite
desc: API Tooling needs a performance test suite that covers these scenarios:  * full build * incremental build with few dependencies * incremental build with many dependencies * tag scanning (for API description building) * tag scanning (for unsupported tags) * searching

title: Compatibility and Usage tests do not respect specified compiler compliance
desc: Currently in our test suite we have a framework method getTestCompliance() which allows us to set the compiler compliance level on a per-test basis. While running the new tests for bug 258101 I noticed that the code that should be running was not: the test code was compiled to 1.5 even though the getTestCompliance() method returned 1.4.  After a bit of digging I found that our method for importing a project was toasting our project settings after-the-fact. Not sure on a fix yet, since it will affect a lot of tests...

title: Can't change API baseline location
desc: The "Edit API Baseline" dialog has a "Location" combo box with an editable text field. This suggests that I can use the text field to change the location of the API baseline. In fact I can change the text value and click the "Finish" button but when I open the dialog again the location value is still the original one. It seems that I'm forced to create a new baseline, rename the old one, rename the new one, set the new one active and finally delete the old one. Am I missing something?

title: Creating a usage problem filter doesn't remove it from Problems view
desc: I20080903-1200  1. Check out org.eclipse.jdt.core v_911 2. Build 3. In Problems view, select  Description	Resource	Path	Location	Type AST.convertCompilationUnit(int, CompilationUnitDeclaration, char[], Map, boolean, CompilationUnit, int, IProgressMonitor) has non-API parameter type CompilationUnit	AST.java	org.eclipse.jdt.core/dom/org/eclipse/jdt/core/dom	line 305	API Usage Problem 4. Quick fix 5. Create a usage problem filter... Observe: The problem is still reported in Problems view

title: Associate a comment to a problem filter
desc: I20080903-1200  When adding a problem filter, one must have a good reason. However this reason is not recorded and after a while we may forget why the problem filter was added.  It would be good if one could associate a comment to a problem filter (preferably at creation time, or using the "Properties>Plug-in Development>API Problem Filters" UI. Of course this comment would be stored in the ".settings/.api_filters" file.

title: @extend violation not detected for local and anonymous subclasses
desc: N20080904-2000.  @extend violation is not detected for inner and anonymous subclasses.  test 1) I added this code to ide.ui: 	OpenWithMenu openWithMenu= new OpenWithMenu(PlatformUI.getWorkbench().getActiveWorkbenchWindow().getActivePage(), (IAdaptable)selectedElement) {           some code here }   test 2) I added this code to jdt.ui: 	void test() { 		class foo extends OpenWithMenu { 			foo() { 				super(null, null); 			} 		} 	}  OpenWithAction has this tag: @noextend This class is not intended to be subclassed by clients.  If I turn the class into a top-level class the problem is detected.

title: restricted constructors from public static inner types not flagged
desc: if you have a public static inner type with a public constructor which has a noref tag on it, and you call the constructor, it does not get flagged as a problem.  Tests to uncomment once this has been fixed:  ConstructorUsageTests#testConstructorUsageTests1F ConstructorUsageTests#testConstructorUsageTests1I

desc: I20090127-0100  Each time the API Errors/Warnings preference or property page is opened, 12 fonts  are leaked. The allocations all look like this:  java.lang.Error 	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.new_Object(Device.java:804) 	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Resource.init(Resource.java:85) 	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font.<init>(Font.java:110) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui.internal.preferences.ApiErrorsWarningsConfigurationBlock.initializeInstalledMetatadata(ApiErrorsWarningsConfigurationBlock.java:1297) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui.internal.preferences.ApiErrorsWarningsConfigurationBlock.createPage(ApiErrorsWarningsConfigurationBlock.java:944) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui.internal.preferences.ApiErrorsWarningsConfigurationBlock.createControl(ApiErrorsWarningsConfigurationBlock.java:839) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui.internal.preferences.ApiErrorsWarningsPreferencePage.createContents(ApiErrorsWarningsPreferencePage.java:105) 	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferencePage.createControl(PreferencePage.java:235) 	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog.createPageControl(PreferenceDialog.java:1468)

title: Remove implementation of primitive types
desc: We have implementations of primitive types in our element descriptor hierarchy. Only the tests use these interfaces/classes, and they can be removed.

title: The group for execution environment datas should be disabled
desc: When the option to check the references in the system libraries is set to ignore, the contents of the group (all widgets including labels, links,...) should be disabled.

title: Optimize .api_description generation on export
desc: See bug 258822 comment #4.    In the particular case of exporting from the workspace with the new option to use the class files compiled in the workspace, .api_description adds significant time to the export.  Since we are using .class files from the workspace instead of recompiling, the time spent generating the api_description could in theory be spent before export.  We should investigate reusing the results of the API Analysis Builder during export.

title: collapse IType and IReferenceType descriptors
desc: Since we've done away with element descriptors for primitive and array types, the ITypeDescriptor and IReferenceTypeDescriptor interfaces can be combined. As well, we can get rid of the constants for primitive and array types.

title: Inconsistent result in incremental build for org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.usage.UnusedApiProblemFilterTests.testUnusedFilter2I()
desc: Using HEAD, it seems that the unused filter detection doesn't work in incremental build when the corresponding type is removed. This test only runs the usage check and that check gets an empty array of types to check in this case. This requires investigation.

title: consolidate element descriptors/structures used by delta compare & usage analysis
API usage report shows internal references from fragment bundles
desc: Fragment bundles at runtime are considered as "part" of the host they are attached to.  Fragments should have access to any internals of their host bundle.  They do not need to import or get special access to packages available in their host (internal or API).  The current reports show internal references from fragment bundles to their host.  For example the usage reports for the SDK (available at http://www.eclipse.org/pde/pde-api-tools/) show internal references from org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility.registry -> org.eclipse.equinox.registry  org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility.registry is a fragment and should be able to reference internals from its host org.eclipse.equinox.registry.  I do think the information is useful.  Perhaps there should be another column showing references to internals from fragments, or maybe the internal references from fragments can be included in the Internal-Permissible References column?

title: test failures in N20090218-2000
desc: There are 16 suspicious test failures on the Mac only in the N20090218-2000 build.

title: Improve API tooling test turnaround
desc: Running the API tooling compaitibility tests is time consuming for developers and for the automated build. The slowness is in creating/deleting an entire workspace for each test. The tests grow slower as we add more and more test data (classses) for new tests...  We should look at ways to improve this.

title: Change format on save options to reduce gratuitous changes in patches
desc: The PDE UI and PDE API Tools projects have format on save settings that clean up the entire file.  The majority of work going into these projects is contributed and must be reviewed.  Having a large number of gratuitous changes in the patch/change-set makes it more difficult to determine what the code change is and review it properly.  The two most noticeable cases are whitespace in doc comments and adding missing @override annotations.  Less often but more distracting is when the source code gets formatted significantly.  1) Change the format on save option to only format edited lines. 2) Remove the additional save action 'remove trailing whitespace'. 3) Remove the additional save actions to add missing annotations.

title: NoSuchElementException in ReferenceExtractor
desc: Running a test API use scan against Galileo I encountered a NoSuchElementException when our reference extractor tried to process a local or anonymous type that has no references.

title: Infrastructure support for source or binary analysis
desc: An m3 plan item for API tooling was to enhance our implementation to support either source or binary type structures. The idea is to design our analyzers such that the "type structure" abstraction could be derived from .java files or .class files without the analyzers needing to worry about it.

title: asm.tree needs to be added to pde feature
desc: Created attachment 241746 [details] patch to be unambiguous  It needs to be "included" in a feature, so it gets "packaged up" and put in repository.   and sense "org.objectweb.asm" is in pde feature ... it should go there with it.

title: Support the API use report conversion outside of the Ant tasks
desc: Currently the default tooling for converting an API use report to an HTML report to completely implemented in the ant task that uses it. This code should be usable outside of the Ant task world so we can provide IDE support for reporting (report conversion).

title: Javadoc tags to annotations wizard does not report progress
desc: 4.4 M7.  Javadoc tags to annotations wizard does not report progress.

title: missing about.html in 'source' jar
desc: In a recent Simultaneous release repo report: http://build.eclipse.org/simrel/luna/reporeports/reports/layoutCheck.txt  I noticed:   Missing about.html in file: org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.annotations.source_1.0.0.v20140507-1338.jar  Not sure if I've just always missed it, before ... or if some thing's changed?   I spent 1 minute looking at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.annotations and didn't see any obvious reason why it'd be missing.   Thought I'd at least open this bug while we do more investigation.

title: ReferenceModifiers class should not exist
desc: Currently in our code base we have a class ReferenceModifiers which contains nothing but constants representing the different kinds of IReferences. These constants should be part of IReference.

title: Update incremental performance tests
desc: Now that we are getting some solid results from our incremental performance tests, we should update the Java 5 incremental perf tests the same way we did for the 'normal' incremental perf tests: remove all but the 'build all problems' from the global footprint.  This would require the removal of:  AnnotationIncrementalBuildTests#testIncrementalAnnotCompat() AnnotationIncrementalBuildTests#testIncrementalAnnotTags() EnumIncrementalBuildTests#testIncrementalEnumCompat() EnumIncrementalBuildTests#testIncrementalEnumTags() EnumIncrementalBuildTests#testIncrementalEnumUsage() EnumIncrementalBuildTests#testIncremetalEnumLeak()  No performance data will go missing with the removal, as building these problems is done in the main incremental perf tests:  AnnotationIncrementalBuildTests#testIncrementalAnnot() EnumIncrementalBuildTests#testIncremantalEnum()

title: incremental build performance test
desc: We should have one or two incremental build tests for the performance suite to stress performance of analysis of dependent types (i.e. ripple/analysis caused by changing a type that has many dependent types).

title: No quickfix available for usage problem in ant.core
desc: Using I20090310-0100,  Steps to reproduce: 1) Check out ant.core from CVS (HEAD stream) 2) Set up a baseline (3.4.2) 3) You should get two usage problems. 4) Try quickfix of any of them 5) => Error: no quick fix available. Nothing in the .log file.

title: fix enclosing type resolution for nested types
desc: The method ApiType#getEnclosingType() is incomplete for member/local/anonymous types.

title: changing API baseline name triggers re-build
desc: Using  I20090310-0100  * If I change the name of an API baseline, it triggers a full build. It should not be required, since the content of the baseline has not changed.

title: Javadoc tags incorrcetly not proposed
desc: Consider the following code example:  /**  *   */ public class ClassUsageClass {   /**    * @noextend This class is not intended to be subclassed by clients.    * @noinstantiate This class is not intended to be instantiated by clients.   */   public static class inner {} 	 }  neither @noextend or @noinstantiate will be proposed for ClassUsageClass because they have been defined on an inner class. The cause is in our tag extactor - we are not ensuring the only type we are extracting tags from is the type we have activated the completion context on.

title: simplify search scopes
desc: Currently, we only ever use search scopes that are an entire component (full build) or specific types in a component (incremental build). We have a lot of code to support more complex scopes that we don't use.

title: Transient failure in API filter tests
desc: the .api_filters file must exist in the testing project   junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: the .api_filters file must exist in the testing project at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.model.tests.ApiFilterStoreTests.testCopyFilterFile(ApiFilterStoreTests.java:63) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:354) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:206) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:35) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.run(CoreTestApplication.java:31) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer.callMethodWithException(EclipseAppContainer.java:574) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:195) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.MainApplicationLauncher.run(MainApplicationLauncher.java:32) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:110) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:79) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:370) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:179) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:549) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:504) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1236) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1212) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:30)

title: CompareToBaselineWizard fails in Eclipse 4.4
desc: I set the baseline to an Luna installation, start the CompareToBaselineWizard dialog via Ctrl+3 and API Baseline... and get:  An internal error occurred during: "Comparing APIs...". org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.product.ProductFeature cannot be cast to org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaElement

title: Generic signatures should be used when creating API problems
desc: fup to bug 253940, we should always show generic signatures in API rpoblems (for types, etc) if they are available.  For example "Clazz illegally extends GenericClazz<T>" instead of just  "Clazz illegally extends GenericClazz"

title: Delta Processor is reporting method additions incorrectly in interfaces
desc: There is a subtle bug in our delta processor where we are considering method additions to an interface tagged as noimplement to be a breaking change. These additions should be allowed.  The fix is simple: with adding back the noextend support I accidentally added the additional case that a method addition needed an extend restriction as well, this should be removed and the tests updated

title: Illegal usage should not be reported inside fragments of the host
desc: With HEAD and running the ant task between 3.5M3 and 3.4.1, we report: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.tool.EclipseFileManager illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.InvalidInputException org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.tool.EclipseFileManager illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.InvalidInputException org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.tool.EclipseFileManager illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.InvalidInputException org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.tool.EclipseFileManager illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.InvalidInputException  These are invalid usage reported inside a fragment of the host. This should be tolerated.

title: NPE running api verification task on Linux
desc: Fup of bug 255667, if you are trying to use an alternate location, or some some reason the *.zip file did not extract properly and the ref locations are empty, then the verification task will throw an NPE:   Buildfile: /eclipse/workspaces/target/P/build.xml  run: [apitooling.apitoolsverification] reference : /eclipse/eclipse-SDK-3.4.1-linux-gtk.tar.gz [apitooling.apitoolsverification] profile to compare : /eclipse/eclipse-SDK-I20081112-1200-linux-gtk.tar.gz [apitooling.apitoolsverification] report location : /eclipse/tests_api/reports/xml [apitooling.apitoolsverification] filter store : /eclipse/tests_api/filters [apitooling.apitoolsverification] exclude list location : /eclipse/tests_api/exclude_list_external.txt [apitooling.apitoolsverification] Extraction of both archives : 39ms  BUILD FAILED /eclipse/workspaces/target/P/build.xml:18: java.lang.NullPointerException  Total time: 6 minutes 16 seconds  Olivier suggested that we should report a build exception in this case, and I agree with him.

title: Wrong API problem (illegally implements interface via sub-interface)
desc: I20081118-1720 (including fix for bug 230189)  In HEAD, we have the following API problem:  AbstractTemplatesPage illegally implements IPage via ITemplatesPage in org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor/src/org/eclipse/ui/texteditor/templates/AbstractTemplatesPage.java  Here's the type declaration: public abstract class AbstractTemplatesPage extends Page implements ITemplatesPage { ... }  => AbstractTemplatesPage should not be flagged, since it also implements IPage via superclass Page, and that path is legal.

title: reduce manifest footprint
desc: API components cache entire manifests as dictionaries. However, we only access a few of the headers (one a BundleDescription has been created). We could reduce the footprint of manifests by reducing them to only contain the interesting headers.

title: API tools should have external tool builder to build ant support jar
desc: Created attachment 118406 [details] proposed fix  org.eclipse.pde.api.tools should have an external tool builder to build the apitooling-ant.jar file when the project is built. Furthermore the tool builder should be scoped to the src_ant folder, and there should be a .cvsignore in the lib folder for the apitooling-ant.jar file.

title: Usage tests do not perform incremental builds
desc: Using I20090310-0100 running the usage tests and debugging I found that the usage tests do not cause incremental builds to happen - each test is run as a full build.

title: Run pde.api.tools.tests with Tycho
Make API Tools comparator available as Application
desc: To ease inclusion in non-Ant builds (such as Tycho), it would be convenient to make the API Tools comparator for a specific bundle available as an Application.

title: Remove unused caching code
desc: we have a few unused classes in the o.e.p.a.t.internal.model.cache that can be removed:  ApiElementCache.java ApiToolsCache.java LRUCache.java LRUCacheEnumerator.java	 OverflowingLRUCache.java ToStringSorter.java

title: FUP 256157 additional code clean up
desc: Using the code coverage report posted here: http://www.eclipse.org/pde/pde-api-tools/coverage/20081121/index.html there are other unused classes that can be removed. We could also use this report to identify places to improve our code usage.

title: migration guide entry
desc: We should add a migration guide entry describing the changes in API tooling tags (@noextend for interfaces). Following was the text sent to the mailing list:  API tooling now supports the @noextend restriction on interfaces.  Components with API interfaces should read/follow instructions below.  ** What is affected: **  API interfaces defined with the @noimplement restriction.  ** Description:  **  In release 3.4 (Ganymede) and earlier, API tooling supported one  restriction for API interfaces - @noimplement. This restriction indicated  an interface was not to be implemented *or* extended by clients. To allow  for more flexibility, Eclipse 3.5 (Galileo) separates these concerns with  two restrictions - @noimplement and @noextend. This allows an interface to  be extended when it is not intended to be implemented directly. For  example, in some cases clients are not allowed to implement an interface  directly, but can subclass an existing implementation and extend the base  interface/class with extra function (@see  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=230189 for a discussion and  examples).  ** Action required:  **  Component owners need to decide where to add @noextend tags on existing  interfaces.  To have exactly the same API contract as specified in 3.4, @noextend tags  can be added to all interfaces specified as @noimplement. However, this  can be decided on a case by case basis. Generally, the @noextend can be  omitted, as clients that extend and implement a @noimplement interface  will still be flagged with errors. However, if you would like to reserve  the right to add constants (public static final fields) to an API  interface in the future, you must add the @noextend tag. This is because  adding a field to an interface is binary incompatible if clients can  extend or implement an interface (@see  http://wiki.eclipse.org/Evolving_Java-based_APIs_2#Evolving_API_Interfaces).  Adding an API restriction to a class/interface is usually an error -  however, API tooling allows you to add @noextend tags without penalty in  release 3.5, since this specifies the same contract as in 3.4. If you were  to wait until a later release to add the additional tag, and error would  be generated.

title: Incremental usage build does not work when restrictions are changed
desc: If you change the restrictions on a type and save (causing an incremental build) some API usage types are not reported.  Steps:  1. make sure you have done a clean full build  2. open InspectPopupDialog from org.eclipse.debug.ui and ExceptionInspector from org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui 3. add an @noinstantiate tag to InspectPupupDialog and save  Expected:  ExceptionInspector should have a usage problem created for illegally instantiating InspectPopUpDialog (on line 95)  Happens:  nothing, no problem is reported unless I do a full build on org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui or I edit ExceptionInspector and save it.

title: Add tests for search implementation
desc: We should add tests to cover the code located into the two packages: org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.search org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.search

title: package / classfile organization
desc: Created attachment 118524 [details] work in progress  As we have been adding more features, fixes, etc, our package structure and source files have become a hodge-podge mess and should be reorganized into the correct packages.  The attached patch is a start

title: Pick one API scope and use it
desc: We have two API scopes in our tooling, both of them used to prune down the IApiElements to inspect (for some purpose). We should just turn the two classes into one and use that globally as our scope.  the interfaces in question are:  1. org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.model.IApiScope 2. org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.search.IApiSearchScope

title: Builder could report unused API problem filters
desc: With code always changing, it could happen that API problem filters become stale. This could also happen due to changes in the filters themselves.   In our current world we just leave the filters there and it is the responsibility of the user to clean them up. We could do better. We could hook into our builder and report when a filter is no longer used.   The detection should:  1. work with a full and incremental build 2. create a problem marker on the resource (maybe the project?) the filter used to apply to 3. offer a quick-fix to remove the filter and / or open the property page

title: Investigate removing the use of file handles in the API framework
desc: Currently in our API baselines and (some) type containers we hold onto file handles and open streams, which is what requires us to open / close baselines (both the workspace and default) during a build. In the full build world this is not so bad / noticeable, but in the incremental world this adds a significant percentage of time to the build (from my testing 24 - 48ms of time in a ~900 ms operation).   For the sake of not doing this extra work in the builds and to prevent leaking file handles / stream we should remove the use of file handles in favour of something else, URIs perhaps?

title: [perfs] Regression on 'Incremental Build - All' test
Should be able to remove a baseline by pressing "Delete"
desc: Once a baseline is selected, we should be able to remove it by pressing the "delete" key.

title: Unused api filter is reported twice against org.eclipse.ui.internal.navigator.extensions.StructuredViewerManager.StructuredViewerAccess.Listener
desc: This marker is wrongly created. This member type extends an interface tagged with @noextend(org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewerInternals.AssociateListener). It is defined in JFace.  If a modification is made into org.eclipse.ui.internal.navigator.extensions.StructuredViewerManager.StructuredViewerAccess.Listener, two identical markers are created.

title: "Invalid references to system libraries" is unclear
desc: I20081211-1908  Preferences > PDE > API Errors/Warnings > API Use > General has a preference called "Invalid references in system libraries". Doesn't that in fact mean that the references themselves are in the system libraries?  Shouldn't it mean "Invalid references to elements from system libraries"? Or at least "Invalid references into system libraries"?

Scenario 'org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.performance.ApiDescriptionTests#testCleanVisit()' (average over 15 samples):   Used Java Heap:        98.92K         (95% in [63.92K, 133.93K])     Measurable effect: 65.28K (1.0 SDs) (required sample size for an effect of 5% of mean: 2613)   Working Set:           -5.87K         (95% in [-12.86K, 1.13K])      Measurable effect: 13.05K (1.0 SDs) (required sample size for an effect of 5% of stdev: 6401)   Committed:            -11.47K         (95% in [-24.75K, 1.82K])      Measurable effect: 24.78K (1.0 SDs) (required sample size for an effect of 5% of stdev: 6400)   Working Set Peak:          0          (95% in [0, 0])                  Elapsed Process:           4ms        (95% in [0ms, 8ms])            Measurable effect: 7ms (1.0 SDs) (required sample size for an effect of 5% of stdev: 6400)   Kernel time:               0ms        (95% in [0ms, 0ms])              Page Faults:              11          (95% in [11, 11])                CPU Time:                  4ms        (95% in [0ms, 8ms])            Measurable effect: 7ms (1.0 SDs) (required sample size for an effect of 5% of stdev: 6400)   GDI Objects:               0          (95% in [0, 0])

title: Unable to add EE descriptions from repository
desc: If I go to the API Tools preference page, there's an option for me to install the EE descriptions. If I click install, it launches the p2 ui. I find that when I do this, my Eclipse locks up with a bunch of p2 ui install windows open. I am unable to close any.   This could potentially be a Cocoa issue but I'm not sure yet.

title: "The minor version should be incremented" stays on MANIFEST.MF after removing all problems
desc: I20090401-1325  - set 3.4 as API baseline - in org.eclipse.core.expressions, add a new class without Javadoc => problem on the class and in MANIFEST.MF (good)  - remove class => problem in MANIFEST.MF stays:  The minor version should be incremented in version 3.4.100.qualifier, since new APIs have been added since version 3.4.0.v20080603-2000	MANIFEST.MF	/org.eclipse.core.expressions/META-INF	line 5	Version Numbering Problem

title: Incremental build should only analyze structural and description changes
desc: The API analysis incremental build should only analyze types that have structural changes or have API description changes (and all their dependents). Currently, we analyze all types that change (structually or non-structurally), and all their dependents).  As well, only API visible types should be considered for analysis. A change to a non-API type does not effect API compatibility or API use.

title: Possibly broken code in IllegalImplementsProblemDetector.isImplemented(String, IApiType[])
desc: I20081125-0840.   org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.IllegalImplementsProblemDetector.isImplemented(String, IApiType[]):  	for (int i = 0; i < interfaces.length; i++) { 		if(interfaces[i].getName().equals(iname)) { 			return true; 		} 		return isImplemented(iname, interfaces[i].getSuperInterfaces()); 	}  Obviously the loop is either useless as it will at most handle interfaces[0] or it is broken.

title: Wrong problems reported in build reports (N20081126-2000)
desc: N20081126-2000.  The following build reports are wrong:  http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/N20081126-2000/apitools/apitoolsverifications/html/org.eclipse.ui.editors/report.html  org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.ITextEditorActionConstants illegally implements org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchActionConstants   http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/N20081126-2000/apitools/apitoolsverifications/html/org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor/report.html:  org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.ITextEditorHelpContextIds illegally implements org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.IAbstractTextEditorHelpContextIds   It looks once again, that API filters aren't respected. Could be same problem though as reported in 252719 comment 4.

title: Missing baseline warning cannot be disabled
desc: This warning is reported when a baseline has not been set for the workspace, but the project is set to use api tooling. This is an option defined only against the workspace and cannot be customized per project. If I uncheck it inside the baseline preference page, I still get the warning after a build. The problem seems to come from the fact that the instance scope is not checked when the project is not null in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.ApiPlugin.getSeverityLevel(String, IProject).

title: CoreException should not be logged when a superclass or a superinterface cannot be resolved
desc: Inside api usage scan, we log CoreException when a type cannot be resolved. This happens when resolving either the superclass or a superinterface for a IApiType. With fix for bug 252386, a marker will be reported if the baseline doesn't resolve properly. We should however still log the problem in debug mode.

title: Incorrect API leak warning given on a protected method of final that returns non-API class
desc: I20081030-1917  Make an API class that is final, but does not have @noextend Have a protected method that returns a non-API class The protected method gets a warning that it is returning a non-API class.  Adding a @noextend fixes this problem, but of course is not allowed since the class is final.

title: cleaning project should not "remove" API description
desc: When a project is cleaned, its API description should be cleaned but not removed from the API description manager cache. It should remain in the cache until the project is removed/deleted (else it is no longer managed, but remains in the API component and will be visited/used in potentially wrong states).  This is the cause of the 100% peformance increase in the perf tests - the description is not actually cleaned and the visit is a no-op.

title: Edit Api baseline wizard not properly initialized
desc: I20090407-1430  When you double-click an API baseline to edit it the location combo has nothing in it but the list is populated with bundles  Steps:  1. double-click a non-default baseline to edit it  expected:   all fields are properly initialized  happens:  the location combo has nothing in it even though there are bundles in the list

title: Default severity for missing baseline should be 'Error'
desc: 3.6.  The default severity for missing baseline should be 'Error'. For background see discussion in bug 315417.

title: API baseline manager should not hold on to java.io.File handles
desc: I20090407-1430  while fixing bug 272196 I noticed that the ApiBaselineManager hangs on to java.io.File handles once it has initialized its state cache. These handles are used to lazily load the infos for a baseline when more than its name are needed. We should change this to be locations and not hold the java.io.File handles.

title: Adding a first baseline doesn't select it by default
desc: Using HEAD, adding a baseline when no exists, don't select it once the baseline is created. The baseline used to be selected by default. When the baseline is not selected, it doesn't trigger a rebuild when closing the baseline creation wizard.

title: CCE while refactoring
desc: I20090421-0930  I was refactoring a type (moving to a different pacakge), and received the following exception:  Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.PackageFragment incompatible with org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui.internal.refactoring.FilterMoveParticipant.createPreChange(FilterMoveParticipant.java:45) 	at org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.participants.ProcessorBasedRefactoring.createChange(ProcessorBasedRefactoring.java:307) 	at org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.CreateChangeOperation.run(CreateChangeOperation.java:124) 	at org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.PerformChangeOperation.run(PerformChangeOperation.java:211) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1800) 	at org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.run(WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.java:87) 	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:121)

desc: in I20090427-0800 and seen in previous builds. title: Cannot locate illegal usage inside anonymous or local types when bundle targets < 1.5
desc: Right now the current implementation is using the EnclosingMethod attribute inside the .class file in order to retrieve the right line number inside the source file when we want to locate illegal usage problems for anonymous or local types. Since this attribute is only available in the .class file when the target platform is 1.5 or above, when the bundle targets 1.4, we cannot locate these problems on the right line. In this case the best we can do is to report the problem on the top level type definition.

title: Compare with baseline dialog needs button or link
desc: I tried using the compare with API baseline feature but did that in a workspace without any configured API baselines. The dialog for picking the API baseline to compare against has an empty combo and oK/cancel buttons. At this point I am stuck. Please add a link (for getting to the preference page) or a button (for adding an API baseline) to that dialog!

title: Jazz up the API reports a bit
desc: It would be nice if the (awesome) API html reports were just a bit more snazzy.  1. If the number of a category of problems was a hyper-link to the respective section in the components' report    org.eclipse.osgi  	15  	175  	1  i.e. if the '15' linked to the compatibility section, the 175 to the usage, etc, etc  2. if a component has problems they should be red + bold or something to make them stand out more from the vast sea of zeros (plus having them red + bold would match the Junit build reports, which might look nice)

title: API setup wizard accepts binary projects
desc: I20090428-0100  If I activate the API Tooling setup wizard on a binary project nothing appears in the table of projects, but the checked counter says one project is selected and the next button will show me proposed chnages for adding the API tools nature to the binary project.  Steps:  1. start new workspace 2. import org.junit into your workspace as a binary project 3. open the API tooling setup wizard on the project  Expected:  the wizard will open and there will be no projects in the table or selected and the finish / next buttons will be disabled.  Happens:  the wizard opens, there is nothing in the table, but the checked counter says there is one project selected and pressing Next will show me proposed changes to the binary project.  The problem comes from the getWorkbenchSelection() method in the wizard, it does not prune binary projects like the method for deriving the overall input does.

title: Explore alternate methods to acquire enclosing method for local types
desc: FUP to bugs 246672 and 257219. As it is now we have a discontinuity between how marker ranges are determined for local types in the pre- and post-1.5 worlds. If the class files we are examining are 1.5 or greater everything is fine and the correct selections are made, however, if the class files are < 1.4 we make a best effort to select the top-level type.  This leads to confusion (see bug 246672 comment 21) when a problem is expected but does not appear where expected.  We should examine ways to correctly and consistently compute the enclosing method for local types in the < 1.5 world, so that this confusion can be corrected.  Some ideas would be using the Java model to perform a brute force search (type + method-wise), or to use ASTs and search that way. Things to consider though are the memory and performance impact: we don't want to unnecessarily populate the Java model (more memory) and we don't want to kill the performance of a build (incremental or otherwise).

title: Setup wizard behaves strangely
desc: Using: I20081209-0100  starting the API tooling setup wizard with the only selection in the workspace being the api.tools project, and the wizard indicates that there is a project checked, but the list does not show this. if I press the next button, I see that the wizard will try to setup api tooling for the api.tools project (which is already API tooling enabled)  Steps:  1. select a project that is known to be API tools enabled 2. start the API setup wizard  Expected:  that nothing is selected in the listing of available projects, the next (or finish) button is (are) not enabled  Happens:  the next and finish buttons are enabled, and the wizard proposes to enable api tooling on a project that is already API tooling enabled

title: Quick fix to remove stale filter not available
desc: In I20081209-0100  When there is a warning for a stale API problem filter, the quick fix to remove the problem is no longer available. We need this for M4 to complete the new feature.

title: Reverting workspace only works for compatibility tests
desc: FUP to bug 275005, the usage tests were attempting to use the revertible workspace, which was found to only work for compatibility tests (reliably). The reverting workspace should be updated to allow all tests to leverage it.

title: Full build run after removing unused API problem filter
desc: While verifying the combined fix for bug 274515 I found that a full was occurring when I would add / remove API problem filters for jdt.core.  Steps:  1. remove the final keyword from CompilationParticipant#READY_FOR_BUILD 2. save   Expected  CompilationParticipant is rebuilt  Happens all of jdt.core is rescanned by the API tools builder - notice in the progress view that all packages are re-scanned for unsupported tags and usage

title: New API Baseline dialog: Browse... should start at current install
desc: I20081211-1908  New API Baseline dialog: The Browse... button should start the dialog near the current install. Currently, the chooser always opens at the root, and I have to dig down in the file system to find the install.  Chances are very high that the install I want to use is very close to the current install, i.e. in a sibling directory.

title: ApiType#getSimpleName() fails for local types with numbers for simple names
desc: I20090508-2000  when we process the type name of a local ApiType to derive its simple name we do not consider that the name of the local type might be a number (like an anonymous type name). This causes our code to return null for the simple type name when in fact the local type has a name: for example local type x.y.z.Class$1 the simple name for the local type is '1'. It is not common to have a local type named with number like this but the compiler can generate code like this.

title: API tools code has a lot of JDT warnings
desc: Created attachment 135598 [details] proposed fix  - code from HEAD  Confirming our compiler options for our projects (core, tests and UI) I found that we have a lot of JDT warnings about no-thrown exceptions, unnecessary else statements, synthetic accessors, etc. These should be cleaned up for RC1.

title: PluginProjectApiComponent#createApiTypeContainers() should be synchronized
desc: Created attachment 136330 [details] proposed fix  I20090518-2000  FUP to bug 275338 we synchronized the createApiTypeContainers() method for BundleApiComponent but did not do so for the overriding method in PluginProjectApiComponent.

title: Unsupported tag tests should examine specific problem message arguments
desc: Currently in our test suite all of the unsupported tag tests check that the message for the created problems fits a general pattern, but should be making use of the setExpectedMessageArgs(..) and specialized assertProblems(..) methods to ensure the exact expected problem messages are being created.

title: API dependency reporting
desc: API tooling is planning to augment its toolset to produce reports of what API and *non*-API is referenced. This analysis could be used to obtain a better understanding of what parts of your API and non-API is used by others. This is different from current discouraged access reporting, as the report is oriented from the perspective of the producer rather than the consumer (currently, if you use something illegally, you are told - but the producer has no idea).  We should report non-API access as well as illegal API use (illegal extension, etc).  Typically, these reports would be run as part of a releng build - but could also be integrated into the IDE's search facilities.

title: Dialog help does not show unless page content is selected
desc: Created attachment 137066 [details] fix  3.5RC2  On the API baselines preference page if you select the page from the tree and press the ? help button the default preferences help is shown. If you select the table in the page, for example, and then press the ? button the correct help for the page is shown.
