org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:54)  May be this kind of exception should be caught as user may change his mind during long run operations, hence it should be considered as a 'normal' use case...

title: Replace usage of SubProgressMonitor with SubMonitor in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui
desc: See also Bug 477527.

title: Entries in .api_filters should also be sorted by arguments
desc: I20100302-0800  +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #269163 +++ [..] To keep the file as stable as possible, you should sort by <resource>'s "path" and "type", and inside by the <filter>'s "id".   Looks like that's still not enough. You should also sort by the message arguments' values. See e.g. /org.eclipse.jface/.settings/.api_filters.

title: Error message for bad regular expression should be improved
desc: The messages displayed in the launch dialog for a bad regex need to be improved, as they talk about a text field of the wrong name:  /org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui/src/org/eclipse/pde/api/tools/ui/internal/use/messages.properties  ApiUseScanTab_regex_problem_search_for=Search For regular expression problem: {0} ApiUseScanTab_regex_problem_search_in=Search In regular expression problem: {0}  should be merged into something better like:  #{0} is the invalid regular expression the user entered The regular expression is not valid: {0}

title: Incorrect errors that API exception filters are unnecessary when code is changed
desc: I20100225-1936  To reproduce:  In o.e.ui.navigator StructuredViewerManager in HEAD, add a println somewhere.  You will get this error:  The API problem filter for: 'StructuredViewerAccess illegally references method StructuredViewerInternals.setAssociateListener(StructuredViewer, StructuredViewerInternalsAssociateListener)' is no longer used  It seems to happen whenever classes that have these filters are changed.

title: remove @nooverride support for constructors
desc: I20080415-1646  Remove the @nooverride support for constructors. A constructor cannot be overridden. The super(..) in a subclass is a reference.

title: Add messages for compatible deltas
desc: We should add message for compatible deltas. Right now we only handle the breaking delta. For example, when we report a delta for a method addition in an interface that is tagged with @noimplement, we use the message defined to report a method addition in an interface that is *not* tagged with @noimplement.  I think we should add the delta restriction when we build the key for the delta's message.

title: ApiDescriptionXmlCreator NPE in test suite
desc: There have been a handleful of times now that we have seen this NPE crop up. In the I20100305-1011 build for example.  Trace:  java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiDescriptionXmlCreator.<init>(ApiDescriptionXmlCreator.java:75) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.ApiBuilderTest.exportApiComponent(ApiBuilderTest.java:327) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.compatibility.BundleMergeSplitTests.setupTest(BundleMergeSplitTests.java:348) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.compatibility.BundleMergeSplitTests.test009(BundleMergeSplitTests.java:293) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:376) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:209) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:35) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.run(CoreTestApplication.java:31) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer.callMethodWithException(EclipseAppContainer.java:587) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:198) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:110) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:79) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:369) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:179) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:619) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:574) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1406) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1382) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:34)

title: In API usage report, more details should be provided for illegal usage
desc: Trying to run api usage report on STAN IDE bundles, I found it quite difficult to know exactly what is wrong with report ILLEGAL_API usage.  The report doesn't give much details for: org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.IPropertySheetPage.  It only reports two ILLEGAL_API. With the context, we can guess this is because some types are implementing org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.IPropertySheetPage which has a superinterface with restrictions (IPage).

title: Filters for api usage report should specify on what they are applied
desc: The filters defined inside the api usage launching configuration are applied on package names and not bundle names. It would be good if this could clearly be stated in the corresponding UI.

title: Unusable options should not be enabled on Use Scan tab
desc: I20100307-2000  If you select the Analyze option to only generate HTML reports the options to clear the report location and the description should be disabled, as they have no effect during report-only creation.

title: [API Analysis application] Exceptions return success
desc: When the API Analysis application sends an exception, the application return with a 0 (success) code; giving impression everything is fine while no analysis could run.

title: NPE in API builder
desc: I20100316 When I build my workspace I get the following exception.  java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.builder.StringSet.add(StringSet.java:31) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.IncrementalApiBuilder.buildContext(IncrementalApiBuilder.java:396) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.IncrementalApiBuilder.build(IncrementalApiBuilder.java:227) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.build(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:314) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:628) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:42) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:171) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:202) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$1.run(BuildManager.java:254) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:42) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:257) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuildLoop(BuildManager.java:310) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.build(BuildManager.java:342) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.build(Workspace.java:344) at org.eclipse.ui.actions.GlobalBuildAction$1.run(GlobalBuildAction.java:179) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:54)

title: Overriden method defined in java.lang.Object should not be reported as a method addition
desc: When toString() is added to a class, it should not be seen as an API addition.

title: An application to generate .api_description files (without Ant)
desc: In order to save some CPU time during the build, instead of a script building and Ant build.xml file + the Eclipse antRunner loading the file and then triggering API file generation, it would be more straightforward (ie a bit faster to execute, and easier to maintain) to directly ship an application the generates the API file.

title: exceptions from builder state
desc: Using the code from HEAD, I started my target workspace which started re-building since I had upgraded to the newest I-build. I saw exceptions like this in my console:  java.io.EOFException at java.io.DataInputStream.readFully(DataInputStream.java:180) at java.io.DataInputStream.readUTF(DataInputStream.java:592) at java.io.DataInputStream.readUTF(DataInputStream.java:547) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BuildState.readDelta(BuildState.java:76) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BuildState.read(BuildState.java:54) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.readState(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:927) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.getLastBuiltState(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:915) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.build(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:274) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:633) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:170) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:201) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$1.run(BuildManager.java:253) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:256) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuildLoop(BuildManager.java:309) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.build(BuildManager.java:341) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.doBuild(AutoBuildJob.java:140) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.run(AutoBuildJob.java:238) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: DBCS3.6: NL Characters in the API Use Report are displayed as question mark "?".
desc: Build Identifier: I20100313-1044  Non US ASCII characters are displayed as question mark "?" when US ASCII characters are used in API Use report configuration. For instance, non US characters in the directory name for Report Output Location, and Description, the characters are corrupted. Instead, the characters are displayed as question mark "?".   Reproducible: Always  Steps to Reproduce: Steps to recreate problem: 1. Run > External Tools > External Tool Configurations. 2. Double click "API Use Report" in the left pane. 3. Click "Baselines" button in the New_configration. 4. Click "Add Baseline" button.  5. Enter NL characters in the name field.  6. Click "Reset" button, and click "Finish" button. 7. Click "OK" button. 8. Select the API baseline created in the API baseline field. 9  Enter a directory name including NL characters in the report output location. 10. Enter org\.eclipse\.debug\..* in the Reference to: field, and enter org\.eclipse\.jdt\..* in the Bundles matching: field. 11. Check "Internal references", "Clean report directory before... ", "Create HTML reports", "Clean HTML report location", and "Open report when search completes" 12. Enter NL characters in the "Description" 13. Run the API tools. (Run> External Tools > Select configuration name e.g., New configuration) 14. The report appears in the workbench but all NL characters are corrupted.  15. Browse the html files in the report created.  16. The charset in the html file is hard coded as ISO-8859-1.   Expected output: All NL character should be displayed. The charset in the html files should be the default charset.

title: error claims API type was removed, but it was internal
desc: Using HEAD  * Check out "org.eclipse.jdt.launching" from HEAD and build against a 3.3 baseline.  > Two errors appear - missing an API type, and related bundle version number problem for the breakage. However, the removed type is not API: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.ListenerList

title: Failure to write meta-data should not prevent index page from being written
desc: Created attachment 164584 [details] fix  found diagnosing bug 308885, using I20100406-1034.  If any exception occurs while trying to write the meta-data section of the index page, the entire page is not written. We should trap an exception from trying to write the meta section and continue on writing the rest of the index page.

title: Participate with the Java problem type marker grouping
desc: I20080428-1300  - have a PDE project with some warnings in the code and some API tooling problems - open the problems view, group by 'Java problem type'  You see that all API problems are sorted in 'others'  The following addition to the API tooling plugin.xml will add a new category 'API' in the Java problem type grouping placed after 'Build path problems' and 'PDE' (see bug 229308)      <extension           point="org.eclipse.ui.ide.markerSupport">     	<markerGroupingEntry id="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.jdt_category"         	markerGrouping="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.java_marker_category"         	label="API Usage and Compatibility"         	priority="83"/>         <markerAttributeGrouping              defaultGroupingEntry="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.jdt_category"              markerType="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.compatibility"/>         <markerAttributeGrouping              defaultGroupingEntry="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.jdt_category"              markerType="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.api_usage"/>         <markerAttributeGrouping              defaultGroupingEntry="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.jdt_category"              markerType="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.version_numbering"/>                                   <markerAttributeGrouping              defaultGroupingEntry="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.jdt_category"              markerType="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.api_profile"/>         <markerAttributeGrouping              defaultGroupingEntry="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.jdt_category"              markerType="org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.marker.sincetags"/>                  </extension>     Of course API tooling could think of adding even more categories (I wouldn't), or reuse the existing categories in JDT.

title: Setting / removing API baseline makes .settings/.api_filters dirty
desc: N20100418-2000  Setting / removing an API baseline makes .settings/.api_filters dirty. This causes a lot of unnecessary outgoing changes.  Steps: Check out org.eclipse.compare and then set the API baseline to 3.5.

title: Incremental build does not flag addition of invalid tags
desc: If I add an invalid javadoc tag to a class (like @noimplement), the error is not found in an incremental build. If I do a full build of the project (clean), then the error is found.

title: Not prompted to build after changing baseline
desc: I added a new baseline (3.4 M6), and set it as the default. Pressed OK.  There was no prompt to re-build the workspace.

title: changing unsupported API tag severity does not update problems
desc: If I have an existing problem for an unsupported API tag, then change the severity from error to warning, the problem remains with an error severity.

title: Filtered problems reappear sometimes
desc: Steps to reproduce using HEAD.  1) In a self-hosting workspace, check out jface databinding 2) set up  3.3.2 as the baseline 3) After the first full build, some types contain errors as not being API types anymore 4) quickfix them using Ctrl + 1 and add filter for each of them. 5) Doing this, they still come back. Not all of them.  This is repeatable and Boris has the same issue.

title: Project specific errors/warnings doesn't work anymore
desc: Changing the project's specific error/warnings levels for compatibility problems has no effect.

title: removing the last filter should remove the parent
desc: On the API filters property page, if you remove the last filter from the parent resource, the viewer should update to remove the parent.

title: DirectoryBundleContainer feature-resolution should lead to stable order like bundle-resolution
desc: When reading through org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.target.DirectoryBundleContainer I noticed that the feature resolution in resolveFeatures() is not consistent to the bundle resolution and does not lead to a stable order unlike the bundle-resolution.  I did not encountered any issues with it, but I think it should be consistent.

title: Search engine doesn't support a system bundle component
desc: If a system bundle component is passed in the search engine. It will fail with a CCE.

title: adding method to @noimplement interface flagged as error
desc: Using HEAD/latest build:  * Check out org.eclipse.core.filebuffers * Setup API tooling * 3 errors appear - two about adding method to an interface that is to be implemented, and plug-in version error  >The first 2 errors should not be present as the interface is marked as @noimplement. The plug-in version error is due to these errors.

title: Remove javadoc resolution should use the remove icon
desc: Created attachment 99570 [details] patch  The 'remove invalid javadoc tag' resolution should use the 'remove' image and not the '@' javadoc image

title: Unused filter problems should not be filterable
desc: I20100414-1200  Using the quick-fix to add problem filters can create a problem filter for an unused problem filter problem  Steps: 1. create a Java class that has an unused filter problem and at least one other kind of API problem 2. activate the quick-fix for a non-unused filter problem 3. select all of the problems to apply the filters to (should be selected be default) 4. hit ok  Happens:  You get a problem filter for the unused filter problem  Expected:  You get problems filter(s) for all problems *except* for the unused filter problem  when this happens it adds an immense amount of confusion as you will immediately get another unused filter problem for the filter you just created, if you then use the quick-fix on that one to remove it you immediately get another problem for the original unused filter.

title: API tools javadoc tags on enum or annotation types
desc: When adding @noreference to an enum constant, we add: 	/** 	 * @noreference This field is not intended to be referenced by clients. 	 */ I think we should refer to an enum constant, not a field since you can also have field inside enum types.

title: Tag scanner does not respect source level
desc: Currently when our tag scanner creates a new AST parser we do not set the correct source level (it defaults to 1.4 compliance). In the cases when we have an ICompilationUnit to scan (in the IDE) we can get the options to use. In the headless world (the ant task) we should ask the API profile for its bound EE and derive the compliance level from that.  As it stands, currently we do not respect restriction settings in any code with a compliance level of 1.5 or greater.

title: [doc] Spelling mistake in preference
desc: the compatibility preference:  Classes -> 'The superclas has been modified' needs another 's' on the word 'superclass'

title: Remove use of ExportPackageDescription.isRoot()
desc: There are two occurrences of the use of ExportPackageDescirption.isRoot():  1. ApiProfile.resolvePackage0(..) 2. BundleApiComponent.annotateExportedPackages(..)  In both case we switch on the truth value of the isRoot() method, which will always return true (which is why it is deprecated).

title: "Comparing 'project' to API baseline..." message could be better
desc: We could make the "Comparing 'project' to API baseline..."  message a bit better by adding in the name of the baseline it is being compared to.  For example:  "Comparing 'project' to Eclipse 3.3.2 API baseline..."

title: NPE opening the errors / warnings property page
desc: Created attachment 104513 [details] patch  See bug 236676 for steps (except select the API Errors/Warnings page).  The work-around is the same as well.

title: No baseline equals no scanning for analysis that doesn't require a baseline
desc: While writing the testsuite for the API tools builder I found that our analyzer short-circuits to do no work if a default API baseline is not set.  The only scan we do that requires a baseline is the compatibility checks: meaning all of our other scans are not performed when there is no default baseline set (VERY BAD).

title: Not all tag problems are reported
desc: The unsupported tag validator does not work properly for inner types when the enclosing type has a similar unsupported tag problem.  Consider the following example:  package a;  /**  * @noreference  */ public class InnerTest {  	/** 	 * @noreference  	 */ 	class InnerTestInner { 		 	} }  the unsupported tag will only be reported on the enclosing type. The reason is that we are using a set to collect tag problems, and the problem ids and message arguments match in the given two cases. We were stung by this problem before using a set for collecting problems...

title: Doc clarification - type member or member type
desc: In the following file: eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.doc.user\reference\api-tooling\preferences\ref-errorswarnings.htm  Two sentences read as follows:  A type member (annotation not tagged as '@noimplement') has been added  When enabled the API analysis builder will check if any member types have been added to API annotations that have not been tagged as @noimplement.   In the first sentence it says "type member" but in the second sentence it says "member type".  Which is correct?

title: Cannot enter Report Conversion Patterns on API Use Report External Tool Launch
desc: Build ID: I20100608-0911 (3.6rc4a)    1. Create an External Tool Launch for an API Use Report 2. Switch to the "Patterns" tab 3. Press "Add..." 4. Pick "Report Conversion Pattern", Next 5. Enter any Pattern, Finish  --> On the Launch Config dialog, the "Apply" button is not enabled --> When switching to the "API Use Report" tab and back, the new pattern is gone --> When choosing "Run", the new pattern is gone  It looks like the lack of a defined "Kind" for the report conversion pattern might be causing the problem that it cannot be saved.  I once got an NPE logged while playing with API Tooling, but it's likely not related to this issue:  java.lang.NullPointerException at title: API baseline setting not persisted
desc: Steps to reproduce: 1. Set the api baseline to a valid location. 2. Disable the api baseline by unchecking the checkbox in preferences>Plug-in developement>api baseline 3. restart eclipse  API tooling is enabled again, the checkbox is enabled.

title: API Use Report provides no Common tab
desc: Build ID: I20100608-0911 (3.6rc4a)  I used File > Export > Run/Debug > Launch Configurations in order to export my API Tools Report setup and share it with others in the team. Since the exported Launch is in my Workspace, I now have 2 identical copies of my API Use Report.  It looks like the "Common" tab which is used to show private vs. shared Launch Configurations is missing from the API Usage Report LaunchTabGroup.

title: Consistently use "API Tools" (not "API Tooling")
desc: 3.6.  We should consistently use "API Tools" (not "API Tooling"). Especially in the documentation.

title: [api tooling]  Show API closure of classes
desc: From bug 180706, we should be able to point the API Tool at a class/package/bundle and use it to ensure that only API classes are exposed in its method signatures, etc.  I have some code to use as a start for this if you are interested. You point it to a directory with class files and then enter the name of the class or package that you want to analyze. It follows all the public/protected methods/fields and prints out all of the classes that are exposed.

title: Baseline wizard does not indicate what it is doing
desc: I20101123-0800  When you go to create a new API baseline the wizard reports progress correctly, but it no longer says what it is doing - just progress with no message any more.

title: Use scan preference page does not validate archives
desc: code from HEAD  The new Use scan preference page allows you to select an archive that contains a use scan, which is pretty cool, but currently you can select *any* archive, and no validation is done on it to see if it actually has a use scan in it.  When the build runs with an archive that does not contain a use scan you get this handsome exception:  java.lang.Exception: The directory that contains xml reports must be specified at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.search.UseScanParser.parse(UseScanParser.java:230) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.search.UseScanManager.fetch(UseScanManager.java:181) at I am assuming I get one per project that got built (before I cancelled the build).

title: Polish Use Scan Feature
desc: I had no performance issues in my tests.  I haven't tried with an overly large (100+ project workspace) yet.  Issues:  1) I think we should revisit the pref page name.  The current one is long (doesn't fit in the default sized dialog), not very clear and does not start with 'API' like the other API tooling pages.  My suggestions would be: "API Use Dependencies" "API Dependency Scans" "API Use Scans" Make the API tooling pages have their own branch in the pref tree)  We originally moved away from using 'use scans' as it is not a user friendly term.  However, only users that are familiar with use scans will ever have a use for this tool.  2) Problem category should match up exactly with the preference page name.  We need to use a consistent name, otherwise users won't understand where the problems are coming from.  3) The problems should be associated with the type name if it can be calculated so they show up in the editor.  4) Preference page should have a link to the error level page.  5) Error levels should not be ignore by default.  Currently the user sets up the scan on the preference page, it asks you if you want to build and you say "great, go for it".  No errors are reported, which is perfect until you realize that there are no errors being reported period.  6) Is there any value to letting the user change the cache size?  As a user I have know idea what a reasonable value it and whether it would be beneficial for me to change it.  No need to give the user an advanced option unless there is a definite need by some users.  7) The text at the top of the page needs a bit of work.  It shouldn't say *the* api use scan problems.  Second sentence should perhaps read "The dependencies found in the use scans will be compared against workspace projects to ensure they still exist."  8) Edit locations button should be removed, it adds no real value.  9) There is no help doc for the page, we should file a bug to remind us to write doc in M6.

title: Edit button is the new delete button
desc: code from HEAD  Steps:  1. add an location on the API use scans page 2. edit the location 3. do not change the location in any way, press OK on the file dialog 4. watch as your location is deleted.

title: Warning/Error for missing API Tools EE description
desc: N20110109-2000  Set the option "Preferences > API Errors/Warnings > API Use > General > Invalid references to system libraries" to Warning or Error.  => When no environment descriptions are installed and a project would need the descriptions in order to flag bad references (because there's no strictly compatible JRE for the execution environment available), then API Tools should show a warning/error on the project.  Background: Currently, some of our projects have the option "Preferences > Java Compiler > Building > No strictly compatible JRE for execution environment found" set to Error to make sure nobody accidentally writes new code against a newer JRE than allowed.  This was OK as long as older JREs were still available, but nowadays, it's difficult (or e.g. on the Mac even impossible) to get a 1.4 JRE install to compile against. We should eventually set the JDT/Core option to Ignore and rely on the API Tools option, but we currently can't do that because the environment descriptions are not installed by default and the API Tools compiler silently skips that problem.  An alternative to this solution would be to make it easier to add a dummy EE install for every EE. In the rt CVS repository, /org.eclipse.osgi/osgi/ contains dummy *.ee files for the OSGI-Minimum and CDC/Foundation-1.1 environments, but similar files are not available for other EEs (e.g. J2SE-1.4).

title: Searching only for illegal API Use throws exception
desc: Build Identifier: 3.7M4  When searching only for illegal API with the following attributes set: considerapi="false" considerinternal="false" considerillegaluse="true"   This exception is thrown by the API Use Ant Task: Exception: "Build stopping - neither API nor internal references are being searched for at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.tasks.ApiUseTask.assertParameters(ApiUseTask.java:265)"    Reproducible: Always

title: UseReportConverter prints out reference plus value(s) for "API patterns"
desc: Build Identifier: 3.7M4  To reproduce: 1. Run the API Use Ant Task with attribute:   apipatterns=".*"  2. Convert the XML report to HTML using the API Use Report Conversion Ant Task. The resulting HTML will report the used API patterns as :  API Patterns: 	[Ljava.lang.String;@b524aa.*  I looked at the code and the problem appears to be in class UseReportConverter, where the API patterns string array is appended directly:  String[] patterns = this.metadata.getApiPatterns(); if(patterns != null) { 	buffer.append(this.metadata.getApiPatterns()); 	for (int i = 0; i < patterns.length; i++) { 		buffer.append(patterns[i]).append(BR); 	} }  Reproducible: Always

title: Need to clean up api descriptions when projects are deleted
desc: Currently once an API description has been created in metadata it becomes a permanent resident, meaning it is never deleted. This has a very negative impact on the metadata size as some API descriptions can be quite large and if you add / remove projects alot (say in a testing workspace) the metadata grows monotonically with the size of each new API description.  Steps:  1. create an API-aware plugin project 2. build the project to get is API description 3. delete the project  Expected:  API tooling artifacts are removed as well  Happens:  no clean up at all takes place

title: API Tools builder doesn't detect classpath changes
desc: Fup of bug 336632, the API Tools builder doesn't force a full build when org.apache.ant is replaced with a newer version. apt.core project has this project on its classpath and should therefore be rebuilt if org.apache.ant is replaced with a newer version. This happens in AUTO_BUILD mode where the Java builder detects the classpath change and does a full build of apt.core. The API Tools builder doesn't see the classpath change and as there is no other changes, it doesn't rebuild the apt.core project. This is causing some problems not to be removed. See bug 336632 comment 7.

title: API problems not being created properly on inner interfaces
desc: Created attachment 110007 [details] project with the snippet example in it  Consider the following snippet from the attached project:  public interface test5 {  }  interface outer {   interface inner extends Iinternal {   } }  The inner interface 'inner' should be flagged as a leak error for extending the internal type Iinternal. This works if the editor is open, but does not produce a problem marker when test5.java is not open in the editor.  The reason is from our use of findType(..) when creating a marker: we need to be using the findTypes(..) that considers secondary types as well.  NB. in all cases the analyzer finds the correct IAPIProblem, its just that no problem marker is created.

title: [api tooling] stress test setup and build
desc: We need to try the following:  * Check out all SDK plug-ins as source * Set up API tooling on all plug-ins * Ensure source changes are reasonable (application of component.xml) * Examine API errors in workspace to see what people will have to deal with when using the tool for the first time  Use the hand crafted 3.3 API baseline (i.e. existing component.xml's).

title: API tooling creates wrong 'Missing @since tag' errors
desc: I20080812-0800.  I edited two files (only method body!) that did not change since 3.4 and got API tooling errors saying that a @since tag is missing. I'm using 3.4 as baseline.  Here are the files: org.eclipse.jdt.ui.OverrideIndicatorLabelDecorator org.eclipse.jdt.ui.ProblemsLabelDecorator  What's also strange: the errors did not appear when I set the baseline. Only after changing the those files the errors appeared.  Now I cannot get rid of them again (clean + build does not help).

title: Add org.eclipse.team.core.fileTypes extension for .api_filters
desc: Add an org.eclipse.team.core.fileTypes extension for ".api_filters". They should be ASCII by default.

title: UI glitches on 'API Use Report' launch configuration page
desc: 3.7 M7.  - mnemonic clashes for 'n', 'c', 'y' (BAD as it hides Apply) - labels in sentence style (e.g. "Report Output Location", "Report Type")

title: Clean up EE description fragments
desc: 3.7.  The Eclipse project update site (http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/3.7) lists the JRE execution environment descriptions. There are some issues with them:  1. "PDE/API Tools Environment Descriptions" EE description. The details section says it is for JRE-1.1 but below there is already: "PDE/API Tools Environment Descriptions JRE 11" ==> "PDE/API Tools Environment Descriptions" entry needs to be removed or fixed.  2. Use a better name: those are not API Tools Environment descriptions but    JRE Execution Environment descriptions.  3. Don't use plural: each of the entries is one description.  4. Use the correct EE names as listed on the 'Execution Environments'     preference page (e.g. "JavaSE-1.6" instead of "J2SE 16").       For example: "PDE/API Tools JRE EE Description for 'J2SE-1.6' or: "PDE's JRE EE Description for 'J2SE-1.6'

title: Clean up 'API Errors/Warnings' preference page
desc: 3.7.  The 'API Errors/Warnings' preference page has several issues:  1. The naming is confusing:    - the group label talks about "environments"    - the first sentence talks about "execution descriptions"    - and then it talks about additional "environment descriptions"    ==> those are executions environments   2. It says "Additional are available" even if I already installed all of    them.    ==> Either we know when all are  installed or we use another label, e.g.:    "<Install additional execution environments>. I would make that as a link.  3. After clicking the 'install them now' link, the user is lost. He has no    clue which site to choose and what to select.    ==> Best would be if we can feed the site plus pre-select the correct IUs.        If that's not possible, we need to give more hints on the preference        page itself.  4. The F1 help should have a link to    http://wiki.eclipse.org/Execution_Environments

title: leak problems removed for final fields with @noreference tag
desc: using N20080901-2000  Currently you can place an @noreference tag on a final field (which is not allowed) and it will remove API leak problems. The placement of an unsupported tag should not modify any problems on the field.  Steps:  1. using the attached test project build testFTL5  Expected: that there are 8 API field type leak problems  Happens:  there are only 4 of them, the unsupported tag is suppressing the leak problem for final fields

title: remove export code from AbstractApiComponent
desc: Currently there a noticable amount of code in AbstractApiComponent for writing it to a zip file, which is not used anywhere and should be removed.

title: [api tools] use 1.0.0.qualifier as version
desc: All the bundles within API Tools should change their bundle version to 1.0.0.qualifier before they move to PDE.

title: Make it easier to find filter removal UI
desc: I20080916-2000.  Normally I look for PDE tooling stuff in the 'PDE Tools' sub-menu but this didn't work for filter removal. It would be nice see a 'Remove API Problem Filters'. Same could then maybe also provided directly on the .api_filters file itself.

title: Do not allow users to filter missing EE description problems
desc: Created attachment 201103 [details] fix  FUP to bug 333866 - we should not be providing the 'create problem filter...' quick-fix for the missing EE description problems.  The attached patch prevents the filter quick-fix from being presented and also provides a quick-fix to directly install the EE descriptions.

title: API Errors/Warnings severity fishy
desc: N20110810-2000.  Something is fishy when determining the severity of an API Errors/Warnings problem.  1. start new workspace 2. set 'Missing execution environment descriptions' to 'Warning' 3. checkout 'org.eclipse.ui.navigator' from HEAD ==> WRONG: error after build due to missing EE description 4. open the 'API Errors/Warnings' property page for the project ==> OK: the page  indicates that the problem should be reported as warning

title: Incremental build produces an additional missing EE description marker for each build
desc: Version: 3.8.0 Build id: I20110823-0925  Steps 1. new workspace 2. remove all EE descriptions you have installed 3. check out org.eclipse.ui.navigator 4. wait for a build you get an error marker for no ee descriptions (OK) 5. edit any file in ui.navigator and save - you get another error marker for no ee descriptions (BAD)

title: [api tooling] API breakage filters should also work on MANIFEST.MF file
desc: When a breakage is reported against an api component, we create the marker on the manifest file. It would be good if the filter could support the filtering of these markers as well.

title: Many tests are not Java 7 friendly
desc: Version: 3.8.0 Build id: I20111005-0925  code from master.  While running a bunch of tests using Java 7 I was getting some odd and inconsistent failures. One was an NPE in ClassFileScannerTests#testScanInnerStaticInnerClass() - caused because the test relies on an earlier test to set up the environment.  We should do a full pass of the test suite to find other tests that could fail in the same manner.

title: API leak issues should be filtered out on members tagged with @noreference
desc: In JDT/Core, there are four warnings for using a non-API type as the parameter of a method tagged as @noreference. These warnings should not be issued.

title: @nooverride  should not be proposed for a static method
desc: A static method cannot be overriden. So we should not propose it as a possible code assist.

title: Use scan API problems use a flag that collides with NO_FLAGS
desc: FUP to bug 310547  When the builder finds a use scan reference that has been deleted it creates a problem using the flag value 0 to mean deleted, but that value collides with IApiProblem.NO_FLAGS (value 0, used through out the tooling to determine if any flags at all are set).

title: Javadoc tag autocomplete does not work at the end of a tag
desc: Version: 4.3.0 Build id: I20130416-0800  (also before this)  If you type in the complete tag and then try to autocomplete it nothing happens.  For example you type @noextend (carat next to 'd') and try to auto complete it nothing happens. We should be able to auto-complete the tag + fragment even if the tag is already typed.  The problem was in our completion proposal computer #acceptTag method, where we short-circuit when the tag name appears in a listing of existing names.

title: We should not load the profiles when opening the baseline preference page
desc: Using I20080918-0100, I noticed that it was really slow to open the preference page: Window>Preferences>Plug-in Development>API Baselines once a baseline has been defined and no build occurred. On the first opening, it looks like we are validating the baseline again. I don't think we should do this on the opening of the page. The first build should validate the baseline. And this is done in the main thread. This means the UI doesn't refresh during this operation.  3XMTHREADINFO      "main" TID:0x0013BB00, j9thread_t:0x0001511C, state:CW, prio=6 3XMTHREADINFO1            (native thread ID:0x15C8, native priority:0x6, native policy:UNKNOWN) 4XESTACKTRACE          at java/io/WinNTFileSystem.getBooleanAttributes(Native Method) 4XESTACKTRACE          at java/io/File.isFile(File.java:791(Compiled Code)) title: [api tooling] api tool builder should check the preferences before doing api usage scan
desc: If all options for api usage scan are set to ignore, there is no point to run the api usage scanner for the project.

title: [api tooling] @since tag checker should handle inherited doc
desc: When I have {@inheritDoc} inside a javadoc, the @since tag checker might not want to report an problem.

title: Missing full stop in Javadoc of @noreference for class and interface
desc: The Javadoc of @noreference tag does not have the full stop at the end of the sentence, for class and interface types (unlike @noextend and @noimplement).

title: [regression] API tooling complains about missing @since tag for an interface method that has @noreference tag
desc: API tooling produces "Missing @since tag on getEvaluation()" error message for	http://git.eclipse.org/c/cdt/org.eclipse.cdt.git/tree/core/org.eclipse.cdt.core/parser/org/eclipse/cdt/core/dom/ast/IValue.java line 35. API tooling in Eclipse 3.8.2 was satisfied by the @noreference tag.

title: Adding "final" and "@nooverride" confuses API Tool
desc: Build id: I20080918-0100  Steps: 1. Set the baseline to Eclipse 3.4 2. Check out any project from Eclipse repository (e.g. org.eclipse.core.resources) 3. Add "@nooverride" to an API method (e.g. RefreshProvider#resetMonitors), an API Tool error occurs 4. Add "final" to the same method, the API Tool error disappears  5. Remove "final", the error is back

title: Content assist does not work on an interface field or method unless explicitly marked as public
desc: 1) Open an API interface (i.e. IPluginModelBase in PDE) 2) Add a new field, do not mark it as public (String stuff = "stuff") 3) Add javadoc, type @noref, hit ctrl-space Result: Nothing happens, no content assist  If you fill in the @noreference tag manually, it is not marked as a bad tag. If you mark the field as public (public String stuff = "stuff"), content assist will work again.  A field in the interface is always treated as public, but our content assist isn't recognizing that.

title: API tools problems line numbers appear off by one
desc: Created attachment 113119 [details] screen shot  I20080914-2000  All of the API tools problems that get created are off by one, or appear that way in the problems view. In the editor the underlining, etc happens on the correct line and double-clicking the problem takes you to the correct location, so I am not sure what is happening.  See attached screenshot showing a variety of API tools problems all on the wrong line number (according to the problems view).  Rebuilding / cleaning and rebuilding does not change anything.

title: CCE in TagValidator.visit
desc: Created attachment 232086 [details] stack trace  I'm getting a CCE during the full build: Errors running builder 'API Analysis Builder' on project 'org.eclipse.xtext.junit4'. Stack trace is attached. The corresponding project can be found here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/tmf/org.eclipse.xtext.git/tree/plugins/org.eclipse.xtext.junit4

title: API Tools content assist proposals not available with new "Java Proposals" category
desc: I20081007-1600  On the "Java > Editor > Content Assist > Advanced" preference page, make sure "Java Proposals" is checked in the first list, and "Java Non-Type Proposals" is unchecked (the current default). Now, content assist will no longer propose @no* completions from the API tools.  The problem is probably that you contribute to the "Java Non-Type Proposals" category. You should rather create a new PDE category for your proposals.

title: @nooverride tag should not be proposed for final classes
desc: While looking at bug 247677, I realized we should not propose @nooverride as a tag for methods in classes that can not be extended.

title: Remove stub generation code
desc: We can remove the stub generation code in API tools since we are no longer planning to use stubs for API tooling.

title: [api tooling] Got  "@noinstantiate null" while converting org.eclipse.update.configurator.IPlatformConfigurationFactory
desc: I got this line inside the type when converting it to be a api tooling project.

title: use correct resource encoding when reading .java files
desc: API Tools should use the correct resource encoding from the workspace when reading .java files.  I use the setup from bug 377107 comment 9 (with the last attached charset64to32.jar), which transforms e.g. "long /*int*/" (ASCII bits on disk) into "int /*LONG*/" (Eclipse chars).  But now I get compiler problems like this, which don't make sense:  Missing @since tag on gtk_new(Device, int)	Cursor.java	/org.eclipse.swt/Eclipse SWT/gtk/org/eclipse/swt/graphics	line 550	@since tag problem  My API Baseline is also set to a 32-bit build, so everything should be fine with this declaration. And when I change the type to "int", then the problem disappears. It looks like the analyzer doesn't use the correct encoding, but the error message is issued against the correct IMethod with the "int" parameter type.

title: infrastructure: make search criteria more flexible
desc: One of the M3 work items is to re-work our API use/leak analysis to make the search criteria more specialized so they are more efficient for specific kinds of searching (i.e. avoid general regex pattern recognition, any-depth element matching/containment, etc).

title: [api tooling] @noextend not available for interfaces
desc: @noextend is not available for interfaces in the completion proposal.

title: API tools should work with unresolved bundles
desc: The apitooling.analysis and apitooling.apifreeze tasks should be usable with a bunch of bundles that aren't fully resolved.  A component owner or product owner should be able to feed just the bundles he owns through the tooling without having to gather all the dependencies necessary to have a fully resolved Eclipse instance.

title: IApiComponent should be an IApiElement
desc: most of the model elements for the API tooling have been migrated over to be the new IApiElements, except for IApiComponent. This should be done so it can be correctly used in the heirarchy of elements and so that we can alleviate some of the many handles to API components

title: rename IClassFile and IClassFileContainer
desc: We should rename this abstractions to reflect that they contain type's rather than class files. The types could be class files or source files.

title: [api tooling] fragments packages are not considered as API even if the host is exporting them
desc: If you load org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility.registry and org.eclipse.equinox.registry, you will get binary compatibility errors because of removed type. The types are there, but are not considered as API anymore.  If I add the Export-Package directive for the package org.eclipse.core.runtime inside the manifest.mf file of the fragment, it works again.  This means that the fragment doesn't see the api packages described by the host.

title: Should not build when changes to .api_filters are detected
desc: I20081021-0905  If you have autobuild off, and you check in a change to .api_filters, it builds your project. I expect that it builds the project only when I press the build button.

title: The API generation task should always overwrite
desc: Currently is you run the API generation task and you already have a .api_description file where it would create a new one the task short-circuits and prints a non-descript message to the console that there was a .api_description file there already.  Personally I can't think of any reason why you would want to keep the old .api_description file when running the Ant task - its a pretty explicit set of steps to do no work.

title: [api tooling] No binary breakage should be reported for a protected field change in a final class
desc: Using HEAD, the class org.eclipse.jdt.core.CompletionProposal reports a binary breakage because of a protected field constant value has been modified. This should not be reported since the class is final. The javadoc tag @noextend is not there, because a final class cannot be implicitely subclassed.

title: speed up tag tests
desc: Created attachment 115944 [details] patch  We should be able to speed up the tag tests - we create/delete/build an entire project for each test. We should be able to create each test file without having to re-create the entire project.  Attached patch attempts to undo changes after each test. For some reason the tests start to fail when they reach the InvalidAnnotationFieldTagTests.

title: plug-in version error appears on second build
desc: Steps:  * new workspace * check out these projects from CVS:      org.eclipse.core.variables      org.eclipse.debug.core      org.eclipse.debug.ui      org.eclipse.jdt.debug      org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui      org.eclipse.jdt.launching * Set up API tooling on all the projects > note: note errors in org.eclipse.debug.ui * Modify IDebugElement > add @noextend > an error appears in org.eclipse.debug.ui about its version number:  "The minor version should be incremented in version 3.3.0.v20070607-1800, since new APIs have been added since version 3.3.100.qualifier"  I would expect the error to appear on the first build.

title: tooling setup wizard does nothing without a preview
desc: with the way the text edits are lazily collected in the api tooling setup wizard, if you press the finihs button when the wizard initially opens (without doing a preview) it will do nothing.  there are two things we can do:  1. more aggresively load the text changes, or just do them when the user presses finish (needs more logic to track if the user has seen a preview or not and if we should recompute them, etc)  2. we could force a preview.  I vote option 2 (it only requires setting a boolean flag).

title: [api tooling] IllegalStateException on rebuild after a bundle version has been updated
[api tools] Missing @since tag version should be based on the right bundle version
desc: When a bundle needs to have its minor version incremented and also has an error for missing @since tag, the new @since tag value should be the plugin version modified, not the current version.

title: Invalid API error reported against OSGi
desc: I20081104-0916  * Check org.eclipse.osgi out from HEAD (note, it's found in dev.eclipse.org:cvsroot/rt/org.eclipse.equinox/framework/bundles) * An error appears:  Description	Resource	Path	Location	Type The interface org.osgi.service.condpermadmin.ConditionalPermissionInfoBase adds method getGrantDecision() to org.osgi.service.condpermadmin.ConditionalPermissionInfo that is tagged as @noimplement	ConditionalPermissionInfo.java	org.eclipse.osgi/osgi/src/org/osgi/service/condpermadmin	line 26	Compatibility Problem  > However, there is no @noimplement tag anywhere on the interface.

title: Move API Tools to a 1.6 BREE
desc: We would like to investigate adding annotation support for API tools (replacement for using Javadoc tags), and will need to be 1.5+.

title: [1.8] NPE comparing 1.8 bytecodes
desc: Steps:  1. new workspace 2. new plugin project -> 1.8EE + compiler level 3. export as deployable 4. new API baseline - point to the export in 3. 5. build your workspace title: Convert API Tools Javadoc tags not converting tags on method
desc: I ran the conversion tool on "org.eclipse.jdt.junit" where it converts the @noextend Javadoc tag on class JUnitLaunchConfigurationTab to the corresponding annotation.  However, if I add the following javadoc to a method in the above class, say #getId, and run the conversion, it only converts the @noextend tag on class but leaves the @nooverride tags on the method as it is.  /**  * @nooverride This method is not intended to be re-implemented or extended by clients.  */

title: Fields incorrectly assume type restrictions
desc: While testing bug 434320 I found that a field in a restricted class had assumed not-applicable restrictions.  Steps:  1. Change the fMethodsCacheKey field in JUnitLaunchConfigurationTab to:  /**   * @noreference This field is not intended to be referenced by clients.  */ public String fMethodsCacheKey;  2. run the conversion tool 3.notice it wants to add @NoReference (good) and @NoExtend(?? bad)  Our restriction resolution does ask parent elements for enclosing restrictions, but in this case a field cannot have noextend restrictions.

title: org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.generator uses CPL
desc: While checking for missing copyright I found out that org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.generator still uses CPL.  Please check whether this is intentional or just an oversight.

title: clean up ids for nature/builder
desc: I changed the ids for our project nature and builder for consistency:  * apiAnalysisBuilder * apiAnalysisNature

title: Java 8 API errors on ZonedDateTime#isBefore(ChronoZonedDateTime) and #toEpochSecond()
desc: BuildId: 4.4.0.I20140606-1215  The API execution environments for JavaSE-1.8 seem to be missing ZonedDateTime.isBefore(ChronoZonedDateTime).  Steps to repeat:  1. Create s plugin project with a JavaSE-1.8 EE with an activator and enable API analysis. 2. Paste the following snippet into the Activator's start() method:  	ZonedDateTime now = ZonedDateTime.now(); 	if (now.isBefore(now.plus(Duration.ofDays(1)))) { 		now.toEpochSecond(); 	}  3. Save.  Notice the isBefore() and toEpochSecond() methods are marked as API errors:     The method ZonedDateTime.isBefore(ChronoZonedDateTime) referenced in java8bug.Activator.start(BundleContext) is not defined in the bundle's required execution environment: JavaSE-1.8

title: API Tools should use the new PixelConverter class
desc: @see bug 251280.   API Tools should us the new PixelConverter class

title: IApiProblemDetector.createProblems() should take a progress monitor as parameter
desc: It could be a long running task and it prevents any sub detector to check for cancelation requests.

title: API Tools should remove use of deprecated preferences code
desc: With the recent deprecation of the 'old' preferences framework, we should migrate to using IEclipsePreferences and IPreferenceService

title: [api tooling]  generate a fake ee file for testing purpose
desc: In order to get a more robust ee file to use for the test harness, I suggest to generate a fake 1.5 one in case there is none passed as an argument. The bootclasspath of the running VM could be used.

title: Misleading error message on added field
desc: Using HEAD, I get three errors in debug.ui like:  The field org.eclipse.debug.ui.IDebugUIConstants.DEBUG_CONTEXT_SOURCE_NAME in an interface that is intended to be implemented has been added  I think the real problem is that the interface needs to specify @noextend as well as @noimplement now (since adding a field to a type that can be extended breaks binary compatibility - http://wiki.eclipse.org/Evolving_Java-based_APIs_2#Evolving_API_Classes - the field may hide an inherited field).

title: NPE from BaseApiAnalyzer
desc: Using HEAD, I found the following exception in my target workspace .log. Not steps to reproduce, but the NPE looks quite possible based on the Javadoc for IJavaElement.getResource().  java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BaseApiAnalyzer.checkUnusedProblemFilters(BaseApiAnalyzer.java:286) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BaseApiAnalyzer.analyzeComponent(BaseApiAnalyzer.java:252) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.build(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:637) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.build(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:340) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:633) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:170) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:201) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$1.run(BuildManager.java:253) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:256) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuildLoop(BuildManager.java:309) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.build(BuildManager.java:341) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.doBuild(AutoBuildJob.java:140) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.run(AutoBuildJob.java:238) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: add version numbers to our external files
desc: We should add version numbers to our external files (.api_description and .api_filters), so we can evolve the file content/meaning.

title: Problem filters should not be severity sensitive
desc: Currently we store problem severity in IApiProblem. Instead, we should dynamically obtain the problem severity from the workspace settings. This way, a problem filter will not be selective on severity (i.e. if "developer 1" filters a problem as an error, but "developer 2" has the same problem set as a warning, the shared filter will only filter the "error" and not the "warning").  We can render problem filters based on the workspace severity settings.

title: [api tooling] source bundles seem to appear against inside the profile wizard
desc: Using HEAD, it looks like the source bundles appear again when creating a new profile and setting the plugin location. They used to be filtered out. The call to org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.IApiComponent#isSourceComponent() should return true for these plugins.

title: Replace usage of SubProgressMonitor with SubMonitor in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui
desc: See also Bug 477527.

title: No way to get rid of api tooling errors
desc: I have o.e.ui.console as source in my workspace. When I updated from HEAD I got an API error on the project and in the Problems view (A default API profile has not been set for the current workspace).  Neither cleaning and rebuilding nor replacing with an earlier version of the project makes the error go away. I then tried to close and reopen - no luck.  Please don't introduce yet another problem kind that doesn't go away on clean. Clean should do what it says: clean.

title: [api tooling] Addition of a type member inside an interface should not be a binary breakage
desc: The addition of a type member inside the interface should not be seen as an binary incompatible change. It is not source compatible, but it remains binary compatible.

title: [api tooling] Quickfix for api filter should be more verbose
desc: When I want to filter a problem, if the same member has two problems I get twice the same quickfix description. I don't know which one corresponds to the problem I want to filter.  Steps to reproduce: 1) Inside a fresh workspace set up a 3.3.0 baseline profile 2) Checkout jdt.ui and build. Look at the errors in org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaUI. 3) Select a field in this class and use quickfix.

title: [api tooling] Should not report a binary breakage on a private method
desc: This must be a consequence of the changes on the kinds. Building org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring from HEAD against 3.3.0 produces a binary incompatible change for a static keyword added on a private method.

title: [api tooling] Quickfix for missing @since tag should not add the tag twice
desc: If you work with autobuild off and you fix one missing @since tag, you can add it twice if you select the previous error. This should be a no-op.

title: Should have error marker in manifest.mf for bundle version errors
desc: Currently, when there is an error with bundle versions, a problem appears in the problem view, but after navigating to the manifest.mf file where the error exists, there is no error/marker in the vertical ruler.

title: [API Analysis application] Exceptions return success
desc: When the API Analysis application sends an exception, the application return with a 0 (success) code; giving impression everything is fine while no analysis could run.

title: Resolve API references (use scan) in alternate baseline
desc: Scenario:  An API use scan of a product is generated showing API/internal references to a specific version (X) of the SDK on which the product runs/depends. The SDK continues development on the next release (version Y). The product wants to migrate to the new version (Y) of the SDK. It would be interesting to be able to show what API/internal references are broken (if any) on version Y of the SDK based on the use scan from version X.

title: An application to generate .api_description files (without Ant)
desc: In order to save some CPU time during the build, instead of a script building and Ant build.xml file + the Eclipse antRunner loading the file and then triggering API file generation, it would be more straightforward (ie a bit faster to execute, and easier to maintain) to directly ship an application the generates the API file.

title: NPE during save cycle
desc: I20090809-2000  After I imported jdt.ui to my target workspace I got the following NPE during a workspace save cycle:  java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ProjectApiDescription.getJavaProject(ProjectApiDescription.java:611) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ProjectApiDescription.getXML(ProjectApiDescription.java:722) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiDescriptionManager.saving(ApiDescriptionManager.java:353) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.ApiPlugin.saving(ApiPlugin.java:462) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.executeLifecycle(SaveManager.java:343) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager$1.run(SaveManager.java:160) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:42) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.broadcastLifecycle(SaveManager.java:163) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:1012) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:991) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.DelayedSnapshotJob.run(DelayedSnapshotJob.java:44) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: API use scan considers inner types more than once
desc: Build id: I20090825-1032  * Run an API use scan against the 3.5 SDK searching for internal references to 'org\.eclipse\.debug\..*' from 'org\.eclipse\.jdt\..*' * Notice that there are 3 references to org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.variables.details.DetailPaneProxy.getCurrentControl() all from the same line:  org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.ExpressionInformationControlCreator.ExpressionInformationControl.DetailPaneContainer.paneChanged(String) 165  org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.ExpressionInformationControlCreator.ExpressionInformationControl.DetailPaneContainer.paneChanged(String) 165  org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.ExpressionInformationControlCreator.ExpressionInformationControl.DetailPaneContainer.paneChanged(String) 165  It looks like the intter type (DetailPaneContainer) is scanned 3 times. Once for each enclosing type, and itself.

title: [api tooling] addition of a protected field inside a class that can be extended should not be flagged as an error
desc: The addition of a protected field inside a class that can be extended should be considered as a compatible change.

title: [api tooling] Wrong @since version not detected
desc: Steps to reproduce: 1) Check out org.eclipse.core.jobs inside your workspace 2) Convert it to be an api tooling project 3) Set a default profile 4) Build 5) Add a method in org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs.IJobChangeEvent without @since tag. e.g.:      public void foo(); 6) Rebuild. 7) I'll see that the MANIFEST.MF file has an error about the fact that the plugin version should be incremented. 8) Use quickfix on the method foo(). It has an error saying that there is a missing @since tag. 9) 3.3 is suggested (We should suggest 3.4. See bug 219535). 10) Go to the MANIFEST.MF file and use quickfix. 11) Plugin version is now 3.4.0, but the foo() method is not tagged with an invalid @since tag error. 3.3 is not the right version for a new API.

title: Profile pref page: should use check box for default
desc: I20080226-1155.  The preference pages I know (like Installed JREs, EE) use a check box for default selection. API tooling should not introduce a new style.

title: [api tooling] Cannot set a default profile anymore
desc: Using HEAD, the default profile is never remembered. So nothing happens during the build. This needs to be fixed asap.

title: Allow to override/specify internal/API package name patterns in API use scan
desc: Some projects do not use API tooling (i.e. projects are not configured to use API tooling in the IDE). Some projects export all their internal packages without using the x-internal modifier (to identify internal packages). In such cases, all packages of a bundle are seen as API, when in fact the .internal packages are intended to be non-API.  We should consider this case when initializing an API description for a bundle (i.e. no API description and no x-internal modifiers and .internal package names exist).

title: Use scan visitor should have deterministic order
desc: The order in which a use scan visitor visits components/referencing components should be consistent. This makes it easier to do things such as compare two scans.

title: Hide EE selection from user
desc: The user should not be forced to select an EE for API profiles - we should use the same EE as used for the workspace profile.  Would be nice to reveal resolution errors to the user somehow - so they know why some bundles cannot be analyzed.

title: Profiles need to re-bind EE/VM as VM installs change
desc: We need profiles to update as VM installs are added/removed such that the VM they are bound to might change:  * a VM might be removed that a profile is bound to * a VM might be added that better satisfies the bundle requirements in profile  In both cases, the pofile needs to re-bind its VM/EE.

title: Improve labels on Binary Incompatibility tab
desc: I20080305-1100  - Open preference page: API Error/Warning On the second tab:  As a API tooling novice, trying to understand the page for the first time I failed... Maybe the page needs to have a longer description or needs a link to a help page.  My guess, after reading the WIKI is, that this is about comparing the code to a reference build.  What does 'API profile: Removed API component' mean? A type that was API got removed? What is a API component?  'Removed some execution environment'. What does 'Some' mean? Maybe 'Less execution environments supported?'  'Removed type'. I assume this means 'A type that was API got removed?'  'Annotation' 'Enum', 'Classes',.... Is it to be expected that the user wants to fine tune all the cases? Or would it be possible to have only few of these settings or even one setting? I assume in the end it's all about 'compatible or not'. Or is there a gray area?   What's the difference between 'Removed interface bounds' and 'Removed interface bound'?

title: [api tooling] @reference null is inserted for some internal classes inside API packages
desc: When trying to convert the JDT/Core project, I got: @noreference null for classes with package visibility inside API packages.  For example, org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTConverter or org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.AnnotationBinding.

title: [api tooling] "Unable to resolve method signature" when adding @noreference in a method on the next build
desc: Api tooling builder failed once the @noreference in the javadoc of the method org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.AST.convertCompilationUnit(int, CompilationUnitDeclaration, Map, boolean, CompilationUnit, int, IProgressMonitor) in the jdt/core plugin.  For now I won't add the javadoc tags as the next build will fail.

title: [api tooling] Add @noreference support for delta creation
desc: Right now the delta creation doesn't check the @noreference for methods and fields. Any "breaking" change to a method with @noreference should be converted to a compatible change.

title: NPE after changing workspace preferences
desc: I changed the severity setting for API usage from error to warning for @noreference and @noextend. Pressing OK, gave me an NPE:  java.lang.NullPointerException 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.util.Util$BuildJob.run(Util.java:208) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: Builder should report problems not markers
desc: Currently our builder does its thing and creates markers as it goes.   There are a few problems with this: 1. In a headless world, this is alot of wasted work 2. it is not flexible at all  Our builder should report problems that can be consumed in differing ways, and not have anything to do with creating markers.

title: TagScanner should not process non-API types
desc: From bug 280464 comment #13:  "I noticed that the TagScanner ends up scanning internal types for API descriptions. This is triggered by some compatibility checks were internal types are super types of API classes, etc. We can avoid scanning the types by simply inheriting the visibility of the parent node in this case."

title: [api tooling] Add global switch to change binary compatibility options
desc: We should add a global switch to change all binary compatibility options at the same time.

title: Two builds done when removing last api filter from property page
desc: If you remove the last remaining api filter from a project (via the property page) you will end up getting two incremental builds run on the project in question.  This is happening because of the way we handle filter files and the resource chnaged listener in the plugin project filter store. Currently we listen to resource changed events and cause an incremetal build if a filter file is deleted or added to a project. At the same time we also remove the api filter file if the last remaining filter is removed from the store. In the case of using the property page to remove the last filter we get one build when the file itself is removed, and one build if you click 'ok' from the prompt dialog.

title: [api tooling] NPE trying to create the problem that corresponds to the missing default profile
desc: Using HEAD, I get a NPE when trying to create a problem for the missing default profile error.

title: [api tooling] NPE when  performing finish in the profile setup page
desc: Using HEAD, I got a NPE when I tried to set up a profile. Steps: 1) Give a name to a new profile 2) Instead of browsing to a location, copy/paste into the combo the location of a plugin folder. 3) click finish.  Since the fProfile has never been initialized, the performFinish() is failing with a NPE.

title: API problems ids could be better
desc: from bug 222113:  Looking at the way the id is computed, it makes it difficult to add new messages. Here are my two cents.  So with what I described: We have: category 5 => 3 bits element kind = 10 => 4 bits kind = 5 => 3 bits flags = 71 => 7 bits  So in order to keep room for the future, we can use:  category => 4 bits (room for 10 more) element kind => 4 bits (still room for 5 more) kind => 4 bits (room for 10 more) flags => 10 bits (room for many more)  This leaves the lower 10 bits for the message key (about 1023 message). So we could have the properties file be:  1 = ..... 2 = ..... 3 = .....   And the problem id be: category | element kind | kind | flags | key

title: Prompted twice for rebuild
desc: on the API profiles pref page if you change the default profile notification pref (in the options section) and press apply you get prompted twice for a rebuild.  Steps:  1. open the API profiles pref page 2. change the default API profile option 3. press apply  Expected:  I am prompted for a rebuild   Happens:  I am prompted for a rebuild, I press ok and am prompted for a rebuild again

title: API tooling keeps lock on files (was: import fails because files cannot be deleted)
desc: I20090922-0800 (I've also seen it with last weeks I-build but not for the previous few months).   During PDE binary plug-in import (no targets running) I got a dialog (see attached picture) and the log entries below. After that my workspace had tons of errors because those plug-ins were not correctly imported. Sounds familiar? I thought this got fixed (and it looked fixed for quite some time).  Trying to import the plug-ins again in the same session worked.  There are two issues here: 1. PDE should re-try to delete the files (it's a known issue that deletion sometimes fails on WindowsXP) several times before giving up, see e.g. org.eclipse.jdt.testplugin.JavaProjectHelper.delete(IResource) in org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.  2. we need to find the code that locks the files. I know that APT changed some algorithms recently. Maybe that's the origin of the problem?   !ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.ui 4 0 2009-09-23 09:31:28.900 !MESSAGE Problems detected while importing plug-ins !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 title: Use PDE's bundle project creation APIs
desc: Created attachment 156131 [details] patch  PDE has new API to create/modify bundle projects. The API tooling tests can use this new API rather than the internals it uses currently. I have attached a patch for the code changes.  The new PDE API is in HEAD now, but also requires the new p2 code. It might be easier to apply this after the next integration build.
