title: API builder performance still bad for incremental build
desc: I20100115-1100  The API builder performance is still bad for incremental build scenarios. Prior to API Tools, working with the Eclipse compiler was really slick, since everything was compiled as soon as you lifted your finger from Ctrl+S.  But nowadays, API Tools is THE performance bottleneck that hits me literally every minute. E.g. right now, I'm in org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.FilteredItemsSelectionDialog.CamelCaseComparator.compare(Object, Object), and when I change '-1' to '-2' here, it takes 25s until the "incremental" build is done. For comparison, the same operation takes 4s when I disable the baseline (including Save Actions and the API tools builders). And this is with all the cached warmed up and using an SSD, not a floppy disk.  Bug 233643 may have brought some improvements, but they are yet enough to bring me back to speed.

title: [api tooling] Reduce number of false positive from leak detection
desc: We should try to reduce the number of false positive when reporting leaks in APIs that are using non-API types. If a method is protected within a type that has a '@noextend' restriction, it should not be considered as a leak.

title: [api tooling] When fixing invalid @since tags, the quickfix should say "update" and not "add"
desc: The message shown when applying a quickfix to correct a @since tag that is malformed should use "update" or "correct" instead of "add".

title: [api tooling] Profile not bound to EE when trying to set a profile to a 3.2.2 install
desc: Using HEAD, I tried to create a new API profile based on 3.2.2 SDK and I got this error once I selected the plugins directory.

title: [api tooling]  Show API closure of classes
desc: From bug 180706, we should be able to point the API Tool at a class/package/bundle and use it to ensure that only API classes are exposed in its method signatures, etc.  I have some code to use as a start for this if you are interested. You point it to a directory with class files and then enter the name of the class or package that you want to analyze. It follows all the public/protected methods/fields and prints out all of the classes that are exposed.

title: [api tooling] Should not be able to create two profiles with the same name
desc: Using HEAD, it is possible to create two profiles with the same name. This should be considered as an error case. The first profile would need to be edited if it has to be changed.

title: failing test in N20080318-2000
desc: The getSeverity test is failing when run in the test harness. It is the design of the test that is causing the problem, since getSeverity could return different values based on if the framework is running or not.  The test should be updated to check both cases (framework running and not).

title: @since tag problem: Invalid @since 3.2 tag on org.eclipse.pde.launching.IPDELauncherConstants; expecting @since 3.6
desc: I'm getting some fresh API Tooling related errors in PDE with the latest i-build.  Resource: org.eclipse.pde.launching/src/org/eclipse/pde/launching/IPDELauncherConstants.java Location: line 23

title: Poor API builder performance on manifest changes
desc: Build: I20090922-0800  The incremental API analysis builder performs poorly when there are changes to a bundle manifest. In my workspace doing an empty change to a bundle manifest (add/remove space, save), takes 1 minute on the first run, and a consistent 40 seconds on a subsequent run. It appears to be doing detailed API analysis on every project in my workspace, even those unrelated to the change. This is extremely painful when doing work that requires manifest changes (in my case editing manifest headers completely unrelated to API). It should be able to determine there is no work to do here - only certain headers have impact on API (BSN, version, import/export package, require bundle, classpath, execution environment come to mind).  Note, I know there are existing bugs about poor API builder performance, but wanted to enter this very specific one about manifest file changes in particular.  I will attach a debug trace showing builder invocations for multiple "no-op" changes to the bundle manifest of a single bundle (org.eclipse.equinox.p2.core).

title: String.chars() seems to be missing from JavaSE-1.8 execution environment
desc: Created attachment 268483 [details] Sample project  Using Eclipse SDK I20170518-1030 API Tools Execution Environment Descriptions 1.0.200.v20170515-0910  In a Plugin project with API tooling enabled and JavaSE-1.8 execution environment:  public class Test {  	public static void main(String[] args) { 		args[0].chars(); 	} }  I get:  "The method String.chars() referenced in Test.main(String[]) is not defined in the bundle's required execution environment: JavaSE-1.8"  See attached project for reproducing it quickly.

title: 293 compile warnings in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.tests
desc: I20080323-2000  There are 293 compile warniings in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.tests. Besides

title: test failure: project was not found in the workspace baseline
desc: I was able to reproduce the transient failure that happenned in the nightly build. The workspace baseline is being disposed as we are iterating over the API components in it, causing lookup to fail. It is diposed asynchronously due to resource deltas/classpath changes being handled asynch in the workspace.   The project was not found in the workspace baseline: a.b.c.core   junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: The project was not found in the workspace baseline: a.b.c.core at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.compatibility.BundleMergeSplitTests.setupTest(BundleMergeSplitTests.java:350) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.builder.tests.compatibility.BundleMergeSplitTests.test009(BundleMergeSplitTests.java:294) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:376) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:209) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:35) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.run(CoreTestApplication.java:31) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer.callMethodWithException(EclipseAppContainer.java:587) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:198) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:110) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:79) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:369) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:179) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:619) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:574) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1407) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1383) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:34)

title: [api tooling] stress test setup and build
desc: We need to try the following:  * Check out all SDK plug-ins as source * Set up API tooling on all plug-ins * Ensure source changes are reasonable (application of component.xml) * Examine API errors in workspace to see what people will have to deal with when using the tool for the first time  Use the hand crafted 3.3 API baseline (i.e. existing component.xml's).

title: change to x-internal in manifest file is not picked up
desc: I changed one of my packages from x-internal:false to x-internal:true (and vice versa), but the API tooling did not pick up this change - I had to go to the file in question and make a whitespace change to get updated error markers based on the x-internal setting.  We had an internal package that was marked as x-internal:false. I found this bug when I tried to fix our problem in the manifest file.

title: [api tooling] Change of interface method signature is not recognized as API breakage
desc: Build id: I20080327-2251  Baseline (1.0): interface Foo {    void foo(String s); }  Workspace (2.0): interface Foo {    /** @since 2.0 */    void foo(String s, IProgressMonitor pm); }  This change is not recognized as API breakage, i.e. the API Tooling tells me that my Manifest should not have major version increment and it also tells me that my @since tags use the wrong version.  This is a major problem IMHO because adding a method parameter is a frequent change, and one important use of API Tooling is to detect unintended API breakage. Not detecting this breakage reduces my confidence in the tool and is thus a major loss of functionality.  FYI, the real-world plugin I've been testing this on is    /cvsroot/dsdp : org.eclipse.tm.rse/plugins/org.eclipse.rse.services HEAD against TM 2.0.1 baseline. Should be very easy to reproduce since it's checked in with API Tooling enabled, it has no dependencies except eclipse.core.runtime, and the baseline can easily be downloaded from    http://download.eclipse.org/dsdp/tm/downloads/

title: Tests failing in  I20100414-1200
desc: There are several tests failures in I20100414-1200.  It appears to be timing issues with the tests. The tests are using a combination of API (IBundleProjectDescription) and non-API (internal PDE models) to update project artifacts, wait for events to singal updates are complete, and then test state. It would be more robust to use only the API classes, and wait for build to complete.

title: [api tooling] The IMember is not properly located when it is a constructor
desc: When we try to locate a constructor, the method selector should be the type name instead of <init>. This can cause all kinds of side-effects as reporting invalid @since tags since we default to the enclosing type. This will be fixed as part of bug 224713.

title: [AAP001] The source issue
desc: Build ID: I20080329  In the file: eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui\org\eclipse\pde\api\tools\ui\internal\markers\markermessages.properties  We came across the following:  </TWBQ>UpdateSinceTagOperation_title= Update since tag  I think that the source should be: </TWBQ>UpdateSinceTagOperation_title= Update @since tag

title: [api tools] use 1.0.0.qualifier as version
desc: All the bundles within API Tools should change their bundle version to 1.0.0.qualifier before they move to PDE.

title: @noreference: distinguish between method and constructor
desc: 20080401  in the following code  In the Javadoc of a constructor, use code assist to add a API tooling tag '@noreference' to the constructor A.  This results in /*  * @noreference This method is not intended to be referenced by clients.  */ It would be better to have 'constructor' instead of 'method'.

title: Update user Ant task documentation for include lists
desc: Support has been added to all API tools Ant tasks to support include lists (see bug 270973). The user documentation needs to be updated to reflect this for each ant task in the following folder.  /org.eclipse.pde.doc.user/reference/api-tooling/ant-tasks

title: [api tooling] API breakage filters should also work on MANIFEST.MF file
desc: When a breakage is reported against an api component, we create the marker on the manifest file. It would be good if the filter could support the filtering of these markers as well.

title: [api tooling] api tool builder should check the preferences before doing api usage scan
desc: If all options for api usage scan are set to ignore, there is no point to run the api usage scanner for the project.

title: [api tooling] @since tag checker should handle inherited doc
desc: When I have {@inheritDoc} inside a javadoc, the @since tag checker might not want to report an problem.

title: [api tooling] Got  "@noinstantiate null" while converting org.eclipse.update.configurator.IPlatformConfigurationFactory
desc: I got this line inside the type when converting it to be a api tooling project.

desc: @noextend is not available for interfaces in the completion proposal.

title: [api tooling] fragments packages are not considered as API even if the host is exporting them
desc: If you load org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility.registry and org.eclipse.equinox.registry, you will get binary compatibility errors because of removed type. The types are there, but are not considered as API anymore.  If I add the Export-Package directive for the package org.eclipse.core.runtime inside the manifest.mf file of the fragment, it works again.  This means that the fragment doesn't see the api packages described by the host.

title: Internal API use report should capture illegal API use
desc: Currently, API Use reports allow users to detail all API and internal references. Internal reference reports are useful for detailing internal dependencies. However, the reports do not capture when a client illegally implements an interface (for example). On some level, this is also an internal dependency, and would be good to capture in reports.

title: [api tooling] Incremental builder for Api tooling
desc: If the API description of some element changes (for exmaple, adding or removing a @noimplement tag to an interface), all dependant projects need to be re-analyzed by the builder.

title: Should not report @since tag errors for protected members inside a class tagged as @noextend
desc: When a class is tagged with @noextend, a protected field is not "visible" for the client. Therefore the @since tag is not required.

title: No rebuild is requested when the location of the baseline is modified
desc: Steps to reproduce: 1) Set up a project to use API tools 2) Set up a baseline to point to a 3.2.2 SDK 3) A rebuild is requested 4) let the build complete and then go to the baseline and edit it 5) Modify its location to point to a 3.3.2 SDK without updating the name (click reset to make sure that the new plugins are read). 6) Click ok and finish. 7) No rebuild is requested even if the baseline is different.

title: code assist after prefix doesn't work
desc: 3.4 20080401-0851  - in an API tools enables project do a code assist in the following code  /**  *   * @no |code assist  */ public class CategorizedTextEditGroup { }  I would expect tags '@noextend' and '@noinstantiate'  result is  * @no@no

title: Translation Clarification - string concatenation problems in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools
desc: Build ID: I20080405  In this file:  eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.api.tools\org\eclipse\pde\api\tools\internal\coremessages.properties  It is extremely hard, almost impossible for other languages to translate strings that are concatenated as they must deal with problems such as noun gender.  Can a developer provide complete string sentences for the following strings?:  JavadocTagManager_class=class JavadocTagManager_extended=extended JavadocTagManager_field=field JavadocTagManager_implemented=implemented JavadocTagManager_instantiated=instantiated JavadocTagManager_interface=interface JavadocTagManager_method=method JavadocTagManager_not_intended_to_be=This {0} is not intended to be {1} by clients. JavadocTagManager_referenced=referenced JavadocTagManager_subclassed=subclassed  Thank you.

title: More specific implementation of a super method should not be considered as an addition
desc: From bug 225138 comment 7, one method was defined in the super class since 3.2. In 3.4, the subclass simply defines a more specific implementation of this method. Should this be seen as an API addition ?

title: Problem filter quickfix should be more descriptive
desc: Created attachment 95451 [details] Screenshot showing the quickfix proposals  Using HEAD, 1) Check out org.eclipse.jdt.ui from CVS 2) Set up the API tools (only need to set up the nature and the builder). All javadoc tags are already in place 3) Go to org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaUI.ID_TYPES_VIEW and add the final keyword. This is a breaking API change. 4) Try to do quickfix on the errors to fix them. There are two errors: addition of a constant value and addition of the final keyword, but the corresponding quickfixes are not descriptive enough to know to which error they apply. Check the screenshot.

title: Problem reporter cannot filter problems outside of the workspace
desc: Right now the problem filter is retrieving the workspace profile to get the corresponding filter store. This means it cannot work outside of the workspace. In fact it would fail with a NPE right now.  Also the fProject field should not be static as it would prevent from having two problem reporters on two different projects at the same time.

title: Wrong version range for requirement on JDT
desc: I'm getting very annoying modal error dialogs each time my workspace is built:  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException 	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTParser.<init>(ASTParser.java:234) 	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTParser.newParser(ASTParser.java:131) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.scanner.TagScanner.scan(TagScanner.java:610) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.scanner.TagScanner.scan(TagScanner.java:586) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ProjectApiDescription$TypeNode.refresh(ProjectApiDescription.java:245) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiDescription.findNode(ApiDescription.java:428) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ProjectApiDescription.visit(ProjectApiDescription.java:398) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ProjectApiDescription.accept(ProjectApiDescription.java:367) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ReferenceAnalyzer.buildProblemDetectors(ReferenceAnalyzer.java:301) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ReferenceAnalyzer.analyze(ReferenceAnalyzer.java:230) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BaseApiAnalyzer.checkApiUsage(BaseApiAnalyzer.java:1225) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BaseApiAnalyzer.analyzeComponent(BaseApiAnalyzer.java:278) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.IncrementalApiBuilder.build(IncrementalApiBuilder.java:301) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.IncrementalApiBuilder.build(IncrementalApiBuilder.java:252) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.build(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:420) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:795)  ... or content completion is triggered:  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException 	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTParser.<init>(ASTParser.java:234) 	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTParser.newParser(ASTParser.java:131) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui.internal.completion.APIToolsJavadocCompletionProposalComputer.sessionStarted(APIToolsJavadocCompletionProposalComputer.java:400) 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.java.CompletionProposalComputerDescriptor.sessionStarted(CompletionProposalComputerDescriptor.java:423) 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.java.CompletionProposalCategory.sessionStarted(CompletionProposalCategory.java:384) 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.java.ContentAssistProcessor$CompletionListener.assistSessionStarted(ContentAssistProcessor.java:119)  The reason is that the versions of PDE and JDT don't fit together anymore because of https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=535103  PDE started to use the enum literal "AST.JLS10" that JDT introduced in their recent 3.14 cycle. But the requirement on JDT is defined as:  <required namespace='osgi.bundle' name='org.eclipse.jdt.core' range='[3.10.0,4.0.0)'/>  Shouldn't that have a lower bound of 3.14.0 instead? Then I would have noticed the problem much earlier at install time...

title: [api tooling] No binary breakage should be reported for a protected field change in a final class
desc: Using HEAD, the class org.eclipse.jdt.core.CompletionProposal reports a binary breakage because of a protected field constant value has been modified. This should not be reported since the class is final. The javadoc tag @noextend is not there, because a final class cannot be implicitely subclassed.

title: plug-in version error appears on second build
desc: Steps:  * new workspace * check out these projects from CVS:      org.eclipse.core.variables      org.eclipse.debug.core      org.eclipse.debug.ui      org.eclipse.jdt.debug      org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui      org.eclipse.jdt.launching * Set up API tooling on all the projects > note: note errors in org.eclipse.debug.ui * Modify IDebugElement > add @noextend > an error appears in org.eclipse.debug.ui about its version number:  "The minor version should be incremented in version 3.3.0.v20070607-1800, since new APIs have been added since version 3.3.100.qualifier"  I would expect the error to appear on the first build.

title: tooling setup wizard does nothing without a preview
desc: with the way the text edits are lazily collected in the api tooling setup wizard, if you press the finihs button when the wizard initially opens (without doing a preview) it will do nothing.  there are two things we can do:  1. more aggresively load the text changes, or just do them when the user presses finish (needs more logic to track if the user has seen a preview or not and if we should recompute them, etc)  2. we could force a preview.  I vote option 2 (it only requires setting a boolean flag).

title: [api tooling] IllegalStateException on rebuild after a bundle version has been updated
[api tools] Missing @since tag version should be based on the right bundle version
desc: When a bundle needs to have its minor version incremented and also has an error for missing @since tag, the new @since tag value should be the plugin version modified, not the current version.

title: Add @nooverride as a javadoc tag for javadoc generation
desc: http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/N20080412-2000/compilelogs/platform.doc.isv.javadoc.txt  Constructing Javadoc information... /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableListContentProvider.java:112: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableListContentProvider.java:124: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableSetContentProvider.java:68: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableSetContentProvider.java:97: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableSetContentProvider.java:109: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. 5 warnings

title: Builder should use analyser, and create its own markers
desc: Doing some introspection on our builder while fixing bug 226745, there are a few things we could probably change.  Currently we have a problem reporter that is used for each instance of our builder, which accepts problems and once the build is done creates markers (as needed). This works well, but is not quite as flexible as we could be.   For example, if we used the notion of an analyser that could do all of the api analysis, create problems, etc. and when the build is done give the problems back to the builder to create markers (as needed). This way clients (if there are any in the future) could provide their own analyser and all we do is call it in a consistent way and create markers (if any) once the builder is done.

title: Failing tests in N20080414-2000
desc: There are 3 failing tests in N20080414-2000, all of which are in the new headless tests for the profile manager.  The problem is the tests themselves, they assume they will be run in headless mode, but in fact they might not. The tests should be changed to determine how they are being run to return the correct result.

title: clean up ids for nature/builder
desc: I changed the ids for our project nature and builder for consistency:  * apiAnalysisBuilder * apiAnalysisNature

title: [api tooling]  generate a fake ee file for testing purpose
desc: In order to get a more robust ee file to use for the test harness, I suggest to generate a fake 1.5 one in case there is none passed as an argument. The bootclasspath of the running VM could be used.

title: add version numbers to our external files
desc: We should add version numbers to our external files (.api_description and .api_filters), so we can evolve the file content/meaning.

title: Problem filters should not be severity sensitive
desc: Currently we store problem severity in IApiProblem. Instead, we should dynamically obtain the problem severity from the workspace settings. This way, a problem filter will not be selective on severity (i.e. if "developer 1" filters a problem as an error, but "developer 2" has the same problem set as a warning, the shared filter will only filter the "error" and not the "warning").  We can render problem filters based on the workspace severity settings.

title: [api tooling] source bundles seem to appear against inside the profile wizard
desc: Using HEAD, it looks like the source bundles appear again when creating a new profile and setting the plugin location. They used to be filtered out. The call to org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.provisional.IApiComponent#isSourceComponent() should return true for these plugins.

title: No way to get rid of api tooling errors
desc: I have o.e.ui.console as source in my workspace. When I updated from HEAD I got an API error on the project and in the Problems view (A default API profile has not been set for the current workspace).  Neither cleaning and rebuilding nor replacing with an earlier version of the project makes the error go away. I then tried to close and reopen - no luck.  Please don't introduce yet another problem kind that doesn't go away on clean. Clean should do what it says: clean.

title: API tag code assist proposals should only be available if project is under pde tooling control
desc: I2008040415-0800.  The API tag code assist proposals should only be available if project is under pde tooling control. The processor could check the nature.

title: .api_filters could not be removed
desc: I got this error only once.  org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Problems encountered while deleting files. at org.eclipse.core.internal.filesystem.local.LocalFile.delete(LocalFile.java:123) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceTree.internalDeleteFile(ResourceTree.java:302) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceTree.standardDeleteFile(ResourceTree.java:779) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.MoveDeleteHook$1.run(MoveDeleteHook.java:62) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.EclipseSynchronizer.performMoveDelete(EclipseSynchronizer.java:1710) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.MoveDeleteHook.deleteFile(MoveDeleteHook.java:57) at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.MoveDeleteManager.deleteFile(MoveDeleteManager.java:50) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.unprotectedDelete(Resource.java:1708) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.delete(Resource.java:704) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.delete(Resource.java:676) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiFilterStore$1.runInWorkspace(ApiFilterStore.java:120) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55) Contains: Could not delete: D:\eclipse\workspaces\ui_workbench\org.eclipse.jdt.core\.settings\.api_filters.  I don't have steps to reproduce, but this happened when I removed all the filters for one project and the rebuild has started immediately after.

title: 'Api Errors/Warnings > Configure Workspace Settings...' leaves wrong shell active
desc: I20080415-1646  - org.eclipse.debug.ui from CVS - open project Properties > PDE > Api Errors/Warnings - click "Configure Workspace Settings..." - close Preferences dialog => workspace window has focus, although Properties dialog is still up and modal

title: [api tooling] Addition of a type member inside an interface should not be a binary breakage
desc: The addition of a type member inside the interface should not be seen as an binary incompatible change. It is not source compatible, but it remains binary compatible.

title: [api tooling] Quickfix for api filter should be more verbose
desc: When I want to filter a problem, if the same member has two problems I get twice the same quickfix description. I don't know which one corresponds to the problem I want to filter.  Steps to reproduce: 1) Inside a fresh workspace set up a 3.3.0 baseline profile 2) Checkout jdt.ui and build. Look at the errors in org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaUI. 3) Select a field in this class and use quickfix.

title: [api tooling] Should not report a binary breakage on a private method
desc: This must be a consequence of the changes on the kinds. Building org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring from HEAD against 3.3.0 produces a binary incompatible change for a static keyword added on a private method.

title: [api tooling] Quickfix for missing @since tag should not add the tag twice
desc: If you work with autobuild off and you fix one missing @since tag, you can add it twice if you select the previous error. This should be a no-op.

title: Should have error marker in manifest.mf for bundle version errors
desc: Currently, when there is an error with bundle versions, a problem appears in the problem view, but after navigating to the manifest.mf file where the error exists, there is no error/marker in the vertical ruler.

title: [api tooling] addition of a protected field inside a class that can be extended should not be flagged as an error
desc: The addition of a protected field inside a class that can be extended should be considered as a compatible change.

title: Update asm dep to 6.0
desc: To fix nightly failure as JDT moved already.

title: ResourceException trying to create api filter
desc: While trying to create an api filter in a simple project with no .settings folder I got the following error:  org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource '/TestPlugin/.settings' does not exist. 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkExists(Resource.java:316) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkAccessible(Resource.java:193) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.create(File.java:119) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.create(File.java:186) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiFilterStore$1.runInWorkspace(ApiFilterStore.java:131) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)  We should be checking if the parent folder exists before trying to create the new filter file.

title: NPE in ApiFilterStore.resourceChanged
desc: I20080422-0800  This happened when I updated incoming changes from the CVS view. I don't know what exactly has changed, but the CVS comment was something like "fixed wrong @since tags".  Error Wed Apr 23 11:50:17 CEST 2008 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.resources".  java.lang.NullPointerException 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiFilterStore.resourceChanged(ApiFilterStore.java:544) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:288) 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:282) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:148) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.broadcastPostChange(Workspace.java:313) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation(Workspace.java:1022) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1809) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$NotifyJob.run(NotificationManager.java:39) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: External class file folders break bundle API components
desc: The fix to PDE that supports compiling the launched workspace against the launching workspace plug-ins breaks API components that are expecting be either a binary bundle or a plug-in project. In this case we have a hybrid bundle (it is binary, but its bundle classpath is not correct).  (I have a fix in hand)

title: Analyzer should work in OSGi-less mode
desc: The BaseApiAnalyzer currently requires a project to create API problems:  * required for source ranges on problems * required for @since tag validation (need source)  We should modify the analyzer to work in OSGi-less mode so it can be used by an Ant task in a releng build to generate a problem report.

title: [api tooling] @since tags should not be limited to two fragments only
desc: Build ID: I20080422-0800  Here is a simple of my Javadoc comments:  /**  * opens the dialog with an optional Yes/No or OK, Details button for an  * Inquiry/Question message.  * @since 3.0 taking a boolean arg  */ public boolean openQuestionNoException(boolean showYesNo)  The intention here was to add extra information to the @since tag what changed in the particular revision of the API. I found this valuable here, since the API method itself had existed before though with a different signature; I thought that having the extra information on the @since tag would help adopters understand what changed and update their code as necessary if they are affected by the API change.  Now API tooling tells me that this is invalid, since the @since tag can only have two fragments.  Looking at the Javadoc specification, however, I read: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/windows/javadoc.html#@since  @since  since-text     Adds a "Since" heading with the specified since-text to the generated     documentation. The text has no special internal structure. [...]     This tag means that this change or feature has existed since the      software release specified by the since-text. [...] Multiple @since     tags are allowed and are treated like multiple @author tags.  I understand that API Tooling must find the bundle version identifier in  order to provide any useful service here; but wouldn't it be sufficient to use a Regex Pattern like this, to get the first n.n version in the sinceText:  private static final Pattern versionPattern =      Pattern.compile("\\s\\([0-9]+\.[0-9]+\\)\\s"; [...] Matcher m = versionPattern.matcher(sinceTagText); if (m.find()) {    String tagVersion = m.group(1); }

title: Don't require bundles to be in "plugins" directory
desc: The API baseline preference page requires bundles to be in a "plugins" folder relative to a home location. We should be more flexible, and search the "plugins" location if it exists, but otherwise allow any path to be used.

title: [api tooling] Wrong deltas reported when code is refactored by pushing down some methods from the superclass
desc: In I20080430-0800, some code has been refactored in jface databinding and it is causing the API freeze check to report false positives. The previous code was like this:   NON-API TYPE ---- implements an interface    |    | API TYPE  The refactored code is: API TYPE ---- implements an interface  The interface methods were defined inside the non-api type so that they were also API for the API type.  The new code defined the interface methods directly inside the AP type and uses a double-dispatch to an internal instance of the former superclass which has been removed.  From an API perspective, this refactoring is right and the API type doesn't expose any new methods. So the deltas reported by API tools should support this case.

title: [api tooling] Visible methods of a non-API types must be seen as API for API subclasses
desc: The following case is not handled properly by the delta detection.  package p1 (x-internal:=true)   |   +------- NON-API public type                 public void foo()  package p2 (exported as public)   |   +------ API type that extends the NON-API type from package p1  In this case foo() is part of the API of the API type. Removing foo from the NON-API type should be seen as a breakage.

title: [api tooling] Wrong @since version not detected
desc: Steps to reproduce: 1) Check out org.eclipse.core.jobs inside your workspace 2) Convert it to be an api tooling project 3) Set a default profile 4) Build 5) Add a method in org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs.IJobChangeEvent without @since tag. e.g.:      public void foo(); 6) Rebuild. 7) I'll see that the MANIFEST.MF file has an error about the fact that the plugin version should be incremented. 8) Use quickfix on the method foo(). It has an error saying that there is a missing @since tag. 9) 3.3 is suggested (We should suggest 3.4. See bug 219535). 10) Go to the MANIFEST.MF file and use quickfix. 11) Plugin version is now 3.4.0, but the foo() method is not tagged with an invalid @since tag error. 3.3 is not the right version for a new API.

title: Profile pref page: should use check box for default
desc: I20080226-1155.  The preference pages I know (like Installed JREs, EE) use a check box for default selection. API tooling should not introduce a new style.

title: Missing error message for api usage
desc: There is a case in which a api usage problem is returned with: category = IApiProblem.CATEGORY_USAGE kind = ILLEGAL_REFERENCE flags = 0  With the missing break; statement in the method org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.problems.ApiProblemFactory.getProblemMessageId(int, int, int, int) this leads to the message for unsupported tags.  I'll investigate as this doesn't occur in the IDE, but it does occur in the ant task.

title: [api tooling] Cannot set a default profile anymore
desc: Using HEAD, the default profile is never remembered. So nothing happens during the build. This needs to be fixed asap.

title: [api tooling] Extending an @noimplement interface should not be an error
desc: Build ID: I20080502-0100 (Eclipse 3.4M7)  Consider following rather common scenario:  /** @noimplement Do not implement directly. Extend abstract base Foo instead. */ public interface IFoo {   //... }  public abstract class Foo implements IFoo {   //... }  With following client code:  interface IFooBar extends IFoo {   public void bar(); }  class MyFooBar extends Foo implements IFooBar {   public void bar(); }  In this case, the client code legally implements IFoo, because it does so by extending abstract base Foo. This scenario should not be flagged as an error: Just extending an interface does not introduce any binary compatibility issues.  But currently the API Tooling flags IFooBar extends IFoo as an error.

title: Content assist should not propose @no* tags that are already present
desc: I20080502-0100  Content assist should not propose @no* tags that are already present.

title: Hide EE selection from user
desc: The user should not be forced to select an EE for API profiles - we should use the same EE as used for the workspace profile.  Would be nice to reveal resolution errors to the user somehow - so they know why some bundles cannot be analyzed.

title: Profiles need to re-bind EE/VM as VM installs change
desc: We need profiles to update as VM installs are added/removed such that the VM they are bound to might change:  * a VM might be removed that a profile is bound to * a VM might be added that better satisfies the bundle requirements in profile  In both cases, the pofile needs to re-bind its VM/EE.

title: Modernize apitools.ui bundle
desc: Convert to lambda and remove redundant type definitions.

title: Improve labels on Binary Incompatibility tab
desc: I20080305-1100  - Open preference page: API Error/Warning On the second tab:  As a API tooling novice, trying to understand the page for the first time I failed... Maybe the page needs to have a longer description or needs a link to a help page.  My guess, after reading the WIKI is, that this is about comparing the code to a reference build.  What does 'API profile: Removed API component' mean? A type that was API got removed? What is a API component?  'Removed some execution environment'. What does 'Some' mean? Maybe 'Less execution environments supported?'  'Removed type'. I assume this means 'A type that was API got removed?'  'Annotation' 'Enum', 'Classes',.... Is it to be expected that the user wants to fine tune all the cases? Or would it be possible to have only few of these settings or even one setting? I assume in the end it's all about 'compatible or not'. Or is there a gray area?   What's the difference between 'Removed interface bounds' and 'Removed interface bound'?

title: Addition of an ant task to run the API tools verification during Eclipse build
desc: This bug is a fup bug of bug 220637. We must define an ant task to provide a report during the Eclipse build.

title: [api tooling] @reference null is inserted for some internal classes inside API packages
desc: When trying to convert the JDT/Core project, I got: @noreference null for classes with package visibility inside API packages.  For example, org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTConverter or org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.AnnotationBinding.

title: [api tooling] "Unable to resolve method signature" when adding @noreference in a method on the next build
desc: Api tooling builder failed once the @noreference in the javadoc of the method org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.AST.convertCompilationUnit(int, CompilationUnitDeclaration, Map, boolean, CompilationUnit, int, IProgressMonitor) in the jdt/core plugin.  For now I won't add the javadoc tags as the next build will fail.

title: [api tooling] Add @noreference support for delta creation
desc: Right now the delta creation doesn't check the @noreference for methods and fields. Any "breaking" change to a method with @noreference should be converted to a compatible change.

title: NPE after changing workspace preferences
desc: I changed the severity setting for API usage from error to warning for @noreference and @noextend. Pressing OK, gave me an NPE:  java.lang.NullPointerException 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.util.Util$BuildJob.run(Util.java:208) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: Callers of org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.util.Util.getInputStreamAsCharArray(InputStream, int, String) must close the input stream
desc: There are two calls that are not closing the input stream. 1) org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiDescriptionManager.restoreDescription(IJavaProject, ProjectApiDescription)  2) org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiFilterStore.initializeApiFilters()  This creates file handles leaks and potential problems to remove the corresponding files.

title: Builder should report problems not markers
desc: Currently our builder does its thing and creates markers as it goes.   There are a few problems with this: 1. In a headless world, this is alot of wasted work 2. it is not flexible at all  Our builder should report problems that can be consumed in differing ways, and not have anything to do with creating markers.

title: [Metadata] update version of org.eclipse.ui.navigator
desc: HEAD  Setting 3.3.2 as API Tools baseline gives:  Description	Resource	Path	Location	Type The minor version should be incremented in version 3.3.100.qualifier, since new APIs have been added since version 3.3.2.M20080207-0800	MANIFEST.MF	org.eclipse.ui.navigator/META-INF	line 5	Version Numbering Problem

title: Api filter format could list the message arguments instead of concatenating them
desc: Instead of concatenating message arguments using '#', we could create an inner element like this:  <resource path="src/org/eclipse/jface/internal/databinding/provisional/swt/CompositeUpdater.java">         <filter id="305365105">                 <message_arguments>                     <message_argument value="org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.provisional.swt.CompositeUpdater"/>                     <message_argument value="org.eclipse.jface.databinding_1.2.0"/>                 </message_arguments>         </filter> </resource>  instead of: <resource path="src/org/eclipse/jface/internal/databinding/provisional/swt/CompositeUpdater.java">         <filter id="305365105" messageargs="org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.provisional.swt.CompositeUpdater#org.eclipse.jface.databinding_1.2.0"/>     </resource>  This would require the filter version to be incremented and we should support the old version on read and save the new format.

title: Removing api filters file doesn't trigger a rebuild
desc: When deleting the api filter file directly, no rebuild is triggered. A manual build needs to be done to get back the filtered errors.

title: detect unrequired change to plug-in minor version
desc: When there are no API changes in a plug-in and the minor version is incremented, API tooling should flag the problem.  I found when migrating Ant plug-ins to API tooling that the plug-in minor versions had been incremented since the previous release, but there were only bug fixes in this version (no API changes). We should be able to detect that the minor version has been incremented, but there were no API changes.

title: Changing non-final to final class should be a compatible change for @noextend class
desc: If a class is not supposed to be extended (@noextend), changing non-final to final should not be a problem. We need to double check this is properly detected.

title: No delta returned for adding or removing volatile modifiers from a field
desc: Right now this change is not detected. Trivial to add.

title: Bundle verification ant task should report non-api bundles
desc: We should report which bundles are not converted yet to api tools support.

title: [api tooling] Add global switch to change binary compatibility options
desc: We should add a global switch to change all binary compatibility options at the same time.

title: Two builds done when removing last api filter from property page
desc: If you remove the last remaining api filter from a project (via the property page) you will end up getting two incremental builds run on the project in question.  This is happening because of the way we handle filter files and the resource chnaged listener in the plugin project filter store. Currently we listen to resource changed events and cause an incremetal build if a filter file is deleted or added to a project. At the same time we also remove the api filter file if the last remaining filter is removed from the store. In the case of using the property page to remove the last filter we get one build when the file itself is removed, and one build if you click 'ok' from the prompt dialog.

title: [api tooling] NPE trying to create the problem that corresponds to the missing default profile
desc: Using HEAD, I get a NPE when trying to create a problem for the missing default profile error.

title: [api tooling] NPE when  performing finish in the profile setup page
desc: Using HEAD, I got a NPE when I tried to set up a profile. Steps: 1) Give a name to a new profile 2) Instead of browsing to a location, copy/paste into the combo the location of a plugin folder. 3) click finish.  Since the fProfile has never been initialized, the performFinish() is failing with a NPE.

title: org.eclipse.ui complaint about API
desc: AFAIK since we re-export both org.eclipse.jface and org.eclipse.ui.workbench, shouldn't we have to increment this version.  Boris?  Description	Resource	Path	Location	Type The minor version should be the same for version 3.4.0.qualifier, since no new APIs have been added since version 3.3.1.M20071128-0800	MANIFEST.MF	org.eclipse.ui/META-INF	line 5	Version Numbering Problem  This is with I20080508-2000  PW

title: 106 PDE API tools JUnit test failures on /I20180827-2000 or later

title: quickfix for bundle version replaces .qualifier with explicit build ID
desc: I used a quick fix to change a bundle version, and noticed a completely qualified version number was inserted - i.e. ".qualifier" was replaced with a build ID.

title: Minor and major version change should be detected after API freeze
desc: Between the 0507 and the 0508 builds, the version of org.eclipse.ant.core has been changed to 3.2 down to 3.1.300 (see bug  227556).  I would have expected this to be caught by the API tooling since now that we are API frozen this version change constitutes a breaking change.

title: API problems ids could be better
desc: from bug 222113:  Looking at the way the id is computed, it makes it difficult to add new messages. Here are my two cents.  So with what I described: We have: category 5 => 3 bits element kind = 10 => 4 bits kind = 5 => 3 bits flags = 71 => 7 bits  So in order to keep room for the future, we can use:  category => 4 bits (room for 10 more) element kind => 4 bits (still room for 5 more) kind => 4 bits (room for 10 more) flags => 10 bits (room for many more)  This leaves the lower 10 bits for the message key (about 1023 message). So we could have the properties file be:  1 = ..... 2 = ..... 3 = .....   And the problem id be: category | element kind | kind | flags | key

title: Cannot filter error inside MANIFEST.MF
desc: When trying to convert org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility.registry, I got some error for wrong bundle version. When trying to fix them using a filter, the errors are still reported after the build.

title: Prompted twice for rebuild
desc: on the API profiles pref page if you change the default profile notification pref (in the options section) and press apply you get prompted twice for a rebuild.  Steps:  1. open the API profiles pref page 2. change the default API profile option 3. press apply  Expected:  I am prompted for a rebuild   Happens:  I am prompted for a rebuild, I press ok and am prompted for a rebuild again

title: org.eclipse.pde.api.tools dependency on pde.core is broken with pde.core downgrade version
desc: pde.core changed version from 3.4.0.qualifier to 3.3.102.qualifier. This broke the version range of the dependency on pde.core inside the bundle org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.

title: Checking out eclipse.pde.ui results in unignored changes in test projects in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.tests
desc: If you clone the eclipse.pde.ui Git repository and then Import Projects for all projects, you get a number of new unstaged changes appearing, due to the Java builder running and generating .class files and a copied .txt file in the bin folders of numerous API Tools projects. This can make it difficult to detect which changes are real.

title: [api tooling] Reduce number of false positive from leak detection
desc: We should try to reduce the number of false positive when reporting leaks in APIs that are using non-API types. If a method is protected within a type that has a '@noextend' restriction, it should not be considered as a leak.

title: [api tooling] When fixing invalid @since tags, the quickfix should say "update" and not "add"
desc: The message shown when applying a quickfix to correct a @since tag that is malformed should use "update" or "correct" instead of "add".

title: Test tools usage projects class files are not in .gitignore
desc: In org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.tests\test-builder\usageprojectsjava7 and org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.tests\test-builder\usageprojectsjava8 the bin folders are not included in the .gitignore file.

title: Changing pde.core major version to 4.0.0.qualifier is not detected as an error
desc: This should be fixed for 3.4. We should detect that there is no need to upgrade the major version.

title: [api tooling] Profile not bound to EE when trying to set a profile to a 3.2.2 install
desc: Using HEAD, I tried to create a new API profile based on 3.2.2 SDK and I got this error once I selected the plugins directory.

title: Split bundle version management preference to distinguish minor and major version errors
desc: We need to split this preference into two in order to support minor and major bundle version error separately.

title: [api tooling] Should not be able to create two profiles with the same name
desc: Using HEAD, it is possible to create two profiles with the same name. This should be considered as an error case. The first profile would need to be edited if it has to be changed.

title: Convert xml reports from Bundle verification ant task into html
desc: We need a new ant task to complete this work and allow the integration inside the releng builds.

title: failing test in N20080318-2000
desc: The getSeverity test is failing when run in the test harness. It is the design of the test that is causing the problem, since getSeverity could return different values based on if the framework is running or not.  The test should be updated to check both cases (framework running and not).

title: API Baselines pref page - should be "Remove" (no ellipsis)
desc: 3.4 RC1 0510-2000  The API Baselines preference page has a button "Remove...".  It should be "Remove" (without ellipsis).  A long explanation is available if interested but if you look around you'll see that its usually "Delete" or "Remove".

title: 293 compile warnings in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.tests
desc: I20080323-2000  There are 293 compile warniings in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.tests. Besides

title: API Tools not finding @since tag when there is a comment in the javadoc after the tag.
desc: SWT.TRANSPARENT is being reported as missing an @since tag, but it's clearly there. If the "WARNING" comment is moved above the @since the error goes away.

title: change to x-internal in manifest file is not picked up
desc: I changed one of my packages from x-internal:false to x-internal:true (and vice versa), but the API tooling did not pick up this change - I had to go to the file in question and make a whitespace change to get updated error markers based on the x-internal setting.  We had an internal package that was marked as x-internal:false. I found this bug when I tried to fix our problem in the manifest file.

title: [api tooling] Change of interface method signature is not recognized as API breakage
desc: Build id: I20080327-2251  Baseline (1.0): interface Foo {    void foo(String s); }  Workspace (2.0): interface Foo {    /** @since 2.0 */    void foo(String s, IProgressMonitor pm); }  This change is not recognized as API breakage, i.e. the API Tooling tells me that my Manifest should not have major version increment and it also tells me that my @since tags use the wrong version.  This is a major problem IMHO because adding a method parameter is a frequent change, and one important use of API Tooling is to detect unintended API breakage. Not detecting this breakage reduces my confidence in the tool and is thus a major loss of functionality.  FYI, the real-world plugin I've been testing this on is    /cvsroot/dsdp : org.eclipse.tm.rse/plugins/org.eclipse.rse.services HEAD against TM 2.0.1 baseline. Should be very easy to reproduce since it's checked in with API Tooling enabled, it has no dependencies except eclipse.core.runtime, and the baseline can easily be downloaded from    http://download.eclipse.org/dsdp/tm/downloads/

title: Message improvements on Compatibility problems tab
desc: I thinks we could improve the following:  (1) Since we refere to Baselines instead of profiles, "API profile" section should be renamed. Perhaps we should move this to the "Bundle" category?  And do we ever detect a removed bundle/component from a profile? We only analyze projects, so if your workspace is missing a project, we don't notice :-)  (2) "Bundle > A type has been removed" should say "An API type has become non-API".

title: [api tooling] The IMember is not properly located when it is a constructor
desc: When we try to locate a constructor, the method selector should be the type name instead of <init>. This can cause all kinds of side-effects as reporting invalid @since tags since we default to the enclosing type. This will be fixed as part of bug 224713.

title: [AAP001] The source issue
desc: Build ID: I20080329  In the file: eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.ui\org\eclipse\pde\api\tools\ui\internal\markers\markermessages.properties  We came across the following:  </TWBQ>UpdateSinceTagOperation_title= Update since tag  I think that the source should be: </TWBQ>UpdateSinceTagOperation_title= Update @since tag

title: @noreference: distinguish between method and constructor
desc: 20080401  in the following code  In the Javadoc of a constructor, use code assist to add a API tooling tag '@noreference' to the constructor A.  This results in /*  * @noreference This method is not intended to be referenced by clients.  */ It would be better to have 'constructor' instead of 'method'.

title: Eclipse build Ant task should allow removed bundles to be filtered out
desc: The exclude list could also be used to filter out removed bundles like tomcat or resource.win32.

title: Should not report @since tag errors for protected members inside a class tagged as @noextend
desc: When a class is tagged with @noextend, a protected field is not "visible" for the client. Therefore the @since tag is not required.

title: Preference page does not use dialog font
desc: 3.4 RC1  - go to General > Appearence > Colors and Fonts and change the dialog font. - Close and reopen the preferences, go to the API Errors/Warnings page  Tabs and control descriptions are still shown with the default font

title: No rebuild is requested when the location of the baseline is modified
desc: Steps to reproduce: 1) Set up a project to use API tools 2) Set up a baseline to point to a 3.2.2 SDK 3) A rebuild is requested 4) let the build complete and then go to the baseline and edit it 5) Modify its location to point to a 3.3.2 SDK without updating the name (click reset to make sure that the new plugins are read). 6) Click ok and finish. 7) No rebuild is requested even if the baseline is different.

title: Translation Clarification - string concatenation problems in org.eclipse.pde.api.tools
desc: Build ID: I20080405  In this file:  eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.api.tools\org\eclipse\pde\api\tools\internal\coremessages.properties  It is extremely hard, almost impossible for other languages to translate strings that are concatenated as they must deal with problems such as noun gender.  Can a developer provide complete string sentences for the following strings?:  JavadocTagManager_class=class JavadocTagManager_extended=extended JavadocTagManager_field=field JavadocTagManager_implemented=implemented JavadocTagManager_instantiated=instantiated JavadocTagManager_interface=interface JavadocTagManager_method=method JavadocTagManager_not_intended_to_be=This {0} is not intended to be {1} by clients. JavadocTagManager_referenced=referenced JavadocTagManager_subclassed=subclassed  Thank you.

title: Error message missing arguments
desc: I created a @since tag on a member like:        @since 3.4.2  The problem message appeared like:  Invalid @since tag '3.4.2' on {1}; expecting two fragments  > Missing member name

title: Type or members with increased access can return inconsistent delta
desc: When a type is changed from package visibility to public (see org.eclipse.swt.dnd.URLTransfer), it can be seen as an added type on a full build, but it is seen as an increased access on an incremental build.  I think in both cases this is an increased access, not a type addition. The result of this increased access is the exposure of a new API type, but in this case the type itself is not new. It is simply more visible.  This leads to a missing @since tag error on full build that is not reported on incremental build. So this is confusing for the user.

title: Remove new Integer from PDE
desc: There are a number of new Integer() calls in PDE, which can be replaced with either Integer.valueOf() or Integer.parseInt() (if immediately chained via .intValue()).

title: Quick fix message is awkward
desc: If I have a @since tag as 3.3 that should be 3.4, the quick fix description says:     "Correct the version of @since tag using 3.4"  I think it should be:     "Change @since tag value to be 3.4"

title: Naming of the column in the api verification report should be improved
desc: Daniel provided some feedback for the api verification report. The naming of columns is not clear and it seems to be confusing to know what the numbers in the column represents. Daniel, any suggestions ?

title: API Verification Report does not honor API Problem filters
desc: I20080521-2000.  On the build results page the PDE API Tooling report stuff for which I added API problem filters:  jface.text: org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer illegally instantiates org.eclipse.jface.text.projection.ChildDocumentManager org.eclipse.jface.text.revisions.RevisionInformation.applyDiff(Hunk[]) has non-API parameter type org.eclipse.jface.internal.text.revisions.Hunk  ui.workbench.texteditor: org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.ITextEditorActionConstants illegally implements org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchActionConstants  ui.editors: org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.ITextEditorHelpContextIds illegally implements org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.IAbstractTextEditorHelpContextIds org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.DefaultMarkerAnnotationAccess.getAnnotationTypeHierarchy() has non-API return type org.eclipse.ui.internal.texteditor.AnnotationTypeHierarchy   The report should honor the API problem filters.  Please fix this for RC2 as I spent lots of time adding the API tooling tags and fixing the API problems and hence I don't want my plug-ins to appear on that report ;-)

title: Lots of new API errors after switching to I20080521-2000
desc: I20080521-2000  After switching to I20080521-2000 I now have tons of these: - The super interfaces set has been reduced for type ... - The superclass set has been reduced for type ...  And due to those errors it also creates an error in the manifest: - The major version should be incremented in version 3.4.0.qualifier, since API breakage occurred since version 3.3.1.r331_v2007062   Neither restart nor full build fixes it. No problems in I20080520-2000 or RC1.  Test Case: 1. start fresh workspace using I20080521-2000 2. set R3.3.1.1 as API baseline 3. checkout 'org.eclipse.jface.text' from CVS ==> lots of errors

title: Reports wrong error on correct @since 3.4 tag
desc: I20080521-2000.   With this build I get errors on @since tags that look like this:  * @since 3.4 protected (was added in 2.1 as private class)  This is wrong. Also the suggested quick fix is bogus: Change @since tag value to be 3.4 protected (was added   in 3.4 as private class) ==> it wants to change 2.1 to 3.4   The text behind @since can be anything, as specified in: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/tooldocs/windows/javadoc.html#@since  @since  since-text     Adds a "Since" heading with the specified since-text to the generated documentation. The text has no special internal structure.    It also fails when using multiple since tags like: 	 * @since 2.1 private 	 * @since 3.4 protected

title: API Verification Report: List of all non API bundles misleading
desc: I20080522-1800.  In the API Verification Report the following is a bit unclear:    List of all non API bundles  Actually it is not a list of non-API bundles but rather a list of bundles without API tooling setup.   List of bundles without installed API tooling support or  List of bundles not configured for API tooling support

title: [api tooling] Reports wrong error on correct @since 3.4 tag
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #233445 +++ I20080521-2000.  See 233445 comment 18. I would be trivial to support this case.

title: More specific implementation of a super method should not be considered as an addition
desc: From bug 225138 comment 7, one method was defined in the super class since 3.2. In 3.4, the subclass simply defines a more specific implementation of this method. Should this be seen as an API addition ?

title: binary compatible instance field addition should not be flagged as binary incompatible
desc: We added a field to JFace's CellEditor.LayoutData in 3.4. The class was not marked as @noextend (arguably it should be) and thus the API tooling reported the field addition as a binary incompatible change.  If I read "13.4.8 Field Declarations" (JLS, Third Edition) correctly, the change does not constitute a binary incompatible change.

title: Problem filter quickfix should be more descriptive
desc: Created attachment 95451 [details] Screenshot showing the quickfix proposals  Using HEAD, 1) Check out org.eclipse.jdt.ui from CVS 2) Set up the API tools (only need to set up the nature and the builder). All javadoc tags are already in place 3) Go to org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaUI.ID_TYPES_VIEW and add the final keyword. This is a breaking API change. 4) Try to do quickfix on the errors to fix them. There are two errors: addition of a constant value and addition of the final keyword, but the corresponding quickfixes are not descriptive enough to know to which error they apply. Check the screenshot.

title: Problem reporter cannot filter problems outside of the workspace
desc: Right now the problem filter is retrieving the workspace profile to get the corresponding filter store. This means it cannot work outside of the workspace. In fact it would fail with a NPE right now.  Also the fProject field should not be static as it would prevent from having two problem reporters on two different projects at the same time.

title: Externalized string has a typo
desc: The option description for added type parameter for a method has a typo. It says: A type parameters have been added.  instead of: A type parameter has been added.

title: Some compatibility options should be removed
desc: In the Enum section: - A field (enum not tagged as '@noextend') has been added - A method (enum not tagged as '@noextend') has been added  An enum type cannot be extended. There is no such restriction on an enum type.

title: Add @nooverride as a javadoc tag for javadoc generation
desc: http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/N20080412-2000/compilelogs/platform.doc.isv.javadoc.txt  Constructing Javadoc information... /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableListContentProvider.java:112: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableListContentProvider.java:124: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableSetContentProvider.java:68: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableSetContentProvider.java:97: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. /builds/N200804122000/src/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/../org.eclipse.jface.databinding/src/org/eclipse/jface/databinding/viewers/ObservableSetContentProvider.java:109: warning - @nooverride is an unknown tag. 5 warnings

title: Builder should use analyser, and create its own markers
desc: Doing some introspection on our builder while fixing bug 226745, there are a few things we could probably change.  Currently we have a problem reporter that is used for each instance of our builder, which accepts problems and once the build is done creates markers (as needed). This works well, but is not quite as flexible as we could be.   For example, if we used the notion of an analyser that could do all of the api analysis, create problems, etc. and when the build is done give the problems back to the builder to create markers (as needed). This way clients (if there are any in the future) could provide their own analyser and all we do is call it in a consistent way and create markers (if any) once the builder is done.

title: Failing tests in N20080414-2000
desc: There are 3 failing tests in N20080414-2000, all of which are in the new headless tests for the profile manager.  The problem is the tests themselves, they assume they will be run in headless mode, but in fact they might not. The tests should be changed to determine how they are being run to return the correct result.

title: Deleting equals()/hashCode() results in API error
desc: Using latest I-build:  * Delete the equals() and/or hashCode() methods from Breakpoint (org.eclipse.debug.core), and errors appear saying a method has been removed.  However, this is an inherited method and no errors should appear (I think).

title: [api tooling] @since tag error message doesn't refer to the right member
desc: When converting ecf bundles, I realized that the missing @since tags error message are always referring to the type name instead of the constructor/method/field/enum constant names. Even if the error itself is well located on the right member, it doesn't look good at all from the problem view. It is difficult to know what member has the problem.  The fix is trivial.  Darin, I would target 3.4 as this will be a common problem found by teams when they convert all their bundles to API tools.

title: Some compatibility options can be removed
desc: On our pref page for compatibility options there are some options for constructors that could be removed:  1. The keyword 'abstract' has been added (you cannot use abstract on a constructor)  2. The keyword 'static' has been added (you cannot use the keyword static on a constructor)  3. The keyword 'static' has been removed (you cannot use the keyword static on a constructor)  4. The keyword 'final' has been added (you cannot use the keyword final on a constructor)

title: API tag code assist proposals should only be available if project is under pde tooling control
desc: I2008040415-0800.  The API tag code assist proposals should only be available if project is under pde tooling control. The processor could check the nature.

title: .api_filters could not be removed
desc: I got this error only once.  org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Problems encountered while deleting files. at org.eclipse.core.internal.filesystem.local.LocalFile.delete(LocalFile.java:123) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceTree.internalDeleteFile(ResourceTree.java:302) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceTree.standardDeleteFile(ResourceTree.java:779) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.MoveDeleteHook$1.run(MoveDeleteHook.java:62) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.EclipseSynchronizer.performMoveDelete(EclipseSynchronizer.java:1710) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.MoveDeleteHook.deleteFile(MoveDeleteHook.java:57) at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.MoveDeleteManager.deleteFile(MoveDeleteManager.java:50) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.unprotectedDelete(Resource.java:1708) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.delete(Resource.java:704) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.delete(Resource.java:676) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiFilterStore$1.runInWorkspace(ApiFilterStore.java:120) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55) Contains: Could not delete: D:\eclipse\workspaces\ui_workbench\org.eclipse.jdt.core\.settings\.api_filters.  I don't have steps to reproduce, but this happened when I removed all the filters for one project and the rebuild has started immediately after.

title: 'Api Errors/Warnings > Configure Workspace Settings...' leaves wrong shell active
desc: I20080415-1646  - org.eclipse.debug.ui from CVS - open project Properties > PDE > Api Errors/Warnings - click "Configure Workspace Settings..." - close Preferences dialog => workspace window has focus, although Properties dialog is still up and modal

desc: While trying to create an api filter in a simple project with no .settings folder I got the following error:  org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource '/TestPlugin/.settings' does not exist. 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkExists(Resource.java:316) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkAccessible(Resource.java:193) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.create(File.java:119) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.create(File.java:186) 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiFilterStore$1.runInWorkspace(ApiFilterStore.java:131) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)  We should be checking if the parent folder exists before trying to create the new filter file.

Error Wed Apr 23 11:50:17 CEST 2008 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.resources".  java.lang.NullPointerException 	at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.ApiFilterStore.resourceChanged(ApiFilterStore.java:544) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:288) 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:282) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:148) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.broadcastPostChange(Workspace.java:313) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation(Workspace.java:1022) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1809) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$NotifyJob.run(NotificationManager.java:39) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: External class file folders break bundle API components
desc: The fix to PDE that supports compiling the launched workspace against the launching workspace plug-ins breaks API components that are expecting be either a binary bundle or a plug-in project. In this case we have a hybrid bundle (it is binary, but its bundle classpath is not correct).  (I have a fix in hand)

title: [api tooling] Should modify code to compile in 1.6 mode
desc: Fup of bug 228928. When compiling the api tooling code in 1.6 mode, several compile errors are reported, because the code is using String.compareTo(Object) method and this method doesn't exist anymore in 1.6. In 1.6 or 1.5 this is a bridge method so it cannot be directly invoked. We should cast the argument to String to invoke String.compareTo(String). This is what is done in the end anyway.

title: Support problem filters for API Use Scan Task
desc: Build Identifier:   The primary function of this scan is to report referenced API. However it also reports internal and illegal API references. But it doesn't allow specifying filter(s) as does the API Analysis task. Which is a problem in our headless builds as developers might set such filters in their IDE and get different results from what they will see in the automated builds API Use scans.  Reproducible: Always

title: Analyzer should work in OSGi-less mode
desc: The BaseApiAnalyzer currently requires a project to create API problems:  * required for source ranges on problems * required for @since tag validation (need source)  We should modify the analyzer to work in OSGi-less mode so it can be used by an Ant task in a releng build to generate a problem report.

title: NPE from API Analysis builder
desc: I noticed this NPE in my log sometime after updating to the latest build. Not sure how to reproduce.  java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.BundleApiComponent.getId(BundleApiComponent.java:719) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.BaseApiAnalyzer.analyzeComponent(BaseApiAnalyzer.java:158) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.build(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:612) at org.eclipse.pde.api.tools.internal.builder.ApiAnalysisBuilder.build(ApiAnalysisBuilder.java:336) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:633) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:170) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:201) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$1.run(BuildManager.java:253) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuild(BuildManager.java:256) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.basicBuildLoop(BuildManager.java:309) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.build(BuildManager.java:341) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.doBuild(AutoBuildJob.java:140) at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.run(AutoBuildJob.java:238) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: [api tooling] @since tags should not be limited to two fragments only
desc: Build ID: I20080422-0800  Here is a simple of my Javadoc comments:  /**  * opens the dialog with an optional Yes/No or OK, Details button for an  * Inquiry/Question message.  * @since 3.0 taking a boolean arg  */ public boolean openQuestionNoException(boolean showYesNo)  The intention here was to add extra information to the @since tag what changed in the particular revision of the API. I found this valuable here, since the API method itself had existed before though with a different signature; I thought that having the extra information on the @since tag would help adopters understand what changed and update their code as necessary if they are affected by the API change.  Now API tooling tells me that this is invalid, since the @since tag can only have two fragments.  Looking at the Javadoc specification, however, I read: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/windows/javadoc.html#@since  @since  since-text     Adds a "Since" heading with the specified since-text to the generated     documentation. The text has no special internal structure. [...]     This tag means that this change or feature has existed since the      software release specified by the since-text. [...] Multiple @since     tags are allowed and are treated like multiple @author tags.  I understand that API Tooling must find the bundle version identifier in  order to provide any useful service here; but wouldn't it be sufficient to use a Regex Pattern like this, to get the first n.n version in the sinceText:  private static final Pattern versionPattern =      Pattern.compile("\\s\\([0-9]+\.[0-9]+\\)\\s"; [...] Matcher m = versionPattern.matcher(sinceTagText); if (m.find()) {    String tagVersion = m.group(1); }

title: Don't require bundles to be in "plugins" directory
desc: The API baseline preference page requires bundles to be in a "plugins" folder relative to a home location. We should be more flexible, and search the "plugins" location if it exists, but otherwise allow any path to be used.

title: [api tooling] API freeze task should also check for API removals
desc: Right now the API freeze check is only checking for API addition. It should also check for API removals.
